title: My Life After Manson
description: I vividly remember entering the California Institution for Women for the first time in 2001. As the prison guard slammed the gate behind me, I wondered if I had made the right decision to become a volunteer for an inmate support group. But my nerves were eased by a woman who introduced herself as Krenny. Welcoming me into the group, she seemed quiet and insecure  yet also exuded an inner strength. I had no idea how she got here and didnt ask.

title: Abortion Providers in Texas Press Judge to Block Portions of New Law

Owners of Texas abortion clinics asked a federal judge on Monday to block enforcement of stringent new building and equipment standards, set to take effect on Sept. 1, that they say could force more than half the states remaining abortion clinics to shut down, leaving fewer than 10 across a sprawling state.

title: Ukraine Rebels Conscript Punishment Brigades for Support Work

title: A Summer of Extra Reading and Hope for Fourth Grade
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  Educators like to say that third grade is the year when students go from learning to read to reading to learn. Yet one afternoon last month, there was Anthony, a 10-year-old whose small frame was highlighted by baggy black cargo shorts, struggling with Tiny the Snow Dog, a picture book with only a handful of words per page. This is Tiny, he read to his teacher, Holly Bryant. He is my dog.

title: Down the Stretch, Whos Looking Up

It is hard to convince anyone of the need to win a division when 10 wild-card teams have reached the World Series, with five winning the championship.

title: Focusing on G.M. Unit, U.S. Starts Civil Inquiry of Subprime Car Lending
description: Federal prosecutors have begun a civil investigation into the booming business of subprime auto lending, focusing on the packaging and selling of questionable loans to investors.

title: Mississippi: Cochran Victory Is Challenged
description: State Senator Chris McDaniel filed a formal challenge on Monday to the outcome of the Republican United States Senate primary, citing evidence he said would show a pattern of conduct resulting in an improper victory for his rival, Senator Thad Cochran. Mitch Tyner, a lawyer for the McDaniel campaign, said the evidence would show that thousands of votes in the June 24 runoff were invalid, some of them cast by people who may have violated state election law by voting in the Republican runoff after having voted in the Democratic primary (there is no party registration in Mississippi, though so-called crossover voting is illegal). Mr. Tyner said he was not seeking a new election but a declaration by the state Republican executive committee that Mr. McDaniel was the winner, and he asked for a hearing within eight days. Mr. Cochran won the runoff by roughly 7,700 votes, a victory that was helped by turning out black voters who rarely participate in Republican primaries. Mr. Tyner said the McDaniel campaigns research would show that Mr. McDaniel had won by 25,000 votes.

title: The Battle of the Regimes
description: James Mwangi grew up on the slopes of the Aberdare Mountains in central Kenya. His father lost his life during the Mau Mau uprising against the colonial authorities. His mother raised seven children, making sure both the girls and the boys were well educated. Everybody in the family worked at a series of street businesses to pay the bills.

title: Difficult Decisions Ahead in Responding to Police Chokehold Homicide

The police promised better training. But now, with the medical examiners conclusion that the death was a homicide, by chokehold and chest compression, the investigation  and most significantly, the question of whether to prosecute any police officers  rests in the hands of the Staten Island district attorneys office.

That Gotham Greens butterhead is so spectacularly pretty, observed Erin Zimmer, the community engagement and partnerships manager of the New York branch of the three-year-old, Bay Area-based company that fuses the best of greenmarket shopping and C.S.A. membership with the home-delivery efficiency of FreshDirect.

title: Does Hosting the Olympics Actually Pay Off?
description: Brazil may have never wanted for places to play soccer, but that didnt stop the country from spending billions of dollars on stadiums for last months World Cup. The Arena Amazonia, a $300 million edifice designed to look like a woven basket, was built in a rain-forest city where the professional team regularly draws fewer than 2,000 fans per game. And Brazil is only getting started. The country, which is also hosting the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, has embarked on an infrastructure splurge that may top $25 billion. The spending is meant to underscore Brazils emergence as an economic power. The countrys leaders insist that its also intended to increase the nations prosperity.

description: Good morning on this hot Tuesday.

description: Evidence of excessive corporate tax avoidance keeps piling up. And so do Congresss excuses, mainly from Republicans, for not doing anything to curb it.

title: At Quake Scene, Leaders Dip in the Mud Gets Close Attention
description: Updated, 12:09 a.m. ET| Of the images that have emerged from the aftermath of the deadly earthquake that hit southwestern China on Sunday, one of the most popular has been that of a man washing his hands. The man is Premier Li Keqiang, and he isnt washing his hands just anywhere. Hes doing it in a puddle oozing with red mud.

title: The Lessons From Turkey
description: Re What Turks can teach Israel (Opinion, July 24): Mustafa Akyol misrepresents how Turkey dealt with the threat of the Kurdistan Workers Party and the lessons to be drawn from that conflicts resolution. He argues that the P.K.K. curbed violence when the Turkish state began making concessions to its demands related to Kurdish identity and autonomy. He omits that the state negotiated from a position of strength, and that its concessions came after years of responding to the group with unremitting force. The P.K.K. capitulated because it saw it could not win through violence and because it lacked sufficient backing from other countries or nonstate actors in the region.

title: Morning Views
description: As voters and lawmakers in more states decide to legalize marijuana, policy makers will have to answer a fresh and difficult question,writes Vikas Bajaj for The New York Times. How should governments regulate the production and sale of the drug? A functional regulatory system has to limit the increase in drug abuse that is likely to accompany lower prices and greater availability in a post-legalization America. First, lawmakers must institute a viable method of taxation  policies that allow licensed businesses to undercut the illegal market but keep prices high enough so dependence on the drug does not increase a lot. Second, distributors must not be permitted to market to minors: Controls should emulate the restrictions on targeting young people, banning outdoor advertising and product placements that the tobacco industry accepted as part of its settlement with the state attorney general in 1998. And finally, streams of cultivation and retail should be segregated  to avoid a similar system of juggernauts that dominates the tobacco industry. Ultimately, whatever states decide to do, it is important that they stand ready to modify policies as legal marijuana markets evolve.

title: Test Yourself | Emoji
description: Were experimenting with a new, slightly more elaborate version of our long-running English language-arts Test Yourself feature. Tell us what you think.

title: Chinese Regulators Search Daimler Offices
description: The German automobile giant Daimler has become the latest multinational company to bear the brunt of a Chinese regulatory inquiry, and an official from the agency that visited the companys offices in Shanghai said on Wednesday that it was under investigation for monopolistic behavior.

title: Luck and a Little Mystery: The Economy Grows Faster Under Democratic Presidents
description: Though I typically resist, my wife often tries to get me to put down the laptop and enjoy the Zen of gardening with her. So you can imagine her surprise when she returned from a trip to find a beautiful clump of nonwild flowers planted in her garden. She loved the welcome-home gift and was ready to bestow upon me many valuable (and increasingly elusive) good-husband points.

description: LONDON  With little more than six weeks to go before a referendum on independence for Scotland, the main British political parties promised on Tuesday to grant new devolved powers to Scots if they decide to keep their union with the rest of Britain.

description: In my posts, I occasionally take a look at businesses for sale. I find there are useful lessons for buyers and sellers in this exercise. This post looks at a reseller of industrial components.

description: LONDON  The fighting in Gaza claimed an unexpected casualty among the British political elite on Tuesday when Sayeeda Warsi, the first Muslim to serve in the British cabinet, resigned, saying the governments approach and language in the crisis had been morally indefensible.

title: Gannett, Owner of USA Today, to Split Its Print and Broadcast Businesses
description: Updated, 8:45 p.m. | The splintering of print and television companies in the media industry continued unabated on Tuesday when the Gannett Company announced that it would spin off its newspaper division, which includes USA Today, into a separate company next year.

title: Intersection | Dakars Downtown Flair
description: In downtown Dakar, Senegal, Mamadou Sow, an artist and merchant, likes to mix traditional African clothing with a European flair for Friday prayers.

title: Deep Chords: Haruki Murakamis Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage
description: A devotional anticipation is generated by the announcement of a new Haruki Murakami book. Readers wait for his work the way past generations lined up at record stores for new albums by the Beatles or Bob Dylan. There is a happily frenzied collective expectancy  the effect of cultural voice, the Murakami effect. Within seven days of its midnight release, Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage sold over one million copies in Japan. I envision readers queuing up at midnight outside Tokyo bookstores: the alienated, the athletic, the disenchanted and the buoyant. I cant help wondering what effect the book had on them, and what they were hoping for: the surreal, intra-dimensional side of Murakami or his more minimalist, realist side?

title: Subject, Meet Verb
description: Time for another exasperated reminder that a singular subject needs a singular verb, and a plural subject needs  well, you know.

title: In Performance: Stephen McKinley Henderson and Rosal Coln of Between Riverside and Crazy

In this excerpt, Walter learns that his sons girlfriend, Lulu (Ms. Coln), is pregnant. The show, directed by Austin Pendleton, continues through Aug. 23 at the Atlantic Theater Companys Linda Gross Theater.

title: Chris Bosh Takes the Basketball/Fashion Love Affair to Another Level
description: After Russell Westbrooks collaboration with Barneys; after Carmelo Anthonys many New York Fashion Week appearances, his modeling stint for Rag & Bone, and his watch blog; and after LeBron James on the cover of Vogue comes  Chris Bosh and his ties.

title: Morning Agenda: Scrutiny of Subprime Auto Loans
description: Federal prosecutors have begun a civil investigation into the booming business of subprime auto lending, focusing on the packaging and selling of questionable loans to investors, DealBooks Michael Corkery and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write. The inquiry comes amid worries among regulators that checks and standards are being neglected as the subprime auto loan market surges, in a small, yet disturbing, echo of the subprime mortgage crisis, they write.

title: Formula One Chief Bernie Ecclestone Settles Bribery Case for $100 Million
description: LONDON  Nothing in a lifetime of cutting fast deals has quite matched what the Formula One billionaire Bernie Ecclestone achieved Tuesday, when a judge in a Munich court agreed to let him pay a $100 million penalty in return for quashing a criminal case of bribery that could have sent him to jail for up to 10 years.

title: Dont Touch That Stray Hacksaw
description: Dear Diary:

title: In Hollywood, an Old Party House Is Reborn as an Intimate Luxury Hotel
description: In 2006, the developer Jacques Massachi purchased a crumbling Hollywood Victorian near the 101, intending to tear it down. But after he got his demolition permits, preservation groups approached him with several good reasons to save it. The 1904 mansion was one of only two estates remaining of the many that used to line Hollywood Boulevard and had most recently been owned and expanded by Philip and Sylvia Lombardi, who came to L.A. as vocal coaches and composers for vaudeville singers in the 1940s.

title: Tunisia Fears Attacks by Citizens Flocking to Jihad
description: TUNIS  The jihadi video out of Syria shows a line of prisoners bound and kneeling in a courtyard surrounded by dozens of civilians and armed men in a noisy hubbub. One man in fatigues paces around, jabbing his arms as he issues orders. Eventually, a burly fighter in loose, dark clothes shoots each of the half-dozen prisoners in the back of the head.

title: The Problem of Underweight Shareholders
description: Simon C.Y. Wong is a governance adviser affiliated with Northwestern University School of Law and the London School of Economics. He can be followed on Twitter: @SimonCYWong

title: Telling the Kids: Were Moving.
description: Telling my children that our family would be moving to Nashville from Atlanta, the only place theyd ever called home, gave me a new respect for my mother.

title: UniCredit Posts Higher Profit, Buoyed by Stronger Business in Russia
description: Updated, 1:47 p.m. |

title: Japan Imposes New Sanctions on Russia but Keeps a Diplomatic Door Open
description: TOKYO  Torn between maintaining solidarity with Washington and keeping a diplomatic door open with Moscow, Japan imposed new sanctions on Russia on Tuesday but kept them more limited than those recently ordered by the United States.

title: The Reversal of America's Town and Country
description: WAGNER, S.D.  Thomas Jefferson, perhaps the greatest rural snob in history, argued that cities are as useful to a republic as sores are to a human body.

title: Phosphate Memories
description: Does anyone remember this, from Erick Erickson of Red State?

title: Divers Fail to Find Bangladesh Ferry That Capsized
description: NEW DELHI  Rescue workers in Bangladesh fought against powerful currents and heavy rain on Tuesday in hopes of recovering bodies from an overloaded river ferry that had capsized and sunk just short of its destination the day before, leaving more than 120 passengers missing and presumed dead.

title: Two Decades After Pair of Killings on Long Island, Authorities Make an Arrest
description: Her body was found in a wooded area south of the Long Island Expressway in North Shirley, about 17 miles east of where she had last been seen, entering a small blue car outside the Blue Dawn Diner in Islandia.

title: A Lifetime of Looking, Magically Recovered
description: The only history you can really know is your own. The only art Im truly an expert on is art Ive experienced firsthand. As a critic, Im partly a research analyst, comparing and evaluating new data. But Im also a curator of my memory, which carries traces of art encounters from over the years. A few of those encounters  with certain objects, books, buildings  have altered the atmosphere, changed how I see and joined a permanent collection that I regularly revisit.

title: Still Failing To Fail
description: Jonathan Cohn looks at the evidence so far on health insurance premiums, and finds things not too bad:

title: 1914: German Army Attacks Lige
description: BRUSSELS  The Belgian victory on the Vesdre has assumed undreamt of proportions. Several thousand Germans were killed and wounded or taken prisoners before their hasty retreat to Dutch soil. The Prussian cavalry suffered severely. All the German assaults on the city of Lige and its forts have so far been repulsed, and the hope increases that the progress of the invaders will be arrested until the French forces come up. The German artillery is proving inefficient against the powerfully armed turrets of the Lige forts. The glorious behavior of the Belgians exceeds any dream.  The New York Herald, European Edition, August 6, 1914

title: Sliming Rick Perlstein
description: OK, this is grotesque. Rick Perlstein has a new book, continuing his awesomely informative history of the rise of movement conservatism  and hes facing completely spurious charges of plagiarism.

title: Proxy Firm Backs Ackmans Call for a Special Meeting of Botox Makers Shareholders
description: Updated, 1:41 p.m. |

title: British Watchdog Curbs High-Yield Bonds Called CoCos for Small Investors
description: LONDON  Flexing some of its new regulatory muscle, Britains Financial Conduct Authority prohibited banks on Tuesday from selling high-yield bonds called CoCos to retail investors.

title: How to Talk About Americas Newest Arrivals
description: American history is marked by periods of rapid influx of immigrants: the 1850s, the 1880s, and before and after World War I. American history is also pocked with anti-immigration action: the Know-Nothing political movement of the mid-1850s, the Chinese Exclusion Act of 1882 and the Immigration Act of 1924.

title: Whats Your Favorite Out-of-Print Book?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Adam Kirsch and Francine Prose discuss their favorite out-of-print books.

title: Cuban Loses Sight of the Role of International Play
description: Almost on cue, and not out of character, Mark Cuban took a verbal sledgehammer to the N.B.A.s participation in international competitions after the horrific injury to the Indiana Pacers Paul George last Friday as George prepared for the coming and newly billed World Cup in Spain.

title: Biogenesis Founder Surrenders to D.E.A.
description: It has been one of the longest-running dramas in professional sports and has ensnared baseball All-Stars like Alex Rodriguez, roiled the commissioners office and given anti-aging clinics a bad name.

title: British Military Jet Escorts Airliner After Bomb Threat
description: LONDON  Britains Royal Air Force scrambled a military jet to escort a Qatar Airways flight into the northern English city of Manchester on Tuesday after the pilot notified the airport that a possible device was on board, the police said.

title: This Is What an Ivy League Education Will Get You
description: Like so many kids today, I went off to college like a sleepwalker, writes William Deresiewicz in his July cover story for The New Republic, Dont Send Your Kid to the Ivy League.

title: Three on Big Bang to Get $1 Million an Episode
description: Three stars of the hit television comedy The Big Bang Theory got the big payday they were waiting for, agreeing to new three-year contracts with Warner Bros. Television worth about $1 million per episode for each actor, people familiar with the deal said Tuesday.

title: In North Carolina, From Anti-Environmentalist to Fake Green Crusader
description: Funny how one devastating coal ash spill can transform a lifelong anti-environment politician into someone masquerading as a green crusader.

title: Judge Rakoff Says 2011 S.E.C. Deal With Citigroup Can Close
description: Updated, 6:31 p.m. | The settlement that just wouldnt settle  Citigroups 2011 deal with the Securities and Exchange Commission  has finally cleared its last hurdle.

title: Rubin Museum Show to Trace Francesco Clementes Indian Inspirations
description: The Italian artist Francesco Clementes works over the past 45 years have morphed through seemingly opposing styles (conceptional and representational, for example) and have touched on the utopian, the erotic and at times the idiosyncratically grotesque. But one current that runs through much of his painting and sculpture has been the influence of Indian culture, mythology, symbolism and art.

title: Rosetta Spacecraft Set for Unprecedented Close Study of a Comet
description: After 10 years and four billion miles, the European Space Agencys Rosetta spacecraft will arrive at its destination on Wednesday for the first extended, close examination of a comet.

title: Anatomy of a Power Grab
description: Since my Sunday column was a little on the shrill side, accusing President Obama of contemplating domestic policy caesarism on immigration policy, I thought Id do a follow-up addressing the various, maybe you should calm down objections.

title: Open to Both Sides, Homeland Security Chief Steps Into Immigration Divide
description: WASHINGTON  Shortly after Jeh Johnson was confirmed as secretary of the Department of Homeland Security, he invited the flamboyant antiwar protesters from Code Pink to his new office to chat about national security and immigration.

title: White House Weighs Actions to Deter Overseas Tax Flight
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is weighing plans to circumvent Congress and act on its own to curtail tax benefits for United States companies that relocate overseas to lower their tax bills, seeking to stanch a recent wave of so-called corporate inversions, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew said on Tuesday.

title: Atlanta Hospital Admits Second American With Ebola
description: ATLANTA  The North Carolina missionary who contracted the Ebola virus while working in Liberia arrived in Georgia on Tuesday and joined another aid worker in the specialized isolation ward of a hospital here.

title: Conservatives See Potential in Tennessee Judicial Race
description: FRANKLIN, Tenn.  When Tennessee voters in 2006 last had to decide whether Justice Cornelia A. Clark of the State Supreme Court should remain on the bench, she did not raise or spend any money for a campaign. She still won 74 percent of the vote.

title: Today in Small Business: Is Entrepreneurship in Decline?
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Maybe Theres a Whole Other Internet
description: Is it too late to nominate a candidate for novel of the summer?

title: A Festival of One-Acts Illuminates Souls in Trouble
description: The worst thing was to indulge you, the woman ruefully tells her disheveled son, who, at 25, is still incapable of making his way in the world. If she werent there to stop him, Corey would spend his days playing Minecraft on his laptop.

title: Nantucket Fisherman Finds a Digital Lifeline for His Fading Livelihood
description: This is the story of what happens when an heir to the hotbed of American ingenuity in the 18th century  Nantucket, Mass.  intersects with a locus of American entrepreneurship in the 21st century  the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn  to create a mostly happy tale about preserving an old-fashioned way of life.

title: Conan Doyle Estate Told to Pay Legal Fees
description: Updated, 1:52 p.m. | A federal court has ordered the estate of Arthur Conan Doyle to pay $30,679.93 in legal fees to the plaintiff in a successful copyright challenge, calling its practice of demanding licensing fees for use of the character Sherlock Holmes a form of extortion with no legal basis.

title: A New Report Argues Inequality Is Causing Slower Growth. Heres Why It Matters.
description: Is income inequality holding back the United States economy? A new report argues that it is, that an unequal distribution in incomes is making it harder for the nation to recover from the recession and achieve the kind of growth that was commonplace in decades past.

title: N.Y.U. to Add a Bachelors Degree in Video Game Design
description: If youre a high school student with more Call of Duty matches on your rsum than community service in Myanmar, a new degree program at New York University might appeal to you.

title: U.N. Reports Dire Impact on Children in Gaza Strip
description: GENEVA  As a 72-hour cease-fire took hold in the Gaza Strip, a United Nations official said Tuesday that Israels nearly monthlong offensive against Hamas, the militant Islamist organization that runs Gaza, had had a catastrophic and tragic impact on children in the territory and that reconstruction would require many hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: Japanese Researcher, an Author of a Discredited Stem Cell Study, Is Dead
description: A leading Japanese life science researcher and co-author of a stem cell study that was later retracted because of errors and allegations of misconduct has taken his own life, his colleagues said on Tuesday.

title: Why We Should Know the Price of Medical Tests
description: One of the common arguments against mandating or providing upfront prices for medical tests and procedures is that American patients are not very skilled consumers of health care and will assume high prices mean high quality.

title: Sofia Coppolas Latest Project: A Look Book for a New Line of California Casual Wear
description: Sofia Coppola has long acted as muse to marquee fashion designers like Marc Jacobs and Karl Lagerfeld (she interned at Chanel as a teenager). She has also directed commercials for Diors fragrance Miss Dior. Now the director of the upcoming live-action adaptation of The Little Mermaid is lending her talent to a lesser-known name:Calder, a made-in-L.A. label started last year by her cousin-in-law Amanda Blake. Coppola recently shot the look book for Calders fall/winter 2014 collection, a series of soft jersey tees, tanks and T-shirt dresses whose easygoing aesthetic dovetails with Coppolas own. I tried to show the line how I would wear it, says Coppola, who shot the images in her New York apartment so as to feel intimate and basic. The results have the same warm, personal quality as Coppolas films. I just tried to show the clothes in a way that felt real.

title: 1964: Russians Warn of Broad War
description: MOSCOW  The Soviet Union tonight warned that further American rash steps in Vietnam could lead to a broad armed conflict. In a statement by the Tass news agency, the Russians called American action an aggressive act. Such actions, or further steps or provocations, could lead to broad conflict with all the ensuing dangerous consequences, Tass said. It added that the responsibility would lie on the United States. The statement was issued after a day in which Soviet news media refrained from comment, reporting only what American and North Vietnamese sources were announcing.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 6, 1964

title: Murakami as Inspiration
description: Yuko Shimizu, whose illustration accompanies the review of Haruki Murakamis novel Colorless Tsukuru Tazaki and His Years of Pilgrimage on the cover of the Book Review, explains her process.

title: Summer Reading Winner, Week 6 | I Will Always Be What I Am: A Precrastinator
description: Weve been judging this contest for five summers now, so we know that the later in the season it gets, the more entries there are each week, and therefore, the tougher the competition.

title: Behind a Mysterious Advertisement, an Ecuadorean Banana Moguls Legal Battle
description: The simple black-and-white advertisement, addressed to whom it may concern in all capitals, had a taunting, catch-me-if-you-can tone. The author said he could be served legal papers only in his native Ecuador and only in person.

title: 2 Duck Goose Opens in Brooklyn
description: Headliner

title: Man on Trial Over Killing on His Porch Speaks of Night Filled With Fear
description: DETROIT  On the November night that he fatally shot an unarmed young woman on his front porch, Theodore P. Wafer was jolted from his sleep in a living-room recliner by a banging noise so violent, he told a courtroom here on Tuesday, that he was sure that someone  or some people  would be breaking into his house within seconds.

title: Mini Bell Peppers Stuffed with Goat Cheese
description: My oldest brother, Dan, and his wife, Margaret, hosted a wonderful party in Minneapolis in May to celebrate their 50th anniversary. The savory food on the gorgeous vegetarian buffet was catered by the well-known Minneapolis restaurant Lucias, whose chef/owner, Lucia Watson, is a friend of the family. One of my favorite items was minipeppers stuffed with goat cheese, the inspiration for this recipe. Mini sweet peppers have begun to proliferate in supermarkets; the ones Im finding come in 12-ounce bags, roughly 12 to a bag (though they range in size, some being about two inches long, others about three), usually a mix of red and yellow. They are thin skinned, with very small seedpods and membranes. I roast them briefly to soften them and sweeten the flavor. There is no need to peel them, and they should not be roasted so long that the skin loosens. You will probably have a little filling left over, but its nice as a spread so it wont go to waste.

title: New Foundation Will Support, and Commission, American Music
description: Lawrence A. Johnson, a Chicago music critic, got tired of complaining that musical organizations were not performing enough American music and decided to do something about it. Mr. Johnson, the founder of The Classical Review, a group of websites with Chicago, Boston, New York and Florida editions, has spent the last few months putting together plans and raising support for a new venture, the American Music Project a nonprofit foundation that hopes to put a brighter spotlight on the American repertory, old and new, and to commission new works.

title: Gannett Could Have Given More Help to Its Print Spinoff
description: Gannett is redefining the digital divide. The media conglomerate unveiled plans on Tuesday to spin off newspapers, including USA Today, to showcase the value of its broadcasting operations. At the same time, the company will take control of the parent of Cars.com, paying $1.8 billion for the 73 percent it doesnt already own. Instead of using that online asset to buffer the weaker half, however, Gannett is forcing print to stand on its own.

title: In a San Juan Neighborhood, an International Arts Festival
description: The Santurce neighborhood was once a forgotten part of San Juan, P.R. But something has stirred in the barrio where at night, gunfire isnt an unfamiliar sound. It started with the artists.

title: Perfect Shrimp, Every Time
description: Kim Severson buys fresh local shrimp and then shows how to turn them into scampi.

title: Grilled Peppers with Garlic Yogurt
description: This is a typical Turkish way to use grilled peppers. Turkish cuisine features cool, garlicky yogurt with warm vegetables. You can use a mix of peppers for this (in Turkey, longish, thin-skinned green peppers are the norm), and you dont have to stick to sweet peppers, though I prefer the sweet against the pungent yogurt.

title: Grilled Pepper Omelet
description: I often make the classic Basque piprade, eggs scrambled with stewed peppers and tomatoes. This time, I kept it a little simpler and used my roasted peppers to fill an omelet. I added chopped, fresh herbs and a little bit of Parmesan to the mix. If your peppers are already roasted (I had plenty on hand as Id been working with roasted peppers all week) this is a 2- to 5-minute dinner. As always, the better the eggs (farm-fresh, pastured), the better the omelet.

title: Fords European Van Gets a Makeover for America
description: Its no secret that the classic American van is on its way out. Since the late 1960s, most full-size van models have been trucklike vehicles with stubby noses, long bodies and relatively low-profile front windshields. The General Motors G-Series and Dodge Ram vans are already gone.

title: Tig Notaro Among Highlights of New York Comedy Festival
description: Tig Notaros Boyish Girl Interrupted show is one of the highlights of the 2014 edition of the New York Comedy Festival, the festival announced on Tuesday. The 2014 edition of the festival, which is presented in association with Comedy Central, will run five days, Nov. 5-9, with competing shows at halls all around Manhattan, leaving comedy fans to make some serious choices.

title: Should Literature Be Relatable?
description: The word relatable has become as vexed as it is common. Its critics sometimes argue that to seek relatable art is to take the easy way out, to refuse to venture outside ones own sphere of experience. But for some, finding art that speaks to that experience may be anything but easy.

title: In New Jersey, Launching Pads for Same-Day Shipments
description: LINDEN, N.J.  On a recent morning here, construction workers were installing the concrete floor of a warehouse that spans the length of three and a half football fields. Work is nearly complete on the 495,000-square-foot facility, yet the developer, Duke Realty, does not have a tenant to lease it.

title: As the Seasons Change, So Do the Pastries
description: To Serve: Mark Each Month With a Fruity Tart

title: The Dainty Jewelry the Fashion Set Is Wearing Right Now
description: While the unofficial ladies uniform here at T consists mostly of comfortable flats and boyish silhouettes, the staffs jewelry choices fall on the opposite end of the style spectrum: the pieces are pretty and dainty. And where stones are concerned, there are few options more ladylike than pearls. As charming as grandmas hand-me-downs can be, modern fine jewelers such as Sophie Bille Brahe and Ana Khouri offer fresh takes on the classic jewelry box staple, as seen in Ts Culture 2014 issue. Here, Ts womens fashion team rounds up similar designs with real pearls, at a price that wont break the bank.

title: Alfresco, a Passionate Loner Beckons
description: Some choreography seems to shrink on an outdoor stage, dwarfed by open space. The opposite was true on Friday at the Damrosch Park Bandshell at Lincoln Center, where the Paul Taylor Dance Company presented three works as part of Lincoln Center Out of Doors. The open-air setting, depending on the piece, served either to free up Mr. Taylors movement or complement its inherent freedom; his work contains equal measures of tension and effervescence. In all three dances  Fibers (1961), Aureole (1962) and Piazzolla Caldera (1997)  the company looked ripe, expansive, ready for anything.

title: San Antonio Spurs Hire Becky Hammon as N.B.A.s First Female Full-Time Coach
description: Becky Hammon, who is retiring this month from a 16-season playing career in the W.N.B.A., will join the San Antonio Spurs as an assistant coach next season, the N.B.A. team announced Tuesday.

title: Unmasking the Mystery Mac Spell-Checker
description: Q. On my Mac, I use a variant of Gmail adopted by my former employer with only slight customized differences. I have searched in vain for a way to turn off the email spell-checking program because it ruins messages in foreign languages by changing many words unnecessarily. Is there a way to stop spell-check?

title: Walgreens Said to Consider an Tax Inversion-Free Merger With Alliance Boots
description: Updated, 8:43 p.m. | The Walgreen Company is said to be near a deal to take over the British pharmacy retailer Alliance Boots, but through a plan to do so without moving its corporate headquarters abroad.

title: U.S. General Killed in Afghanistan
description: A Pentagon spokesman, Rear Adm. John F. Kirby, said that a suspected Afghan soldier shot up to 15 people, including an American general who was killed, at a military training academy in Kabul.

title: Indian TV Crew Shows Rare Video of Rocket Launch From Gaza
description: Shortly before a cease-fire went into effect in Gaza on Tuesday morning, a crew from Indias NDTV captured rare footage of Islamist militants quietly preparing to fire a rocket at Israel from a densely populated area of the Palestinian territory.

title: Excerpt: King Lear
description: John Lithgow and Annette Bening in a scene from the Shakespeare in the Park production at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: A Start-Up Helps Towns Market Their Property
description: Two public policy graduates at the Kennedy School at Harvard University are trying to build a business of helping municipalities with a task at which they are notoriously deficient: managing and marketing their real estate portfolios.

title: 2 Tourist Buses Collide in Times Square, Injuring at Least 15
description: Two double-decker buses collided in Times Square on Tuesday, with one hurtling into a crowded plaza, injuring at least 15 people and sending scores more scurrying to safety, the authorities said.

title: In Dallas, Turning the Page Marked Nov. 22, 1963
description: For decades Oak Cliff was considered one of Dallass worst neighborhoods, a place of clapboard homes and vacant lots whose seedy reputation as a haunt of Bonnie and Clyde was eclipsed on Nov. 22, 1963, when it became forever linked to Lee Harvey Oswald and the assassination of John F. Kennedy. After the shooting of Americas 35th president, Dallas turned away from Oak Cliff as if in shame and grew north, leaving the area to the poor and new immigrants.

title: Suds, Scents and Soup in San Franciscos Tenderloin
description: Long an enclave of drug dealing, soup kitchens and S.R.O.s, but also live theater, Asian immigrant families and bargain Vietnamese restaurants, the Tenderloin remains a mean-streets anomaly in a city awash in tech dollars. These days, lured by a cache of handsome historic architecture, a central location and moderate rents (at least compared with stratospheric prices elsewhere in San Francisco), pioneering galleries, small performance venues, niche boutiques and trendy watering holes are joining the mix, drawing young urbanites to this neighborhood southwest of the upscale Union Square shopping district.

title: Some Israelis Count Open Discourse and Dissent Among Gaza War Casualties
description: JERUSALEM  The signs are everywhere.

title: Russian Hackers Amass Over a Billion Internet Passwords
description: A Russian crime ring has amassed the largest known collection of stolen Internet credentials, including 1.2 billion user name and password combinations and more than 500 million email addresses, security researchers say.

title: After Pushback, Murdoch Abandons Foxs Pursuit of Time Warner
description: Updated, 9:12 p.m. | At 4:07 p.m. Tuesday, the chief executive of Time Warner Inc., Jeffrey L. Bewkes, received an unexpected email.

title: Cooking With the Locals
description: MAYPORT, Fla.  If there were such a thing as a national shrimp intervention, this may be a perfect moment for it.

title: What Paul George Can Teach Youth Basketball League Players
description: Last Friday, Paul George, a star for the Indiana Pacers, suffered a horrific leg injury while playing in a scrimmage for Team USA. You can find the video online, but pictures of his teammates reacting might be easier to handle if youve got a queasy stomach. Thankfully, for his financial security, George had recently signed a five-year contract extension worth $91 million. But the terms season-ending and career-jeopardizing are being tossed about.

title: Gains Under Health Law Show What Is Possible for Other Poor States
description: Weve seen a few polls now that have demonstrated a real, measurable drop in the number of Americans who lack health insurance since the Affordable Care Acts major provisions kicked in this January. Now we finally have a picture of whats happening at the state level.

title: Ismael Leyva
description: Mr. Leyva, 62, is the president and founder of Ismael Leyva Architects, a New York firm whose projects worldwide have included the design of the residences at Time Warner Center. He is designing the interiors of two apartment buildings in Hudson Yards.

title: Disneys Third-Quarter Profits Soar, on Marvels Back
description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Company said on Tuesday that its quarterly profit totaled $2.25 billion, a 22 percent increase from the year-ago period, helped in large part by the success of its Marvel franchise.

title: Wheelies: The Takata, Continued Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: How to Keep Data Out of Hackers Hands
description: For people worried about identity theft and privacy, the discovery by Hold Security of a giant database of stolen data is highly personal. But there are steps everyone can take to minimize the hackers impact.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: An American Ramen Master
description: Years from now, when PBS runs its six-part documentary about David Chang, Roy Choi and the other American chefs who over the last decade have cracked open Asian cooking traditions and hosed down the pieces with pork fat, I hope an episode will be devoted to the triple pork triple garlic mazemen at Ivan Ramen.

title: Cease-Fire Takes Hold in Gaza as Israel Says Troops Are Out
description: As a 72-hour truce mediated by Egypt began, Israel said it had withdrawn its forces and Hamas said it would join in talks to keep the peace.

title: Millet and Red Pepper Polenta
description: One thing I like best about this savory polenta is that if you do have leftovers, you can reheat them or grill them for quick meals, or even eat the leftovers cold. Take them to work or pack them in a lunchbox. I have made this dish two ways: In the first, shown here, roasted peppers are stirred into the millet halfway through. In the second version, peppers and onions are sauted with garlic.

title: Languid, Meandering and Clearly Abetted by Satan
description: In earlier times, the talent of Martin Frost would have attracted suspicion. Like that of Paganini, whom contemporaries suspected to be in cahoots with the Devil: How else to explain his wizardry on the violin, which surpassed everyone else in technique and brilliance?

title: Like a Jazz Band, but 18th Century
description: The choreographer Mark Morris calls the Philharmonia Baroque Orchestra the car that parks itself. This week it pulls into Lincoln Center to perform two early Handel operas at the Mostly Mozart Festival: the English masque Acis and Galatea, fully choreographed with singers sharing the stage with dancers from the Mark Morris Dance Group, and a concert version of Teseo, a flamboyant castrato vehicle in which the composer merged elements of Italian and French Baroque style. At the steering wheel: Nicholas McGegan, the British conductor and Baroque music expert who has led this period-instrument ensemble for 29 years and, in the process, turned it into the pre-eminent early-music group on the West Coast.

title: Its an Itch That Cant Be Clicked
description: In the course of procrastinating over a deadline  I mean conducting research for this review  I typed Is Internet addiction real into a Google window and received 29 million results and no conclusive answer. Some experts think the addiction model fits compulsive, time-sucking online behavior perfectly, while others are skeptical. After a while, I stopped reading to check for Twitter updates and take a quiz or two, but two hours later, Im not ready to admit that I have a problem.

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Keeping Confidential Personal Data Out of Hackers Hands
description: The numbers sound abstract: hundreds of millions of email addresses and other types of personal identification found in the hands of Russian hackers.

title: Senator Pat Roberts Beats Tea Party Challenger in Kansas
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Pat Roberts of Kansas held off the Tea Party insurgent Milton Wolf on Tuesday to defeat what may have been hard-line conservatives last chance at knocking off an incumbent Republican senator this year.

title: New Buying Strategy as Facebook and Google Transform Into Web Conglomerates
description: Facebook, Google and other Internet titans have been busy transforming themselves into web conglomerates, making fortunes for the venture capital industry. But is it good for everyone else?

title: Met Opera Foresees a Rise in Annual Deficit
description: The Metropolitan Opera, which is in the midst of tense labor negotiations that are threatening the coming season, said in afinancial disclosure filinglast week that its deficit in the fiscal year that ended July 31 would be significantly larger than the $2.8 million gap it reported the year before.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza City and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza City, Israel, Lebanon and Ukraine.

title: A Filmmakers Long-Running Journey, Dense With Details and Full of Characters
description: Its not me talking, its my character. Thats how Samuel Fuller responded to critics  for example, J. Edgar Hoover  who objected to the sketches of American lowlifes, mad men, racists and cynical soldiers in his thrillingly alive films. A shaky labor of love, A Fuller Life repays this filmmakers empathy by letting him have his say from beyond the grave through excerpts from his autobiography.

title: Cease-Fire Takes Hold in Gaza as Israel Says Troops Are Out
description: As a 72-hour truce mediated by Egypt began, Israel said it had withdrawn its forces and Hamas said it would join in talks to keep the peace.

title: Investing Losers in Bailout of Portuguese Lender Banco Esprito Santo
description: Late last year, with the bond market frenzy for risky euro-zone banks in full swing, Banco Esprito Santo, the failed Portuguese lender, issued a 750 million offering of junior bonds.

title: To Revive a Genre, Zombies and Snow
description: LOS ANGELES  Call it When Harry Potter Met Sally.

title: Target Puts Data Breach Costs at $148 Million, and Forecasts Profit Drop
description: Target, still feeling the pain from a huge data breach last year, said in a security filing on Tuesday that costs associated with the episode reached $148 million in the second quarter.

title: Learning Lear': Places, Please, for Opening Night
description: John Lithgow, a Tony-winning actor and writer, has been regularly blogging on ArtsBeat during rehearsals and preview performances of King Lear for Shakespeare in the Park.

title: Q. and A.: Jen Lin-Liu on Noodles and Their Origins
description: While the legend that Marco Polo introduced pasta to Italy from China in the 13th century has become one of the most debunked myths of our time, the origins of pasta, known elsewhere as noodles, have for years eluded historians.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: Reducing Carbon by Curbing Population
description: Remember the population explosion?

title: Yes, We Invited Snoop Dogg to Visit The New York Times
description: Earlier today, Andrew Rosenthal, David Firestone and Juliet Lapidos took questions on Reddit about High Time, an editorial series which called for an end to the federal ban on marijuana. During the AMA  Ask Me Anything in Reddit parlance  the trio had an unexpected questioner drop in: the rapper and reggae artist, Snoop Dogg.

title: Scene City: Diving Into Social Waters
description: James Camerons Deepsea Challenge 3D had its premiere at the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Inside Top40, the Hottest Underground Party in L.A.
description: Meghan Edwards is gyrating atop a speaker box to the thumping music played by Max D, a Baltimore house D.J. who has come to Los Angeles to play Top40, the pop-up party Edwards has been throwing intermittently since February. The setting is a converted bowling alley in Highland Park called Mr. Ts. When Edwards strips off her shirt to go topless, it doesnt seem out of the ordinary. Everyone keeps grooving on the dance floor. It wouldnt be Top40 if things didnt get a little sloppy.

title: Readers Questions About Children Who Beat Autism
description: In last weekends magazine, Ruth Padawer wrote about children who shed their autism symptoms in response to applied behavioral analysis. Readers were invited to submit questions to Padawer about the article. Here are her responses:

title: Beyond Time Warner, Rupert Murdochs Greatest Misses
description: In the deal-making annals of Rupert Murdoch, the victories may be better-remembered than the defeats. But Mr. Murdoch, whose 21st Century Fox said on Tuesday that it would withdraw its $80 billion bid for Time Warner, has suffered his share of disappointments.

title: Photos From Both Sides of the Gaza Conflict
description: Two photographers, an Israeli and a Palestinian, described how they cover the current conflict.

title: Times Readers Online Make Their Own Cases for Legalizing Marijuana
description: WE learned something about New York Times online commenters recently: They are far, far more supportive of marijuana legalization than the average American.

title: The Use of Antibiotics in Farm Animals
James Bradys Legacy: The Campaign for Gun Control
description: To the Editor:

title: For Kurdish Independence
description: To the Editor:

title: Remembering World War I
description: To the Editor:

title: Revitalizing the South Street Seaport
Mexican Congress Approves New Rules for Oil Industry
description: MEXICO CITY  Mexicos Congress approved on Tuesday a sweeping overhaul of the energy industry that cleared the way for international giants to tap Mexicos rich reserves of oil and gas.

title: Sprint and SoftBank End Their Pursuit of a T-Mobile Merger
description: Sprint and its corporate parent, the Japanese telecommunications giant SoftBank, have decided to drop their pursuit of T-Mobile US after conceding that antitrust regulators would block a deal in an industry that is dominated by just a few large players, a person briefed on the matter said on Tuesday.

title: WeWork Joins Etsy in Dumbo Heights Buildings
description: WeWork, the Manhattan-based co-working company, is set to open its first Brooklyn outpost in one of five beige warehouses near the Brooklyn Bridge that were once the headquarters of Jehovahs Witnesses.

title: Jets to Keep Pryor Out of Colts Game
description: CORTLAND, N.Y.  Safety Calvin Pryor, who missed nine days with a concussion before returning to practice on Monday, will not play in the Jets preseason opener Thursday night against Indianapolis. Coach Rex Ryan said that he did not want to thrust Pryor, the teams first-round pick in May, into a game situation so soon after being cleared for contact.

title: Farmers Market Values
description: For most of us, theres no better place to buy fruits and vegetables than at a farmers market. Period. The talk about high prices isnt entirely unjustified, but it can be countered, and Ill get to that in a minute.

title: Secret Papers Describe Size of Terror Lists Kept by U.S.
description: WASHINGTON  About 20,800 United States citizens and permanent residents are included in a federal government database of people suspected of having links to terrorism, of whom about 5,000 have been placed on one or more watch lists, newly disclosed documents show.

title: Venture Capitalists Coddle Entrepreneurs as Royalty
description: A trip to an island resort by seaplane. Exclusive soirees with business titans and celebrities. An offer to share in investment profits, with no need to put capital at risk.

title: Tony Blair Has Used His Connections to Change the World, and to Get Rich
description: LONDON  Not long after stepping down as prime minister in 2007, Tony Blair had drinks at a hotel overlooking the River Thames with Paul Kagame, Rwandas president. Mr. Blair was planning a charity that would embed Western experts in finance and government in African state ministries, and he said he wanted to begin in Rwanda.

title: Russia Moves to Deport Wife of an Activist
description: MOSCOW  Russias Federal Migration Service moved to deport the American wife of a high-profile human rights lawyer living in St. Petersburg on Tuesday, labeling her a threat to national security.

title: The Value of Political Corruption
description: Americans have been pretty cynical about politics since at least Vietnam and Watergate. And key reforms that conservatives sought for decades and finally achieved have done nothing to quiet public distrust of the political class.

title: Utah Officials Ask Justices to Hear Appeal of Ruling on Gay Marriage Ban
description: Utah officials on Tuesday asked the Supreme Court to hear their appeal of a ruling striking down their states ban on same-sex marriage, which voters adopted in 2004. The appeal is the first of several in same-sex marriage cases likely to reach the Supreme Court in coming months, and the justices may agree to hear one or more of them this fall, with a decision by next June. The choice for the Supreme Court, the officials petition said, comes down to this: thousands of couples are unconstitutionally being denied the right to marry, or millions of voters are being disenfranchised of their vote to define marriage.

title: Alex Rodriguez Tries a New Legal Approach: Conciliation
description: In his most recent public outburst, Alex Rodriguez was seen pounding his hand on a table and storming out of an arbitration hearing before heading to downtown Manhattan, lawyer by his side, to vent his anger to a radio talk-show host.

title: Stop the C.I.A. Spin on the Senate Torture Report
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.  THE Senate Intelligence Committee will soon release key sections of its report on the Central Intelligence Agencys detention and interrogation of terrorism suspects after 9/11. In remarks on Friday anticipating the reports release, which he has publicly supported, President Obama acknowledged that we tortured some folks.

title: Long Island Weather Observer Sets U.S. Record With 84-Year Streak
description: BRIDGEHAMPTON, N.Y.  Richard G. Hendrickson dials a certain telephone number by 10 a.m. every day. Bridgehampton, he says into the receiver. Good morning.

title: As U.S. Speeds the Path to Deportation, Distress Fills New Family Detention Centers
description: After declaring the surge of Central American migrants crossing the border a humanitarian crisis, the Obama administration has shifted sharply to a strategy of deterrence, moving families to isolated facilities and placing them on a fast track for deportation to send a blunt message back home that those caught entering illegally will not be permitted to stay.

title: Federal Reserve and F.D.I.C. Fault Big Banks Living Wills
description: Congresss overhaul of the financial system aims to reshape large banks so that if they get into trouble they can descend into an orderly bankruptcy that does not set off a wider panic.

title: Spinal Issues Loom Over the N.F.L.
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  When Giants running back David Wilson left the practice field with a neck injury recently, his teammate Jameel McClain instantly reached out to him.

title: Vatican Ends Suspension of Nicaraguan Priest
description: Nearly 30 years after his suspension from the Roman Catholic priesthood, Nicaraguas former foreign minister, the Rev. Miguel F. dEscoto Brockmann will be allowed to say Mass again.

title: Snapshots From Israel
description: The sometimes surreal impressions of everyday life in wartime.

title: Michael Phelps Is Back, and Everyone Is Watching
description: IRVINE, Calif.  Midway through the Olympic quadrennium is usually when the decorated veterans stir to life after their post-Games hibernation. After two years of living off their Olympic successes, their hunger to compete on the worlds stage returns and snaps them out of their training languor.

title: Police Union President Denies Choke Hold
description: The president of the Patrolmens Benevolent Association, Patrick J. Lynch, said that actions taken by police officers to subdue a Staten Island man, who later died, did not constitute as a choke hold.

title: Dear Guests
description: KIBBUTZ EIN HASHLOSHA, Israel  At 6:02 a.m. on Saturday, the air raid siren sounded over Tel Aviv. I was rousted by the hotel staff from my room and ushered into the windowless service elevator area with two French families, everyone in their pajamas. After 10 minutes, when the Hamas missile threat had passed, we were allowed to go back to our rooms. As I slipped back into bed, the hotel loudspeaker bellowed, Dear guests, you may return to your routine.

title: No Charges for Rikers Officers in 2012 Beatings of 2 Inmates
description: Even on the most violent cellblocks at Rikers Island, the beatings were astonishing in their severity. Two inmates were strapped to gurneys, taken to a clinic in a mental health unit and beaten so badly by correction officers that blood splattered the walls and witnesses described feeling sick to their stomachs.

title: A Modest Proposal
description: WASHINGTON  Enough with all the phony impeachment talk.

title: CBS Talks With James Corden About Replacing Craig Ferguson
description: CBS has held talks with the British actor and comedian James Corden about succeeding Craig Ferguson as the host of The Late Late Show.

title: Arrest by Israel in Abduction of 3 Youths Is Made Public
description: JERUSALEM  Israel arrested a Palestinian last month accused of being the prime mover in the kidnapping and murder of three Israeli teenagers in June, it emerged from court papers on Tuesday. The abduction set off the most recent conflict with Hamas in Gaza.

title: Youth Movement Sways Golf Landscape
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Phil Mickelson does not need to be told that a younger brigade of pro golfers is overtaking its elders, a group marching methodically  like Father Time  to surpass an earlier generation of champions.

title: The Extremist Threat to Iraq Grows
description: Alarming new military advances by Sunni extremists have finally forced Iraqs disastrous prime minister, Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, to put the future of his country over his political disputes. On Monday, he ordered the Iraqi air force to support Kurdish forces battling to prevent extremists from taking even more territory and further threatening Iraqs existence as a sovereign state.

title: Senator Denounces Redactions of Report on C.I.A. Detention Program
description: WASHINGTON  The chairwoman of the Senate Intelligence Committee said on Tuesday that heavy censorship by the Obama administration of her committees voluminous report on the C.I.A.s detention program eliminates or obscures key facts buttressing the documents conclusions, and pledged to fight for more of it to be declassified.

title: A Culture of Violence at Rikers Island
description: A much-anticipated investigation by the Justice Department has uncovered what amounted to a chamber of horrors at Rikers Island, where teenagers were beaten and battered for minor infractions by correction officers who acted without fear of discovery or punishment by senior officials. The report, released on Monday by Preet Bharara, the United States attorney in Manhattan, documents a deep-seated culture of violence that demands immediate remedial action by New York City, which is now at risk of facing a federal lawsuit if it does not take the steps outlined in the report  which wisely calls for removing adolescents from the jail complex altogether.

title: N.C.A.A. May Let Top Conferences Play by Own Rules
description: The universities with the countrys most prominent athletics programs are expected to gain preliminary approvalThursday to break away from some of the strictures of the N.C.A.A., a significant change that would give them more freedom to govern themselves and could allow athletes to share in the wealth of college sports.

title: In Virginia Graft Case, Cognac and Golf Trips Arent Smoking Guns
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Seven days into their corruption trial, former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia and his wife, Maureen, have been portrayed as venal and grasping, eager to star in their own episode of Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous while struggling to get by on the governors income as a public servant.

title: BuzzFeed Hires Greg Coleman as President
description: BuzzFeed announced Tuesday that it had appointed Greg Coleman, a former advertising technology executive who had also been chief revenue officer for The Huffington Post, as its new president.

title: Can the U.S. Still Be a Leader in the Middle East?
British Bank Standard Chartered Faces Action, Again, by New York State
description: Standard Chartered is living the Wall Street version of Groundhog Day.

title: Two Fatal Police Encounters, but Just One Video
description: In a photograph shown in court, the lids of the dead mans left eye were held open by fingers in a yellow glove. Around the white of his eye was a bright red ring left by tiny blood vessels that had burst as he was dying.

title: Grocery Chain Reels as Employees and Customers Rally for an Ousted President
description: TEWKSBURY, Mass.  With a crippling job action enveloping the New England supermarket chain Market Basket for a third week, the companys board is conducting round-the-clock negotiations with its former president  and others  in search of a deal that will quell the turmoil.

title: Putin Urges Economic Retaliation for Sanctions Over Ukraine Conflict
description: MOSCOW  Russia should retaliate against the economic sanctions being imposed on the country over the Kremlins Ukraine policy, President Vladimir V. Putin said Tuesday. His was the strongest endorsement yet for calls in Russia to ban everything from major Western accounting firms to overflights by European airlines to frozen American chickens.

title: Queens Couple Are Charged in Severe Abuse of Daughter
description: A Queens couple have been charged with beating and starving their 12-year-old daughter for more than a year, the authorities said on Tuesday.

title: Sharper Than Serpents Teeth
description: And it started out as such a lovely evening.

title: Summer Event
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  Will Shortz makes a good point below about salting a grid with some of the high-value Scrabble letters to increase the excitement of the solve and the freshness of the fill, as long as those jazzy (34-point) words dont take away from the quality of the fill. I agree with him.

title: A Part of Hamas Negotiates, and Another May Fight Again
description: CAIRO  Battered by a month of Israeli assaults on its fighters, rockets and tunnels, the militant Palestinian group Hamas is turning its attention to surviving the peace.

title: Handling of New York Chokehold Cases Disappointing, Review Board Chief Says
description: The new head of New York Citys police oversight board faulted the Police Department on Tuesday for its handling of officers found to have used chokeholds  a banned tactic that the medical examiner said led to the July 17 death of a Staten Island man in police custody.

title: Catalan Vote Seen as Test for Separatists in Europe
description: BILBAO, Spain  On a recent drizzly morning here, Mariano Bilbao, a retired metals worker, took part in an event for the 120th anniversary of the first hoisting of the Ikurria, the Basque flag. But with the neighboring region of Catalonia set to hold a vote this fall on whether to break from Spain, Mr. Bilbaos thoughts were less on the past than on the future. The Ikurria, he hopes, will eventually fly over a new Basque nation.

title: Ships Reclassification Could Leave Floating Theater Group Without Venue
description: OSSINING, N.Y.  Among all the weekend pleasure crafts docked at Westerly Marina in Ossining on the Hudson River, one vessel easily stood out.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Aug. 5, 2014
Harvey Takes First Official Step in Comeback
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  In Matt Harveys mind, it is a race to the end of the season. The Mets might not have any meaningful games to play come September, but that does not matter to Harvey.

title: Duda Struggles With Lesson Against Left-Handers as Mets Top Nationals
description: WASHINGTON  During the past several months, Lucas Duda had met certain checkpoints in his progression, as if he were crossing items off a shopping list. He won the Mets competition at first base over Ike Davis. He showed he could handle batting cleanup. Now, to complete his ascent, to be considered an everyday starter, he had perhaps one remaining test  prove he could hit left-handed pitching.

title: Edward M. Joyce, CBS News Leader During Era of Cost-Cutting, Dies at 81
description: Edward M. Joyce, a former president of CBS News who in the mid-1980s helped steer the so-called Tiffany network through a $120 million libel suit by Gen. William C. Westmoreland, deep staff reductions and several takeover threats, died on Saturday at his home in Redding, Conn. He was 81.

title: Ebola Outbreak Hits Home for New Yorks West African Immigrants
description: Gwendolyn Davis has never traveled to West Africa and does not know anyone who has contracted the deadly Ebola virus, but she is not taking any chances.

title: The Monet Is a Backdrop
Jack Sock Could Be Poised for a Breakthrough
description: TORONTO  There is no shortage of eye-catching trophies on Jack Socks shelf, beginning with the one for the 2010 United States Open junior boys championship, which he won as a wild-card entry.

title: Apple and Samsung Drop Patent Fights Outside the United States
description: Apple and Samsung Electronics on Tuesday said they had agreed to drop patent litigation against each other in countries outside the United States, including Germany, Australia and Japan. But they said they were not done fighting.

title: Civilian or Not? New Fight in Tallying the Dead From the Gaza Conflict
description: GAZA CITY  Inside the Health Sciences Library at Al-Shifa Hospital here, a small team spent the war crunching numbers. Stuck to their laptops were a statistician, a graphic designer, a data-entry specialist and an issuer of death certificates, some of whom spent nights sleeping in their straight-backed chairs.

title: Slain General in Afghanistan Was Quietly Effective Leader, Known for Technical Skill
description: WASHINGTON  To Maj. Gen. Harold J. Greene, video games were simply another tool for soldiers headed to the battlefield, a way to rehearse for combat.

title: Sierra Leone Deploys Troops in Ebola Crisis
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone  Faced with a widening crisis over the spread of the deadly Ebola virus, Sierra Leones government said Tuesday that it would deploy hundreds of troops and police officers to ensure that patients and family members who may be infected remain isolated.

title: Long Island Home Explodes, Killing One
description: A house on Long Island exploded and burst into flames on Tuesday night, leaving at least one person dead, the Port Washington Fire Department said.

title: Women Pace Marathons Better Than Men Do
description: During marathons, women pace themselves more evenly than male competitors do, according to a study of thousands of racers. The results provide unexpected insights into some of the physical and emotional differences between male and female runners, and also how both genders might improve their race times by noting how the other one runs.

title: Securities Class-Action Suits Seem to Be Waning, Report Says
description: Shareholders may be feeling a little less litigious lately.

title: Word of the Day | clamor
description: clamor \kla-mr\ verb and noun

title: Chamberlain, in Relief of Price, Helps Tigers Top Yanks
description: The Yankees task Tuesday was to try to beat a Cy Young Award winner for the second consecutive night at the Stadium. After solving Max Scherzer on Monday, they faced an old nemesis, David Price, the former Tampa Bay Rays ace whom the Detroit Tigers acquired last week in a trade.

title: A Whos Who of the U.S.-Africa Summit
description: As the conference gets underway this week in Washington, a look at some of the African heads of state in attendance.

title: African Leaders Sit Down With American Investors
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama convened a giant game of Lets Make a Deal between the United States and Africa on Tuesday, bringing together nearly 50 African leaders with American investors for what he promised would be a long-term partnership that went beyond extracting minerals from the ground for our growth.

title: Vladimir Putins Chess-Master Nemesis
description: Garry Kasparov, the former world chess champion, put his head down, hunched his shoulders and walked hurriedly down the carpeted corridor of the Sands Cotai Central, a labyrinthine new complex on reclaimed land in Macau. Downstairs were two of the worlds most lucrative casinos and retailers like Saint Laurent Paris and Fabio Caviglia. There were restaurants, spas and an array of theme-park attractions from DreamWorks, including a daily parade through the lobby with characters from Shrek, Madagascar and Kung Fu Panda. Here on the fourth floor, though, hundreds of boys and girls from across Asia had just wrapped up their matches in a chess tournament. Spilling into the corridor, many of them gaped at Kasparov barreling by, as if Shrek himself had wandered up to the wrong floor. That was why he was rushing, he explained, when I managed to catch up to him as he turned toward a bank of elevators. If you stop, he said, youll be there for 30 minutes. He did not sound angry, just matter of fact. Everyone circles around. They want pictures.

title: Whats On TV Wednesday
description: 9 P.M. (GSN) SKIN WARS Body painters put their creativity and technique to the test  think of the Sports Illustrated swimsuit issue, only with pasties and G-strings  for a prize package comprising $100,000, a years supply of paint and a stint as a guest artist at Imats, a trade show in New York. The series begins as the contestants (like the artist Gear Boxxx, above) embark on a tour of Hollywood before being given two hours to transfer their impressions onto the torsos of their models. Then theyre given five more hours to take judges on a virtual tour of their hometowns via a full-body painting. In each episode the contestant with the least compelling creation must watch as the living canvas washes herself off onstage. Rebecca Romijn hosts; RuPaul Charles is joined by the body painters Craig Tracy and Robin Slonina at the judges table.

title: Egypt Has Ambitious Plan for Suez Canal Expansion
description: CAIRO  When the Suez Canal opened in 1869, it had taken hundreds of thousands of Egyptian workers 10 years to complete it.

title: Germany: Russian Tycoons Mother Dies
description: Marina Khodorkovskaya, the mother of the former Russian tycoon Mikhail B. Khodorkovsky, has died in a Berlin clinic where she was being treated for cancer, a spokeswoman, Christiane Maack, said Tuesday. Russias president, Vladimir V. Putin, cited her illness as the reason for his surprising decision in December to release Mr. Khodorkovsky, once Russias richest man, after he had spent more than 10 years in Russian prisons. During that time, Mr. Khodorkovsky cited his mothers strength and perseverance as his inspiration.

title: 12-Year-Old Boy Is Shot in the Bronx
description: A 12-year-old boy was shot in the Bronx on Tuesday, the police said.

title: Argentina: Man Located After 37 Years
description: The head of a human rights organization that searches for hundreds of babies stolen by Argentinas military dictatorship decades ago has located her grandson after 37 years. Estela de Carlotto, leader of Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo, told reporters in Buenos Aires on Tuesday that she had found the son of her daughter Laura Carlotto, who was kidnapped while pregnant in 1977. She was later murdered as part of the dictatorships dirty war against guerrillas and people associated with leftist ideology. Mrs. Carlottos missing grandson, Guido Carlotto, 36, was raised as Ignacio Hurban. He is married and a pianist and approached Mrs. Carlottos organization because he doubted his identity. DNA tests proved that he was Mrs. Carlottos grandson.

title: Afghan Civilians Killed in Airstrike by American-Led Coalition
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An airstrike by the American-led coalition killed at least four civilians, including two women, Afghan officials said Tuesday. The attack prompted a sharp rebuke from President Hamid Karzai, who has long bristled at the deaths of Afghans in military operations led by foreign forces.

title: Cease-Fire Between Syrian Insurgents and Lebanese Army Ends Quickly
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A 24-hour cease-fire between the Syrian Islamist insurgents who seized a Lebanon border town this past weekend and the Lebanese Army forces seeking to expel them collapsed almost immediately on Tuesday, raising new alarms about the infectious spread of Syrias civil war into Lebanon.

title: Corrections: August 6, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 6, 2014
description: Its what you did for your country.

title: Jailed Uighur Scholar Rejects Chinas Separatism Charges as Distorted
description: BEIJING  Ilham Tohti, the Uighur academic who is facing charges of separatism, has rejected the allegations that he was the ringleader of a group advocating the creation of an independent Uighur homeland in Chinas far western region of Xinjiang, his lawyers said Tuesday.

title: For Chinese Officials at Risk of Corruption, a View of Life Behind Bars
description: If the near daily announcements of officials big and small being toppled by investigations werent enough, a Chinese government agency has taken a new step to warn cadres about the dangers of corruption. The National Development and Reform Commission has sent some 200 high risk personnel for visits of prisons that hold officials convicted of graft.

title: A Militant Jewish Group Confronts Pro-Palestinian Protesters in France
description: SARCELLES, France  Several hundred pro-Palestinian demonstrators rampaged through the Jewish quarter of this northern suburb of Paris in July, some chanting, Death to Jews. As the rioters attacked a funeral home and set fire to a pharmacy, a band of young Jews formed a human shield in front of the citys main synagogue, brandishing motorcycle helmets as weapons.

title: Student Crossword | Musical Notation
description: Test your knowledge of musical notation by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: 6 Qs About the News | The Ebola Outbreak
description: In What You Need to Know About the Ebola Outbreak, The Times sums up, in words and images, key information about this virus.

title: Photos From Both Sides of the Gaza Conflict
description: Uriel Sinai is an Israeli freelance photographer covering Israel during the current war, while Wissam Nassar, a Palestinian freelance photographer, has coveredthe Gaza side of the conflict for The New York Times. James Estrin spoke with Mr. Sinai by phone last week and had several email exchanges with Mr. Nassar over the weekend.Both interviews have been edited.

title: Russia May Be Losing Influence Over European Energy Markets
description: The Ukraine crisis is unlikely to produce many benefits. But it could serve as a kind of stress test to see whether Europes approach to energy policy is working.

title: Standard Chartered Discloses New York Inquiry as Pretax Profit Falls
description: LONDON  Standard Chartered confirmed on Wednesday that it was facing an inquiry by New York State authorities over its monitoring of potentially risky transactions and reported that its pretax profit in the first half of the year fell 20 percent.

title: No Clear Winner as Scots Debate Independence
description: LONDON  Despite fierce, sometimes angry, exchanges, a televised debate on Scottish independence from the rest of Britain failed to produce a decisive victor late Tuesday, a little more than six weeks before Scots vote.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: Why the Price of Sovaldi Is a Shock to the System
description: The outcry about the new hepatitis C drug Sovaldi has focused a lot on its price tag  $1,000 a pill and $84,000 total for a typical patient. But just how high is that price compared with other drugs on the market?

title: Advice From a Vegan Cardiologist
description: Dr. Kim A. Williams, the president-elect of the American College of Cardiology, often sees patients who are overweight and struggling with hypertension, Type 2 diabetes and high cholesterol. One of the things he advises them to do is to change their diets.

title: New York Today: Turn Off the A.C., Again
description: Good Wednesday morning to you.

title: Walgreen Shies Away From Moving Its Tax Base to Britain
description: For months, the Walgreen drugstore chain has faced a difficult choice: Renounce its United States citizenship to cut its tax bill and thereby risk angering Washington lawmakers and possibly even its own shoppers, or shrug off investors who have been pressuring it improve its financial performance.

title: Morning Views
description: A much-anticipated investigation by the Justice Department has uncovered what amounted to a chamber of horrors at New York Citys Rikers Island jail, where teenagers were beaten and battered for minor infractions by correction officers who acted without fear of discovery or punishment by senior officials, says an editorial in The New York Times. The report reveals a deep-seated culture of violence that demands immediate remedial action by New York City. Adolescents on Rikers were in constant danger of physical harm even when they present no risk to the system or safety of the staff and force was routinely used not so much to keep order but for the express purpose of inflicting injuries and pain. This scandalous behavior went on for so long because of a departmental code of silence that aided and abetted this brutal regime and shielded its practitioners from discovery and official rebuke. The report recommends the removal of all teenagers from Rikers and improvement in officer training.

title: European Spacecraft Pulls Alongside Comet After 10 Years and Four Billion Miles
description: After 10 years and a journey of four billion miles, the European Space Agencys Rosetta spacecraft arrived at its destination on Wednesday for the first extended, close examination of a comet.

title: Inverting the Debate Over Corporate Inversions
description: On Tuesday, Treasury Secretary Jacob J. Lew told The New York Times that the Obama administration was considering executive action to discourage corporate inversions  transactions in which American corporations move their tax residency abroad by being bought by smaller foreign firms, in order to reduce their American corporate tax bills. The same day, the Walgreen Company, the drugstore chain, ended months of speculation by signaling that it would forgo such an arrangement, but a number of large American firms are still considering these transactions.

title: Daily Report: More Than a Billion Passwords Stolen by Russian Hackers
description: A Russian crime ring has amassed the largest known collection of stolen Internet credentials, including 1.2 billion user name and password combinations and more than 500 million email addresses, according to security researchers, Nicole Perlroth and David Gelles report.

title: Wikipedia Details Government Data Requests
