description: LONDON  Wikipedia released its first-ever transparency report on Wednesday, outlining the number of requests the website had received for its users data.

title: The Countdown Continues: Can We Recover From Our Lost 50 Days?
description: Even though we are experiencing a meltdown on one of our new production lines (as I explained in my last post), Im still thinking about expanding our business.

title: North Korea Declines Invitation to Papal Mass in Seoul
description: SEOUL, South Korea  North Korea has declined to send a delegation to a Mass that Pope Francis will preside over during a visit to Seoul this month, Roman Catholic officials in South Korea said Wednesday.

title: Test Yourself | Subway Acrobats
description: This week were experimenting with a new, slightly more elaborate version of our long-running English language-arts Test Yourself feature. Please, tell us what you think.

title: Mayor of London Plans to Run for Parliament
description: LONDON  Boris Johnson, Londons mayor and one of the most recognizable figures in British politics, said on Wednesday that he would try to return to Parliament next year, opening the possibility that he could one day succeed Prime Minister David Cameron as leader of the Conservative Party.

title: Morning Agenda: Fox Gives Up on Time Warner Deal
description: FOX ABANDONS PURSUIT OF TIME WARNER | Rupert Murdochs 21st Century Fox withdrew its offer to acquire Time Warner on Tuesday, ending what was shaping up to be the biggest media merger in a decade, Michael J. de la Merced and Jonathan Mahler write in DealBook. The $150 billion union of the two giant conglomerates would have created a colossus that loomed over the industry, combining the two biggest movie and television studios in Hollywood and enabling Fox to try to challenge ESPNs sports broadcasting dominance, they add.

title: In a Xinjiang City, No Room on the Bus for Those With Veils or Long Beards
description: The authorities in a city in the western Chinese region of Xinjiang have banned long beards and apparel with Islamic symbols on public buses as part of an effort to increase security and ensure stability, a state-run newspaper has reported.

title: Once Flashy, Hedge Funds Now Seen as Staid but Consistent
description: Hedge funds once had the allure of being high octane and exotic. Today, they have a reputation of being mundane and consistent.

title: Profit-Sharing Trims Apollo Global Income
description: Updated, 7:33 p.m. | Apollo Global Management on Wednesday reported a decline in second-quarter income as it earned less from selling its investments and allocated more of that profit to employees.

title: A Touch Screen Becomes a Window to the Past
description: ALL the whiz-bang technology in todays smartphones and tablets can sometimes make you feel as if youre living in the future. But those same devices can also give you a window to the past.

title: App Smart | History 101
description: Kit Eaton reviews three apps that will help you brush up on past events ranging from the Roman era to World War I.

title: Reviewing: Temperleys Interactive E-Commerce Video and the Herms Tie App
description: The message has gotten through and high fashion brands are finally trying to up their digital game. Conventional wisdom says they waited so long because they wanted to make sure the result had the same gorgeous values as their products, but was that the right decision?

title: Fox and Time Warner Deliver Dueling Earnings Reports, Both Positive
description: How dead is the Fox-Time Warner deal?

title: Would You Like Us to Arrest Him?
description: I just got flashed, my 15-year-old daughter texted me. She called, shaken. A man in his late teens or early 20s had stared at her and exposed his genitals as she walked past him on her way to work. He didnt speak or follow her, but she wasnt sure whether to leave the area or stay and call 911. He is still sitting there, Mom. I need to call the police.

title: Bus Operator Arrested in Times Square Crash Is Released
description: The driver of a double-decker bus that crashed into a crowded plaza in Times Square, injuring more than a dozen people, was arrested late Tuesday on a charge of driving while ability impaired. But he was released Wednesday night, after prosecutors said they were delaying a decision over whether to prosecute until they finished their investigation.

title: Bangladesh Begins Manhunt for Owners of Capsized Ferry
description: NEW DELHI  The police in Bangladesh have launched a manhunt for the owners, captain and other crew members of a ferry that capsized and sank in a river on Monday. By Wednesday, 137 passengers from the ferry had been reported missing and 19 bodies had been recovered.

title: Antwerps Enduring Appeal to the Creative Set
description: With its experimental architecture, bijou furniture markets and numerous concept galleries and fusion eateries, Antwerp has long been known as Belgiums capital of cool. The trendy little city, a buzzing hive of creativity, attracts an increasing number of artists, designers and other globetrotters with its thriving avant-garde style scene. This years fashion festival, which happens next month, will be the biggest its ever been. Here, a sampling of where to hang out in Antwerp this summer.

title: A Cool Pizza Man on a Hot Day
description: Dear Diary:

title: Bitcoin Foundation Seeks More Time to Address Virtual Currency Rules
description: Big-name Bitcoin supporters are stepping up the pressure on New York States top financial regulator to extend the comment period for the states new virtual currency rules.

title: Study on Parental Longevity Is Short on Causation
description: A recent paper by two sociologists purports to show that sending your children to college is a great way to extend your life. Accessing the paper requires a subscription, but it is discussed in this news article and this post.

title: Dreamed-Of Music, Undreamed-Of Spaces
description: Twenty-five years ago, when I was in junior high, my father produced a jazz festival on the North Shore of Oahu. It lasted only a few years, well received and well attended, but not what youd call a financial success.

title: Will You Lose Your Job to a Robot? Silicon Valley Is Split
description: There is little disagreement that machines are outworking humans. They have progressed from displacing factory workers to personal assistants and even lawyers, and much of our lives will be digitized or augmented even more in a decade.

title: With Feds Blessing, Bank of America to Raise Dividend
description: Bank of America said on Wednesday that it would increase it dividend for the first time in seven years, after the Federal Reserve blessed its revised plan to weather a severe financial storm.

title: Can Foursquare Crack Local Search?
description: Foursquare, a start-up focused on local business recommendations and discovery, has finally started to find itself.

title: Wireless Charging, at a Distance, Moves Forward for uBeam
description: LOS ANGELES  When Meredith Perry, 25, started studying astrobiology at the University of Pennsylvania, her career goal was to eventually find life on other planets.Instead, Ms. Perry accidentally stumbled upon something even more exciting: the ability to chargeportable electronics, like cellphones and laptops, wirelessly using ultrasound.

title: 1939: Strike at G.M.C. Ends
description: DETROIT  The four-week strike in the plants of the General Motors Corporation came to an end last night when the companys representatives and the strikers of the Congress of Industrial Organizations overwhelmingly ratified a settlement. William S. Knudsen, president of General Motors, announced that production would be resumed as soon as possible in the companys scores of plants, possibly tomorrow and certainly on Tuesday. We want to get everybody back to work, Mr. Knudsen said. We want to forget all the names we have called each other.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 7, 1939

title: At a Camp for Hasidic Boys, Studying Faith Is Their Daily Exercise
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y.  Although they are at the heart of one of the nations largest sleep-away boys camps, the dozen basketball courts at Camp Rav Tov DSatmar are crumbling from disuse, with weeds sprouting from cracked playing surfaces and hoops either sheared off or rusting.

title: A Valhalla for Libertines
description: A weekly look at international culture.

title: Bush Urges Renewed Fight Against Deadly Diseases in Africa
description: WASHINGTON  Former President George W. Bush made a rare return to the nations capital on Wednesday to rally world leaders behind a public health campaign to conquer killer diseases in Africa and to forecast what he called the beginning of the end of AIDS.

title: $11 Billion Later, High-Speed Rail Is Inching Along
description: WASHINGTON  High-speed rail was supposed to be President Obamas signature transportation project, but despite the administration spending nearly $11 billion since 2009 to develop faster passenger trains, the projects have gone mostly nowhere and the United States still lags far behind Europe and China.

title: Storm Chasing on Saturn
description: Theres always something strange going on with Saturn, the solar systems most photogenic planet  from the famous rings that baffled Galileo 400 years ago to the methane dunes and lakes of its smoggy moon Titan.

title: Storm Chasing on Saturn
description: The sun is slowly rising over Saturns North Pole, exposing an immense six-sided hurricane. The storm, big enough to swallow four Earths, was first spotted by the Voyager missions in the early 1980s.

title: Italy Falls Back Into Recession, Raising Concern for Eurozone Economy
description: FRANKFURT  The Italian economy shrank in the second quarter, according to an official estimate on Wednesday, taking economists by surprise and provoking concern that violence in Ukraine and tension with Russia could be pushing the broader eurozone back into recession.

title: Andy Coulson, Former Murdoch Editor, Accused of Perjury
description: LONDON  Adding to the legal tangle spreading from the phone hacking scandal, prosecutors in Scotland on Wednesday accused Andy Coulson, a former top editor in Rupert Murdochs British newspaper empire, of committing perjury in a trial in 2010.

title: Broadways Lady Day Recoups Its Costs
description: The critically praised Broadway production of Lady Day at Emersons Bar and Grill, for which Audra McDonald won her history-making sixth Tony Award in June, has recouped its $2.6 million capitalization, the producers have announced. The play with music, starring Ms. McDonald as an emotionally raw Billie Holiday just months before her death, is running through Sept. 21 at Circle in the Square Theater. Only about 25 percent of Broadway shows turn a profit. Lady Day was written by Lanie Robertson; the productions director is Lonny Price.

title: Scientist on Comet Interception
description: Mark McCaughrean, a scientific adviser at the European Space Agency, discussed the Rosetta spacecrafts 10-year journey to pull up alongside a comet.

title: The Clam Chowder Wars
description: Clam chowder may have originated in the caldrons of coastal France and migrated to kitchens across the English Channel in Cornwall. But it grew up in the Plymouth Colony and is one of Americas first recipes, a stew of fish or shellfish flavored and thickened with stores brought from Britain aboard colony ships: salt pork, biscuits, the odd potato.

title: Five of the Best Players in Nike Elite Youth Basketball League History
description: Team Scan, the youth basketball team I wrote about in this weeks magazine, competes in the Nike Elite Youth Basketball League, which has become the top incubator of high-school-age basketball talent today. The league has only been around for five years, but it has already impacted college and professional basketball. Here are five of the top players in E.Y.B.L.s short history:

title: Kent, N.Y.: Theres Something About the Water
description: If the neighborhoods of the Putnam County town of Kent, and the exact geographic areas they correspond to, can perplex even longtime residents, then have a little sympathy for more recent arrivals.

title: Wikimedia Wants You to Remember the Links Europe Wants You to Forget
description: Europe has decided people have the right to be forgotten. The Wikimedia Foundation wants everyone to remember just how much it doesnt like that.

title: Facts & Figures: Americans Now Hate Their Own Representatives
description: Americans have long hated Congress, and yet reported liking their own representatives. (Congress is terrible, they tell pollsters, but my Congressman is OK.) Thats changing. Now theyre giving up on the individual lawmakers that they voted into office.

title: Premier Leagues New Concussion Protocol Empowers On-Field Doctors
description: The debate about how to best handle head injuries in soccer became more inflamed during this summers World Cup, when fans witnessed incidents in which players clearly sustained serious blows to the head yet quickly returned to the field. Now, with the top domestic leagues in Europe set to begin their seasons, Englands Premier League has announced changes to its in-game injury protocols.

title: Gaza: When Home Is a War Zone
description: Fares Akram is a Palestinian journalist working as a stringer for The Times in the Gaza Strip, where he lives with his family. We asked him what it is like to report on a conflict that has direct impact on him and his family.

title: Amid Criticism, a Changing Brooklyn Gets a Second Cathedral
description: Brooklyn has one more thing that Manhattan does not: two Roman Catholic cathedrals.

title: U.S. Drone Strike Kills 6 in Pakistani Tribal Area
description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan  An American drone strike against a compound in the North Waziristan tribal district on Wednesday killed at least six people, Pakistani officials and local residents said. It was the latest in a series of strikes by C.I.A.-operated drone aircraft to coincide with a major offensive by the Pakistani military in the area, which is notorious as a sanctuary for militants.

title: Disparities in Diabetes
description: Diabetics who live in low-income neighborhoods are about 10 times as likely to have an amputation as those who live in affluent areas, a study reports.

title: Emmys 2014: Who Are Your Picks for Lead Actor in a Drama?
description: In advance of the Emmy Awards on Aug. 25, were asking you to tell us who deserved their nominations and who should have been nominated. Next up is lead actor in a drama series. Take a look at this alternative list  its made up of the actual nominees, popular and critical favorites who werent nominated, and my own choices. Cast your votes in the comments, and let us know whos still been left out.

title: What You Get for ... $1,000,000
description: DALLAS

title: A Nomadic Museum Takes Up Temporary Residence in Istanbul
description: The Moving Museum is pretty much exactly what it sounds like: an artistic institution that is perpetually on the go. Founded by Aya Mousawi and Simon Sakhai, who live and work together, it launched in May 2013 with a show in Dubai devoted to the lost cuisine of Iraqi Jews, who thrived in that country prior to the 1940s. A show in London followed last fall that was devoted to the citys contemporary art scene. As part of the museums continuing effort to respond to a city through artistic practice, in Sakhais words, the duo has now headed to Istanbul, both for its bubbling political energy and its geographic and cultural location on the boundary between east and west.

title: Isaacs Elected to New Term as Head of Motion Picture Academy
description: LOS ANGELES  Cheryl Boone Isaacs was elected for a second term as president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, the Academy said in a statement on Tuesday evening. Presidents are named for one-year terms and can be elected up to four consecutive times during their service on the board of governors. Ms. Isaacs is a long-time Hollywood marketing executive and consultant.

title: House Hunting in ... the Canary Islands
description: A MODERN THREE-BEDROOM VILLA ON TENERIFE

title: The Case Against the Death Penalty From the Right
description: After two botched executions in the United States, the debate over capital punishment has been rekindled  but now with a focus on the cost and effectiveness of the method used to carry it out rather than on its moral legitimacy.

title: Technology Driving Young Art
description: PARIS  When he was 18, the South African artist Bogosi Sekhukhuni sought out his father, whom he had never met, on Facebook. It didnt go well. They had a terse and awkward online chat. Later, his father blocked him from contacting him on the site. Now 23, Mr. Sekhukhuni is using the experience for a new project: designing robot-generated imagined conversations between fathers and sons, akin to an interactive video game.

title: Helen Mirren Returning to Broadway With The Audience
description: Helen Mirren, who won an Oscar for her portrayal of Queen Elizabeth II in The Queen, and an Olivier Award for her performance as the queen in The Audience, a hit on the London stage last year, will extend her realm when The Audience comes to Broadway next year. The play is to begin previews at the Gerald Schoenfeld Theater on Feb. 17 and open on March 8. It is scheduled to run through June 28.

title: Lyft Hopes to Coax Commuters to Leave Their Cars
description: Today, like every weekday, about three-quarters of the nations adult workers  more than 100 million Americans  drove to work alone. It was ever thus: Americans, it seems, just dont like to travel together.

title: Chryslers Quarterly Income Rose 22 Percent
description: Few could have predicted that five years after Chrysler and General Motors tumbled into bankruptcy and were bailed out by the federal government, it would be Chrysler surging in profits while G.M. struggled.

title: As Big Merger Deals Boom, So Do Big Failures
description: Deal-making has boomed this year. So has deal-breaking.

title: Sprint Names New Chief Executive
description: Sprint announced Wednesday that it had named Marcelo Claure, founder of the wireless company Brightstar, as its new chief executive and president.

title: Highlights of Judge in Pistorius Trial
description: A look at Judge Thokozile Matilda Masipas interactions with those in her courtroom during the Oscar Pistorius trial in Pretoria, South Africa.

title: From Apartheid-Era Jail Cell to the Bench in Pistorius Case
description: JOHANNESBURG  The murder trial of Oscar Pistorius has never had a shortage of larger-than-life figures: the double-amputee sprinter known as the Blade Runner; the glamorous, blond model cut down in her youth; the Afrikaner prosecutor so pugnacious he was nicknamed the Pit Bull.

title: C.I.A. Hires Yossarian to Censor Torture Report
description: In Joseph Hellers anti-war satire, Catch 22, the hero, Yossarian, is assigned to a censorship detail. He amuses himself by deleting all the adverbs and adjectives from soldiers letters, then all the articles, then everything but the articles, and so on. His job was to delete details that threatened operational security. The result was gibberish.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: Start-Ups Seize Marijuana Opportunities as Big Companies Hold Back
description: When Garett Fortunes brother was found to have cancer in early 2013, it was so advanced that all he could do was to try to live out the remainder of his life in as little pain and discomfort as possible. That meant taking about 30 pills a day, Mr. Fortune said  until his brother tried marijuana.

title: Occupation of Theater in Rome to End
description: ROME  The curtain will come down on Sunday on the three-year occupation of the Teatro Valle, putting an end to a self-management experiment that turned the storied theater here into a lively cultural hub.

title: Italy's Lost Decade
description: Its not often that were moved to write about the Italian economy. But this mornings news that it has shrunk for two quarters in a row  meeting a widely used threshold for the declaration of a recession  is worth noting. Italy has sunk into a triple-dip recession.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts, Running Back
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts, Wide Receiver
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: From Sundance, a Los Angeles Festival
description: Every January, Park City, Utah, welcomes an onslaught of Angelenos to the Sundance Film Festival. The ski town transforms into a smaller, cooler (both literally and figuratively) Hollywood, crawling with producers and journalists shopping for the next generation of indie film taste makers.

title: 7 Steps to a Cheaper Hotel Room
description: There are so many ways to wrangle deals on hotel rooms these days that no matter how great a bargain you find, its not uncommon to worry you missed a better one.

title: Finding Last-Minute Deals on Upscale Hotels
description: If last-minute hotel booking apps make you think of impetuous travelers on a budget, think again. The market for such apps and websites is becoming increasingly crowded, making it easier for those looking for upscale hotels to find 11th-hour discounts. During recent searches I found a room at the Four Seasons Hotel Miami for about $157 (compared with $259 on the hotels website), a room at the Westin Resort & Spa, Cancn for $75 (as opposed to about $200), and, in Maine, a room at the White Barn Inn & Spa in Kennebunkport, for $300, down from $630. Which sites will check you into the lap of luxury? I spent days with new apps and old standbys to determine the best tactics for nabbing a high-end hotel room at a (somewhat) down-to-earth price.

title: Hotel Review: InterContinental Marseille Htel Dieu
description: Rates

title: Revenue and Profits Drop at Viacom
description: Viacom, the media group that includes the Paramount film studio and the cable television networks MTV, Comedy Central and Nickelodeon, reported a 5.1 percent decrease in profit in the latest fiscal quarter, with earnings dragged down by declines in the filmed entertainment group.

title: Dont Fight Flames With Flames
description: Last year, at a low point in my life, I did something Im still utterly ashamed of. When I tell you, please understand, I was upset at the time. Emotions were running high.

title: I Will Be There by Odessa
description: The first single by the singer-songwriter from her self-titled debut EP.

title: Rupert Murdoch Loses but Could Still Come Out Ahead
description: Rupert Murdoch miscalculated. The sly old fox of global media abruptly yanked his $80 billion offer to buy rival Time Warner on Tuesday after failing to anticipate his quarrys resolve and the price demands of investors. Shares of 21st Century Fox rallied after the market officially closed while Time Warners retreated toward their pre-bid level. That means the refusenik boss, Jeffrey Bewkes, has something more to prove.

title: Afghan Officers, Said to Be Working for Taliban, Kill 11 of Their Police Colleagues
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Two attacks by Afghan police officers who were collaborating with the Taliban claimed the lives of 11 police officers in southern Afghanistan on Wednesday, officials reported. News of the so-called insider attacks came as the authorities were still grappling with the assassination one day earlier of an American general by an Afghan soldier.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts, Tight End
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts, Kicker
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: Fantasy Football: Tiered Player Ranking Charts, Defense
description: Charts resulting from a statistical algorithm find natural tiers and clusters within fantasy football player ranking data.

title: 1964: Police to Watch for Gouging
description: PARIS  Police here have been ordered to keep a sharp watch for any sudden price increases by the capitals hotels and restaurants as part of a government campaign to prevent tourists from being overcharged during the peak holiday season. The move coincided with reports that tourist traffic in Paris this year is 20 percent below that of 1963 and that foreign travel agencies are advising against France for vacations because of high costs. Legal proceedings have already been taken against 37 Paris hotel and restaurant owners who allegedly made sudden price increases for drinks.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, August 7, 1964

title: As Usual, Unusual Offerings From the Kitchen
description: The Kitchen will present a performance of John Zorns collected Game Pieces, classic scores from the 1970s in which improvisation is governed by sets of rules, as the final event in its fall 2014 season of experimental music, dance, theater, film and art offerings.

title: BlackRock Urges Caution on European I.P.O.s
description: The European market for initial public offerings has been on fire this year, with 200 deals raising $58 billion, compared with 89 deals worth $15.2 billion in the same time period a year ago.

title: Today in Small Business: Reshoring
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Five Rooms at the Inn
description: With his deep catalog of plays, not to mention his continuing fertility, A. R. Gurney seems a natural match for the Signature Theater Company, whose mission is to celebrate the legacy of American playwrights (and increasingly, to promote new ones).

title: Tom Werner Emerges to Create Race for Commissioner
description: For the past decade, Tom Werner has been a prominent part of an ownership group in Boston that has turned the Red Sox into a top baseball franchise, the winner of three World Series and the producer of some pioneering marketing for a sports team.

title: A Clinton-Colbert Name-Dropping Contest
description: WASHINGTON  If Hillary Rodham Clinton decides to sit out of the 2016 presidential race, she may have a future as a sketch comic.

title: A Co-Working Space for Cannabis Start-Ups
description: The first state in the country to legalize recreational marijuana, Colorado is now home to what may be the first co-working space in the country dedicated specifically to marijuana-related start-ups  part of a wave of entrepreneurship that is the subject of an article weve just published.

title: In New Calculus on Smoking, Its Health Gained vs. Pleasure Lost
description: WASHINGTON  Rarely has the concept of happiness caused so much consternation in public health circles.

title: No Longer an Invisible Photographer
description: Among the images in Vanessa Winships first retrospective are portraits taken with a view camera, which led her to slow down and engage her subjects rather than be fleetingly invisible.

title: Drafting a Fantasy Football Team, With Help From Advanced Statistics
description: Last year, I developed a statistical model for fantasy football that determines how to rank and tier players for every position based on consensus expert rankings. The algorithm found natural tiers and clusters within the rankings data. To help visualize this, I created charts for each week of the season, which could be used to help you decide your starting fantasy lineup.

title: Swimming With Bold-Faced Creatures
description: This is the time of year to face fears of riptides, jellyfish and sharks.

title: Texas Bolsters Border Patrol With Its Own
description: MISSION, Tex.  Along the Rio Grande here, the suspected smugglers trying to slip into the United States have certainly noticed their adversaries on the water: burly commandos in black-and-white boats mounted with .30-caliber machine guns and bulletproof shields. The patches on the officers camouflage fatigues identify them not as federal Border Patrol agents but as another breed of law enforcement entirely.

title: Introducing Odessa, a Folk Singer Who Fell Off Her Bike and Decided to Become a Star
description: Two years ago, the singer and multi-instrumentalist who goes only by Odessa had a nearly fatal bike accident. Afterward, she promised herself she would follow her muse. So she left a stable career playing backing violin for established bands like Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeroes to work on her own. The experience inspired me to fully commit to only what I wanted to do, she says. After that it was like, Okay. I have no choice. This is why Im on earth.'

title: 1988: The Internet Comes Down With a Virus
description: This feature looks at the first time famous names or terms appeared in The Times. Have an idea for someone or something you would like to read about? Send a suggestion in the comments section.

title: When Caesarism Is a Choice
description: I talked a little bit, in my last post, about the argument that anything President Obama might do unilaterally on immigration policy is, if not justified, at least explained by congressional gridlock and particularly by the extraordinary intransigence of the current G.O.P. But I want to say something more about this point, because its come up in various responses to my warnings against presidential caesarism this one from Ezra Klein, for instance, and this one from Jonathan Bernstein. I think Bernstein does a good job of making the case that the president faces an unusual situation with House Republicans, given their incentives and dysfunctions:

title: Earthquake Death Toll Rises to Nearly 600 in China
description: BEIJING  The death toll from an earthquake that struck Yunnan Province in southwestern China on Sunday has jumped to 589 as rescuers reached isolated villages and recovered the bodies of 179 more victims, state media reported Wednesday.

title: Missourians Approve Amendment on Farming
description: CHICAGO  Voters in Missouri have narrowly approved a constitutional amendment allowing for a right to farm, a measure that deeply divided the state and set off an influx of spending and television ads.

title: Woods Says Hes Healthy; the Crowds Certainly Are
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  This years British Open champion, Rory McIlroy, was in the parking lot next to Valhalla Golf Club early Wednesday afternoon. So was the defending P.G.A. champion, Jason Dufner. Another P.G.A. champ, Keegan Bradley, was also in the lot, laughing at the scene as he took photos on his phone. Other top pros were there, too, like Hunter Mahan and Rickie Fowler.

title: T-Mobile Taunts Sprint
description: Earlier today John Legere, the chief executive officer of the countrys fourth-largest wireless company, taunted the countrys third-largest wireless company on Twitter: Join T-Mobile now and jump off the Sprint bus before it crashes!

title: Tom Petty Finally Has a No. 1 Album
description: Thirteen turns out to be the lucky number for Tom Petty and the Heartbreakers. The bands 13th studio album, Hypnotic Eye (Reprise/Warner), entered the Billboard charts this week at No. 1, becoming the first chart-topper in the bands 38-year history.

title: Wheelies: The Canyons Cost Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Tension on Deporting a Killer Turned Informer
description: In a cell at a New Jersey detention center, Miguel Feliz awaits what he fears will be his fate. If the government succeeds in deporting him to his homeland, the Dominican Republic, he believes he is as good as dead.

title: The Horrors of War  Between Matchsticks
description: Today we are inundated with ubiquitous news of war  graphic images and death counts from Syria, Gaza and Ukraine  but Garry Bardins simple, almost childlike stop-animation film from1983,Conflict, offers a much different, but exceptionally chilling, account of conflict.

title: Side Show Revival Sets Broadway Opening
description: A new revival of the 1997 musical Side Show, about the real-life conjoined twins Daisy and Violet Hilton, will come to Broadway this fall, starting preview performances on Oct. 28 at the St. James Theater and opening on Nov. 17, the producers said on Wednesday.

title: Pakistan Detains Indian Soldier Who Accidentally Crossed Border
description: NEW DELHI  Pakistani forces took custody of an Indian soldier who accidentally crossed the border into Pakistan in the region of Jammu on Wednesday, an incident that Indian officials said they hoped would be swiftly resolved.

title: All-of-a-Kind Family
description: The Fletchers are an unusual family. You might consider them unusual because they are all male  the family consists of four adopted boys and two fathers  but what really makes them stand out is how inclusive, loving and fun they are. In her first novel, The Misadventures of the Family Fletcher, Dana Alison Levy conjures up an enlightening tale for middle-grade readers, taking the traditional family-story structure and bringing it up to date by introducing same-sex parents and multiracial children.

title: The Face of the Almeida
description: Rupert Goold, the artistic director of Londons Almeida Theater, talks about how the theater has kept a high profile in the working-class neighborhod of Islington, despite its small size.

title: Renovation Plan Sends Irish Reps Season to a Temporary Home
description: The Irish Repertory Theater has started renovating its home in the Stanwick Building on West 22nd Street in Manhattan and entered the final phase of its $13 million capital campaign.

title: Aiming to Be the Netflix of Books
description: THE all-you-can-consume subscription often seems made for the Internet.

title: Are E-Book Subscriptions Worth It?
description: Molly Wood debates the value of three paid monthly services that let you read unlimited books on a smartphone, tablet or the web.

title: Celebrating the Centennial of the Panama Canal
description: With the Panama Canals official centennial on Aug. 15 this year, a number of events have been planned to celebrate the feat of engineering that connected the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans in 1914.

title: Expert Panel to Consult on Ebola
description: Scrambling to catch up with the worst outbreak of the deadly Ebola virus, the World Health Organization announced Wednesday that it was considering the declaration of an international public health emergency and would convene a panel of experts in coming days to explore the use of experimental treatments for the incurable disease.

title: Perfidy Afoot in a Doomed Parking Lot
description: There are so many things working against Othello at Shakespeare in the Parking Lot that its a minor miracle that the show comes together so well. Traffic noise, funky smells and a few fumbled lines plagued one recent performance. Even so, by the end, there was more than a little magic in the air.

title: Freeway Series May Be Key on the Road to the Title
description: LOS ANGELES  As if to mark the moment, the setting sun had turned the hills and the palm trees in Chavez Ravine a golden hue as Mike Trout stepped into the batters box for the first time Tuesday night. He shrugged off the boos from the sellout crowd, wished the umpire Chris Segal and catcher A. J. Ellis good luck, and dug in against Clayton Kershaw.

title: Emigrate? And Give Up the Odessa Apartment?
description: Yelena Akhtiorskayas brilliant and often funny first novel, Panic in a Suitcase, begins in 1993, with the Nasmertovs of Brighton Beach, Brooklyn, receiving a visit from their son, Pasha, the last family member still living in Ukraine. After a long bout of travel, hes weary and reluctant to tag along on a walk to the ocean.

title: In Fashion Ads, Plenty of Dj Vu
description: For an industry that pays a lot of lip service to originality and unique points of view, fashion can seem surprisingly lemminglike at times.

title: Walgreen May Be the Exception to the Logic of Inversions
description: Walgreen has encountered a limit to the logic of inversions. The drugstore chain will keep flying the American flag even after agreeing to buy the rest of Swiss-based Alliance Boots for about $15 billion. A backlash against corporate emigration may have affected Walgreens decision, but harder numbers probably mattered more.

title: Walking, Stopping: Its So Sentimental
description: Jacob Jonas the Company, born in Los Angeles, is a relatively new venture led by a skateboarder turned street performer. Mr. Jonas discovered dance at 13 at a performance by the Calypso Tumblers on the Venice Beach boardwalk; eventually, he became a member. Now, as the artistic director of his own group, he strives to create a supportive environment with a mission statement that highlights producing emotionally charged work with the intention to encourage and not compete.

title: From Street Art to High Art
description: Caledonia Curry started her career as a street artist, but leapfrogged to museums and galleries. Now she has expanded her work to include installation and performance art, often with an activist bent.

title: A Holy Guy Keeps His Worldly, Common Touch
description: Aaron McGruder moves his satire of contemporary African-American life from comic strips and animation to live actors with Black Jesus, his new series for Adult Swim, beginning Thursday night. Its a looser, baggier, less pointed show than The Boondocks, his sometimes-brilliant cartoon that has occasionally popped up on Adult Swim over the last nine years. And it has a comfortable, which is to say familiar, feel, recalling comedies from Chappelles Show all the way back to Sanford and Son.

title: At a Waylon Jennings Sale: Hanks Boots, Buddys Bike and Willies Hair
description: How much for a matched set of vintage Willie Nelson braids? The hammer will go down on this unusual example of pop memorabilia on Oct. 5 at the Musical Instrument Museum in Phoenix, when Guernseys auctions off about 2,000 items owned by the country singer Waylon Jennings, who died in 2002.

title: Bank of America Offers U.S. Biggest Settlement in History Over Toxic Mortgage Loans
description: Updated, 9:58 p.m. | After months of lowball offers and heels dug in, it took only 24 hours for Bank of America to suddenly cave in to the government, agreeing to the largest single federal settlement in the history of corporate America.

title: Life of Wonderment
description: With a glowing paper cutout pinned over her heart, the artist known as Swoon led a procession through the Brooklyn Museum early one summer night to her installation Submerged Motherlands, a site-specific jumble that includes two cantilevered rafts, seemingly cobbled out of junk; a tree, of fabric and wire, that reaches to the rotunda; and nooks of stenciled portraits.

title: Does Allonzo Trier Still Have Game?
description: Ive found that a downside of being a magazine writer is that I dont get to do follow-up stories, as theyre called in the newspaper business. I generally write about a subject and then, professionally speaking, move on. But I do maintain a personal curiosity, and I have a long list of people I once wrote about whom I occasionally do a little research on to see what theyre up to.

title: For Jade Lai, of Creatures of Comfort, a Relaxed Hong Kong Homecoming
description: Most people, when they talk about Hong Kong, theyre like, Oh, the parties, the bars, the shopping,' says Jade Lai (top row, center), the Hong Kong-raised owner of Creatures of Comfort a boutique with locations in New York and Los Angeles  and the designer of its in-house clothing and accessories line. Thats all nice, but for me its about spending time with family  hiking, going to the beach, food.

title: In Homage to Mozart, Musical Wit and Allusions
description: Parody and chaos are integral elements of the works of the Russian composer Alfred Schnittke, whose musical humor, like the most sophisticated jokes, sometimes surfaces unexpectedly with a witty turn of phrase. His Moz-Art  la Haydn, a pastiche based on an unfinished fragment by Mozart called Music to a Carnival Pantomime, opened the Mostly Mozart Festivals concert on Tuesday evening at Avery Fisher Hall.

title: Exploring a Jazzman and Gender Identity
description: Come up into the attic, and lets play dress-up. There are piles of old costumes, stacks of sheet music and vintage 78s, a phonograph and a battered upright piano: everything we need to put on a show.

title: Clip: Frank
description: A scene from the film Frank, with Michael Fassbender and Domhnall Gleeson.

title: Fears Rise Over Wealth Gap as Top College Conferences Push Overhaul
description: The head football coach at Alabama makes $6.9 million a year, and his staff is also very well paid. The offensive coordinator makes $680,000 a year, and the defensive coordinator makes $1.35 million. The strength and conditioning coach earns $395,000.

title: 4 Stylish Ways to Get to the Hamptons
description: The weekend slog to the Hamptons seems to get worse every summer. But for those with deep pockets, its easier than ever.

title: The Man Who Was an Ace
description: Alan C. Greenberg, whose nickname was Ace, died on July 25 in Manhattan of complications from cancer. He was 86.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Outrage Builds in South Korea in Deadly Abuse of a Soldier
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The soldiers beat the 20-year-old private almost every day for more than a month. They flogged him with a mop handle until it broke. They made him eat toothpaste and lick their spittle off the floor. At one point, when he became groggy, they hooked him up to an intravenous drip, gave him nutrients and then, when he seemed to regain energy, they kicked and punched him some more.

title: Study Shows Third Gene as Indicator for Breast Cancer
description: Mutations in a gene called PALB2 raise the risk of breast cancer in women by almost as much as mutations in BRCA1 and BRCA2, the infamous genes implicated in most inherited cases of the disease, a team of researchers reported Wednesday.

title: Why Britains Cabinet Is a Clique of Posh White Men, Again
description: The leaders of Britains government once again became a clique of posh white men,an editorial in The Guardian said, when Sayeeda Warsi, the minister of faith in David Camerons cabinet, resigned Tuesday over the countrys policy toward the crisis in Gaza.

title: For Nondrivers, a Summer Stuck in the Passenger Seat
description: On any given Friday afternoon in the New York summer, offices clear out early, weekend bags are hoisted onto shoulders, and many of those city dwellers who are, in colder months, perfectly happy to live concrete-encircled lives  they who, like the poet and devoted New Yorker Frank OHara, cant even enjoy a blade of grass unless I know theres a subway handy  slide into cars and head out of town.

title: Lets Talk About Risk at the Metropolitan Opera
description: On the opening night of the Metropolitan Operas revelatory new production of Borodins Prince Igor in February, you might have expected some of the backstage bitterness over the labor talks then looming to seep into the performance.

title: Scotlands Debate: Stay Big or Go Small
description: On Sept. 18, Scotland is scheduled to vote on seceding from Britain. We take a look at the issues at stake for the Scottish people.

title: Proof That Voter Impersonation Almost Never Happens
description: An enduring Republican fantasy is that there are armies of fraudulent voters lurking in the baseboards of American life, waiting for the opportunity to crash the polls and undermine the electoral system. Its never really been clear who these voters are or how their schemes work; perhaps they are illegal immigrants casting votes for amnesty, or poor people seeking handouts. Most Republican politicians know these criminals dont actually exist, but they have found it useful to take advantage of the party bases pervasive fear of outsiders, just as when they shot down immigration reform. In this case, they persuaded the base of the need for voter ID laws to ensure ballot integrity, knowing the real effect would be to reduce Democratic turnout.

title: Armed Animals Dont Invent Themselves
description: Like millions of moviegoers over the weekend, Bill Mantlo watched Guardians of the Galaxy, the Marvel Studios space adventure that sold more than $172 million in tickets worldwide in its first four days of release.

title: Jewish Film Festival Is Withdrawn From London Theater
description: LONDON  The Tricycle Theater, which has hosted the UK Jewish Film Festival for the last eight years, says that in light of the conflict in Gaza it will not hold this years event in November if financing for the festival continues to be partly provided by the Israeli government.

title: Putin Bans Some Imports as Payback for Sanctions
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Searching for ways to hit back at Western sanctions without causing Russian consumers too much pain, President Vladimir V. Putin gave his government a broad mandate Wednesday to issue one-year bans on food and agricultural imports. But he included a proviso that the bans be lifted if they drive up prices or cause undue dependence on a single source.

title: Powering Up a Phone, No Cords Needed
description: IT may not seem hard to plug a cord into the wall to charge your mobile phone or tablet. Nonetheless, a number of companies are trying to figure out how to save us from the effort.

title: Taking Chances With Mix and Match
description: VAIL, Colo.  The choreographer Matthew Neenan seems to be one of the strange originals of American ballet. To judge from the works of his Ive seen, hes not remotely preoccupied by ballets virtuosity, hierarchy or orthodoxy. His taste in music includes pop, commissioned scores and classical music of the last two centuries. He makes dancers look vulnerable, openhearted and, above all, marvelously free. And he uses music to release different social and psychological layers in them. In consequence, his stage worlds, at their best, begin to have the complex reality of novels or plays.

title: Former Greek Central Banker Questioned on Bank Sale
description: Financial prosecutors in Greece are asking the former head of the central bank there to explain his actions in approving a bank sale to a Greek businessman later jailed on fraud charges.

title: Demure, Deadpan and Smutty, an Offshoot of Girl Power
description: Garfunkel and Oates are Riki Lindhome and Kate Micucci, a pair of comedians, actresses and songwriters who bear a glancing physical likeness to Art Garfunkel (Ms. Lindhome is tall and blond) and John Oates (Ms. Micucci is short and dark haired).

title: Targets Newest Dance Partner? Joseph Altuzarra
description: Eva Herzigova, creamy skinned and curvy, strides to her closet and slides apart its contents to make way for her latest fashion trophies. Moments later, she is assessing their impact in a full-length mirror, caressing their outlines, clearly enjoying their feel on her skin. The scene fades, and what looms on the screen is Targets familiar bulls-eye logo, beneath it

title: After the Mideast War, Taking Stock
description: To the Editor:

title: Keeping Youths Out of Adult Prisons
Learning to Think
description: To the Editor:

title: Progress on the F-35 Fighter Jet
description: To the Editor:

title: Greg Krelenstein Reads Fashions Crystal Ball
description: While walking home from Jivamukti Yoga in Union Square last February, Greg Krelenstein  arguably the least-conspicuous member of the D.J. collective Misshapes, who is now the editorial director at the Starworks Group, a fashion communications agency in New York, had a vision: Madonna and Katy Perry should appear together on the May cover of V Magazine.

title: With Met Show, Fame Finally Comes to Charles James
description: If fashion had a religious belief, Charles James would be at its core, the designer Ralph Rucci wrote in an email this week. The gospel is being preached at Charles James: Beyond Fashion, entering its final weekend at the Metropolitan Museum of Art Costume Institute and its renovated and rechristened Anna Wintour Costume Center. (Mr. Rucci contributed an appreciation of the designer to the accompanying catalog.) The show will run through Sunday.

title: Meet Charlotte Kemp Muhl, a Rock Star in the Making
description: AGE 26

title: Damn the Torpedoes!
description: Aug 5, 1864, 3 a.m. On a sultry night, 18 ships of the Union navy rest uneasily at anchor off the bar of Mobile Bay, Ala. Led by four ironclads, and strengthened by 14 experienced wooden warships, the Union flotilla is part of the West Gulf Blockading Squadron, commanded by Rear Adm. David G. Farragut. The admiral was the United Statess most experienced, and celebrated, flag officer. He had spent 51 years in the Navy: After service as a youth in the War of 1812, and fighting pirates in the West Indies, Farragut established his Civil War reputation by capturing New Orleans after a daring dash up the Mississippi.

title: Prostate Cancer Screening Still Not Recommended for All
description: A major European study has shown that blood test screening for prostate cancer saves lives, but doubts remain about whether the benefit is large enough to offset the harms caused by unnecessary biopsies and treatments that can render men incontinent and impotent.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza City and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza City, Israel, Ukraine and China.

title: Kittys Canteen on the Lower East Side
description: As the creative force behind the transgressive vaudeville shows at the Box nightclub on the Lower East Side, Richard Kimmel reignited New Yorks long-dormant desire for decadent, freak-flag night life. His next act, Kittys Canteen, a jazz bar and Jewish soul-food joint that looks like a New Orleans bordello run by a religious cat lady, nourishes the same craving in a more wholesome manner.

title: Rustic Vows: The Charm of Barn Weddings
description: To the Editor:

title: Street Style in Dakar, Senegal
description: Friday is a day for prayer in Dakar, Senegal, and a day to wear traditional Senegalese garb. In the downtown area of Plateau, the citys old cultural and commercial center, young Senegalese stroll around in modern looks that mix traditional garments with what locals call European style clothing.

title: Store Openings, New Collections and Sales Starting Aug. 7
description: Openings and Events

title: Hail Mary Softball
description: Were down by one, two outs, no men on, no men anywhere: This is bantam-division softball, and were 11-year-old girls. Michelle, our best player, is approaching the plate, helicoptering the bat over her head like this is the World Series and not just another Catholic Youth Organization game on a garbage-strewn blacktop in a far-flung corner of Queens.

title: Coffee Tables: Percolating From Ideas
description: For many designers, the chair is the ultimate challenge, the tabula rasa on which they aspire to make their creative mark. Not for Brad Ascalon.

title: Back on the Block
description: It was 1969, and Francis Mason, the dance writer, former cultural attach and assistant director of the Morgan Library, was walking down Charlton Street, marveling at the Federal-style townhouses that lined the streets north side. As his daughter, Leslie Mason, recalled recently, he rang the bell of one of the most lavish, handed his card to the young woman who answered the door and said, If its for rent, Ill take it. The young woman asked, Dont you want to see it?

title: How Important Is a Perfect Lawn When Youre Selling Your Home?
description: Q. How important is a perfect lawn when youre selling your home? Ours looks a little patchy.

title: Whats Behind Door No. 1?
description: Designed by Filippo Bombace for the Tuscan company Effeti, Screen is a kitchen that sits in the middle of the room, so you can move about freely and socialize as you cook.

title: Sales at Jonathan Adler, Ligne Roset SoHo, Lockwood Shop and Christofle
description: The Foster sofa is 40 percent off at Jonathan Adler, while supplies last (regularly $2,800, it is about $1,680); 53 Greene Street (Broome Street), 212-941-8950, jonathanadler.com.

title: Itll Be the Onion That Does the Crying
description: Knife sharpeners have always scared me, with all those detailed, anxiety-provoking instructions about how you have to hold the blade at exactly the right angle or who knows what disaster will befall you and your blade. But the new Professional Knife Sharpener from Brod & Taylor, is the first aesthetically pleasing one Ive ever seen. So as a pushover for good design, I decided to put aside my fears and give it a try.

title: Lightweight Lounging on Racecar Technology
description: Halo, a chair that will make its debut in prototype next month at the Designjunction show in London, is a simple design inspired by the two pieces of painted plywood that make up Poul Kjaerholms 1952 PK0 chair. But its material is decidedly 21st century: a new carbon fiber called Hypetex.

title: New York Patient Tests Negative for Ebola
description: A patient at a New York City hospital who recently traveled to West Africa and reported symptoms similar to those of the Ebola virus has tested negative for the disease, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Inviting Your Friends to Stay for a While
description: Last week, the British textile designer Donna Wilson introduced her first fabric collection, Forest and Friends, and its as quirky as her existing menagerie of knitted creatures and face-painted ceramics. Designing things that will make people smile and be happy just sort of comes naturally to me, she said. But Im always trying to get new inspiration so it doesnt get so predictable.

title: Reviving a Dyeing Technique
description: The simplest way to make indigo yarn and fabrics is to soak fibers in chemical dye. But Aboubakar Fofana, 46, a Malian-born artist and designer, recoils at the thought of a technique that is so undemanding. Indigo leaves for his dyeing vats have been ground with mortar and pestle, and the helpful bacteria that form there are fed often and sometimes given the chance to rest. The result is a shimmering blue that holds up even when left in the sun.

title: U.S. Military Deaths in Afghanistan
description: The Department of Defense has identified 2,327 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the death of the following American recently:

title: Treating His House Like a Museum
description: CHICAGO  With its cheerful yellow clapboard facade and white picket fence, the little house on Menomonee Street seems a bit lost among the imposing stone buildings and brick townhouses that surround it, as if it were dropped into the Old Town section of the city from another place and time. How cute! passers-by often remark, even if theyre alone. Theres just something about it that makes people stop and smile.

title: Greening the Gilded Age
description: DUBLIN, N.H.  It was a gray and cloudy morning, and the fog was rolling across the grounds of Stonlea (pronounced stone-LEE), a sprawling Gilded Age estate here on a hill overlooking Dublin Lake, with a view, on most days, of Mount Monadnock. Polly Guth, the 87-year-old owner, was leading a visitor on a house tour that featured lots of the expected Gilded Age-y things.

title: The Threats to Our Drinking Water
description: SAN FRANCISCO  THOSE of us who live in the United States are fortunate; generally we dont have to give a lot of thought to the safety of our tap water. This makes our collective experience with water very different from that of hundreds of millions of people across the globe who lack access to clean water.

title: The Muddled Road to Overhauling Corporate Taxes
description: Every loophole has its lover.

title: A Right Like Any Other
description: Listening to politicians talk about abortion, watching state legislatures put up ever more daunting obstacles, reading the opinions of judges who give the states a free pass, its abundantly clear to me that some constitutional rights are more equal than others. Or to put it another way, there are constitutional rights and then there is abortion  a right, increasingly, in name only, treated as something separate and apart, vulnerable in its isolation from the mainstream of those rights the Constitution actually protects.

title: Call It What You Like, but Not a Chain
description: WHITE CASTLE claims with pride that it is the first fast-food hamburger chain, and for good reason. It opened in 1921, just 15 years after Upton Sinclairs The Jungle exposed horrific conditions in meat-processing plants. With its pure-sounding name, white interiors and fully viewable food preparation areas, White Castle helped restore Americas appetite for beef, promising consistency regardless of which location a customer visited.

title: After a Separate Arrest, Bail Is Doubled for Teenage Driver in Fatal Accident
description: An unlicensed teenage driver who fatally struck a 4-year-old girl last year while fleeing the police was taken into custody on Wednesday after a state judge doubled his bail because he had been arrested and charged with another crime.

title: To Beat Putin, Support Ukraine
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  IN response to Russian support for Ukrainian rebels, and in coordination with European leaders, President Obama has instituted the most comprehensive set of economic sanctions ever against Russian officials and companies. Europe is considering alternate energy policies to reduce Russias economic leverage. NATO is re-energized. And moral, unified condemnation of Russias actions has damaged Russias international reputation.

title: Marijuana Legalization to Be on D.C. Ballot
description: District of Columbia residents will vote in November on whether to legalize marijuana, the Board of Elections said Wednesday. Officials said more than 27,000 signatures submitted by advocates in favor of the initiative were valid. The measure would allow adults to possess and cultivate, though not sell, limited amounts of the drug. The issue seems likely to set off a confrontation with Congress. Representative Andy Harris, Republican of Maryland, led an effort to block the District of Columbias law decriminalizing some marijuana possession, which took effect last month.

title: Areas of Autonomy, What Do They Mean
description: In voting to approve autonomy, the N.C.A.A. Division I board of directors will also vote to authorize the new Big 5 governance body to make rules within 11 explicitly articulated areas of autonomy.

title: 2 First Ladies Share Tales of Budding Partnership and Life in the Spotlight
description: WASHINGTON  In an era of deep divisions between the political parties, at least one high-profile friendship is developing across the aisle.

title: First Spouses Speak at Forum
description: Michelle Obama and Laura Bush joined former President George W. Bush at a symposium about women during the U.S.-Africa summit in Washington.

title: War Against Whites? I Think Not
description: When Representative Mo Brooks, Republican of Alabama, claimed earlier this week that Democrats were waging a war on whites, he lifted the lid on a simmering resentment that is very real and very resilient and feeds on anxiety  and fear  about a changing America, and the possibility of those changes upending historical architectures of privilege.

title: Is Big Data Spreading Inequality?
Lebanon: Border Standoff Eases
description: The clashes between the Lebanese Army and Sunni extremist fighters from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, who occupied a Lebanese border town last weekend, showed some signs of easing on Wednesday, as a cease-fire that had collapsed the day before was revived for 24 hours and the militant group, known as ISIS, released three of at least 13 hostages its fighters had seized. At least some of the fighters were reported to have withdrawn from the town, Arsal, and emergency aid workers were able to reach civilians trapped by five days of fighting. But sporadic shelling interrupted the cease-fire throughout the day as Lebanese troops tightened a cordon around the town. In a new sign of Arab concern about Lebanons stability, the army received $1 billion in assistance on Wednesday from Saudi Arabia, which has supported the insurgency against the Syrian government but has joined other nations in condemning ISIS as a destabilizing terrorist group.

title: New York City Libraries Struggle to Meet Demand for English-Language Classes
description: They came, one after another, through the glass doors of the Bronx Library Center, the largest public library in the borough. Some rode multiple trains or buses from home; others took precious time away from work. A few struggled with young children in tow.

title: Bowe Bergdahl Details Disappearance to General Leading an Inquiry
description: During his first interview with the general leading an investigation into his capture by the Taliban, Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl on Wednesday described details of his disappearance from his tiny combat outpost in eastern Afghanistan five years ago.

title: High and Dry in Pot Country
description: Californias drought is affecting agriculture including marijuana. Illegal growers are being blamed for stolen water and environmental damage. Small-scale farmers say the crop can be grown green.

title: Tearful Exit for Giants Wilson
description: David Wilson, the 23-year-old Giants running back who was advised by team doctors Monday that he should retire because of concerns about his neck and spinal cord, grew emotional Wednesday when he spoke about the support he had received from teammates and coaches.

title: Dry California Fights Illegal Use of Water for Cannabis
description: NICE, Calif.  An abandoned recreational vehicle was the first clue. In this hamlet two hours north of San Francisco and barely a mile from the largest natural freshwater lake in the state, the trailer sat on a hill, hidden from the main drag. Behind it rose a flimsy fence, tall enough to shield its bounty: 50 marijuana plants in hastily constructed wooden boxes.

title: Islamic Militants in Iraq Are Widely Loathed, Yet Action to Curb Them Is Elusive
description: UNITED NATIONS  Its fighters have seized oil fields, held water supplies hostage, and commandeered heavy artillery that the United States once supplied to a friendly government in Iraq. In late July, they decapitated Syrian soldiers, put their heads on fence posts and published photographs online. For the last five days, they have drawn the Lebanese Army into a firefight over control of a border town, their first territorial foray into Lebanon.

title: The Panda Angle
description: About politics and pandas ...

title: Peter Hall, Who Devised the Enterprise Zone, Dies at 82
description: Peter Hall, a British planner widely credited with developing the concept of enterprise zones to spur growth by reducing taxes and regulations in blighted urban areas, died on July 30 in London. He was 82.

title: No Merger of Sprint and T-Mobile US, but Plenty of Taunts
description: Since becoming the chief executive of T-Mobile US, John J. Legere has been known for being outspoken. Still, as his company held merger talks with Sprint for much of this year, he was noticeably restrained in criticizing his rival.

title: Sunni Extremists Repel Kurdish Forces in Iraq
description: BARTELLA, Iraq  Sunni extremists repelled efforts by Kurdish pesh merga forces on Wednesday to push them back in areas east of Mosul in northern Iraq, and shelled a predominantly Christian village there, in what appeared to be a renewed push along the Kurdish border to take ground, control oil fields and water resources and expel minority groups.

title: A Club Pro Contending for the P.G.A. Championship? Why Not?
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  One of the things that sets the P.G.A. Championship apart from the other golf majors is the tournaments deep connection to everyday club or teaching golf pros, a collection of about 27,000 players who are most commonly seen giving lessons or working behind the counter at golf facilities across the country.

title: Ebola Therapy From an Obscure Biotech Firm Is Hurried Along
description: Inside special isolation units at an Atlanta hospital on Wednesday, Kent Brantly and Nancy Writebol, the two Americans infected with Ebola in West Africa, appeared to be responding to an experimental medicine devised by an obscure biotechnology company with ties to the Defense Department.

title: Fighting Ebola for Us All
description: On July 23, Dr. Kent Brantly woke up with a fever. He immediately quarantined himself, and three days later a test confirmed his nightmare. He had the Ebola virus.

title: One Court, Three Judges and Four States With Gay Marriage Cases
description: CINCINNATI  The steady march of judicial approval for same-sex marriage over the past year ran into some skepticism here on Wednesday as a three-judge federal appeals panel heard arguments in six same-sex marriage cases from four states.

title: The Guns of August
description: The centenary of the epic carnage we know as World War I has generated a tide of analyses, commentaries, exhibitions and ceremonies. Many people have been drawn to visit the battlefields, memorials and cemeteries of Europe, trying to comprehend how civilized nations could have been reduced to a slaughter in which as many as 20 million soldiers and civilians suffered horrifying deaths. When confronted with so cataclysmic an event, it is difficult not to seek a moral, a lesson that can guide us away from a repetition of such horrors.

title: Israeli Premier Voices Regret for Civilian Casualties, but Blames Hamas
description: JERUSALEM  Facing withering international criticism of the Palestinian death toll in Gaza, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Wednesday that Israel deeply regretted every civilian casualty of its monthlong military campaign but that Hamas must be held accountable for the loss of life.

title: Eighth Day of Virginia Ex-Governors Trial Focuses on Role of His Wifes Chief of Staff
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Lawyers for Maureen McDonnell argued Wednesday in United States District Court that her chief of staff  and not Ms. McDonnell  had inappropriately wooed the support of the donor at the core of the corruption case against Ms. McDonnell and her husband, Bob McDonnell, the former governor of Virginia.

title: Making the Gaza Cease-Fire Last
description: In the first good news in a long time, a 72-hour cease-fire appeared to be holding on Wednesday as Israelis and Palestinians tallied what was lost, and gained, during the latest war over the desperate Gaza Strip.

title: Conflict Leaves Industry in Ashes and Gaza Reeling From Economic Toll
description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip  For nearly four decades, Al Awda Co. has stocked Gazas shelves with sweets and snacks, starting as a humble refugee-camp bakery and growing into a 180,000-square-foot factory with 600 workers.

title: A Healing That Wasnt: Liberal Activists and the Police Assail City Hall
description: Confronting the first civil rights test of his administration, Mayor Bill de Blasio is struggling to take command of a controversy over the police and race that has pitted his longtime liberal supporters against the police department he now depends on to keep the peace.

title: Avoid Cliches Like the Plague
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Heres how to get yourself completely messed up right out of the box with todays puzzle: Fill in LOANS instead of LENDS at 1 Across, then have your brain scream at you that NEMATODE is the only possible entry for 4 Down, even though there is not a nematode in the world that is known to cause allergies. I didnt say it made sense, but it does fit. And, of course, the answer is really DUST MITE.

title: Add a Sucker Punch to His Fight Card
description: The next time I walk into a theater and am faced with a boxing ring, I may be tempted to flee. For some reason, pugilism has become the flavor of the moment at the theater. There is Rocky, of course, but also the Muhammad Ali bio-drama Fetch Clay, Make Man (which Ive reviewed twice) and Tyson vs. Ali, an experimental play about those two famous champions. Im beginning to feel a little punch-drunk.

title: Cuomo Contests New York Residency of Teachout Before Primary
description: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo is doing his best to appear invincible as he seeks a second term. He generally avoids even mentioning that he faces a challenge in the Democratic primary, and with barely a month to go, he is making few public appearances.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Aug. 6, 2014
Obama Reluctant to Arm Ukraine
description: Speaking at the U.S.-Africa Leaders Summit, President Obama addressed the possibility of extending arms to Ukraine but said the best action now would be to try to get back on a political track.

title: As Meeting With African Leaders Winds Down, Policy Issues Take the Stage
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama, ending a landmark summit meeting with African leaders, said Wednesday that the United States was dispatching teams of health workers to West Africa to help contain an outbreak of the Ebola virus, but stopped short of pledging to send experimental drugs because he said he did not know enough about them.

title: Call to Police Preceded Deadly Long Island Explosion
description: Police officers were responding to a call from a house on Long Island on Tuesday night when a detached garage there exploded and burst into flames, the authorities said Wednesday.

title: In Greece, Migrants Are Desperate to Flee Again
description: PATRAS, Greece  On a recent morning, the young men began to drift back to the abandoned furniture factory, returning from the beach, the roofs of nearby construction sites and other hiding places where they had been sleeping.

title: Jesse L. Steinfeld, Surgeon General and Tobacco Foe, Dies at 87
description: Dr. Jesse L. Steinfeld, who as surgeon general in the Nixon administration spoke out against cigarette smoking, bringing new attention to the risks it posed to women and to people exposed to secondhand smoke, died on Tuesday in Pomona, Calif. He was 87.

title: Buzzing Before Game, Mets Then Fall Quietly
description: WASHINGTON  The day after another spectacular catch by Juan Lagares, the Mets were still buzzing. At the crack of Denard Spans bat Tuesday, Lagares made a beeline for shallow right-center field. He took long strides, not a step wasted. He could see the ball dropping, and with two outs and a runner on third base in the seventh inning, he wanted to save a run.

title: Boating With Friends, Girl, 16, Dies in Accident on Long Island Sound
description: GREENWICH, Conn.  A 16-year-old girl from here was killed and another was seriously injured in a boating accident on Wednesday afternoon on Long Island Sound, the police said.

title: Obama Emphasizes Ways to Limit Ebola
description: President Obama, speaking at the U.S.-Africa Leaders Summit, said the Ebola virus was controllable if you have a strong public health network in place.

title: Yanks Late Rally Gives Them Breathing Room, at a Cost
description: It had been so long since the Yankees had won by a comfortable margin that as they tacked on runs in the eighth inning Wednesday, each was cause for celebration. Or so it seemed.

title: Verlander Still Has His Aura, if Not Yet His Old Form
description: When Brad Ausmus lines up his playoff rotation this October, he might feel like Jerry Seinfeld planning to pick up a friend for coffee. Take the Porsche or the Rolls-Royce? Maybe the Jaguar or the Lamborghini? There is no wrong choice.

title: In Majors, Fowler Has Substance With Style
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Rickie Fowler played 18 holes at Valhalla Golf Club on Monday and Tuesday to prepare for the 96th P.G.A. Championship on a course he had not seen before. Before a little more practice Wednesday, his mood was of a relaxed man confident about his craft. Given Fowlers form in the first three major championships, there was no need to cram on the eve of the fourth.

title: 2 Khmer Rouge Leaders Are Convicted in Cambodia
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia  A court on Thursday found the two most senior surviving leaders of the Khmer Rouge, which brutalized Cambodia during the 1970s, guilty of crimes against humanity and sentenced them to life in prison.

title: Covered-Up Graffiti Tags as Art
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Get a Jump on Autumn With Classics From the Pre-Fall Collections
description: Summer is in full swing: glowing fireflies, humming air conditioners. But while weve all been living in gauzy dresses and sandals, the stores are suddenly stocked with nubby wool sweaters, oversized coats and Dr. Martens-inspired boots, thanks to the phenomenon known as the pre-fall collections. Though layering up may feel far-off, this is the optimal moment  before the September shopping rush  to start building a cool-weather wardrobe. And the current retail landscape includes some especially well-executed takes on the essentials, such as vintage Levis jeans, cool sneakers, a perfect ribbed turtleneck and a versatile miniature black doctors bag. While some of these pieces price tags are formidable, consider them an investment in your styles future. Get your hands on them now, before someone else does.

title: Google and Barnes & Noble Unite to Take On Amazon
description: Google and Barnes & Noble are joining forces to tackle their mutual rival Amazon, zeroing in on a service that Amazon has long dominated: the fast, cheap delivery of books.

title: Think Like a Doctor: Losing It
description: The Challenge: A 55-year-old man loses the hair on his legs, loses weight and then loses his strength. Can you figure out why?

title: Word of the Day | melee
description: melee \ma-la, ma-\ noun

title: Why the Hepatitis Cure Sovaldi Is a Budgetary Disaster for Prisons
description: Prisoners, unlike most Americans, have a constitutional right to medical care.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 6 P.M. (Starz Cinema) THE LAST DAYS OF DISCO (1998) The director Whit Stillman plumbs the malaise of the young and privileged in this tale about the New York nightclub scene of the early 1980s and two young denizens, the confident Charlotte (Kate Beckinsale) and her less-secure college chum Alice (Chlo Sevigny, above right, with Ms. Beckinsale). We look really good tonight, Charlotte tells Alice. Im sure were going to get in. Janet Maslin wrote in The New York Times: Humorously and fondly, with an entertaining supply of what he has called prosaic license, Mr. Stillman again displays a pitch-perfect ear for both the cattiness and the camaraderie that bind his characters into collective friendship. Weaving together the disco backdrop (clearly a labor of love) with more sharp-edged material about college graduates finding their first footing in New York and learning to cook with Campbells mushroom soup, he creates a bright panorama of shrewd young strivers.

title: Michael Phelps, Returning to Major Competition, Is 7th in 100 Freestyle
description: IRVINE, Calif.  For more than a decade, Michael Phelps was known for his numbing consistency. He won swim races in sickness and in health, despite bad starts, poor finishes, untied swim suits and malfunctioning goggles.

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, August 7, 2014
description: Whoever thought that one day a black woman would be standing judge over a white boy?

title: Corrections: August 7, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Ballet Theater Donating Trove of Materials to Library of Congress
description: George Balanchines 1947 contract for Theme and Variations is there. It stipulated that he would be paid $25 per performance in the first year, with his compensation falling to $15 by the third. Amid the mounds of papers also lies Jerome Robbinss 1944 contract for Fancy Free. As a novice choreographer, he was offered only $10 per performance, with no mention of the ballet being staged beyond one year. (Little did they know.)

title: Final Arguments in Pistorius Murder Trial Begin
description: PRETORIA, South Africa  The murder trial of Oscar Pistorius, the double-amputee sprinter accused of killing his girlfriend in a fit of rage, entered a decisive stage on Thursday as lawyers began two days of final arguments at the High Court here before handing over the case to the presiding judge.

title: Student Crossword | Natural Resources
description: Test your knowledge of natural resources by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Italian Coffee Producer Massimo Zanetti Seeks to List Shares
description: LONDON The Massimo Zanetti Beverage Group, the Italian coffee company that owns the Chock full oNuts, Kauai Coffee and Segafredo Zanetti brands, said on Thursday that it was planning to carry out an initial public offering later this year in Italy.

title: 6 Qs About the News | European Spacecraft Pulls Alongside Comet
description: In European Spacecraft Pulls Alongside Comet, Kenneth Chang writes about an unprecedented close study of a comet.

title: Has the Libertarian Moment Finally Arrived?
description: Lets say Ron Paul is Nirvana, said Kennedy, the television personality and former MTV host, by way of explaining the sort of politician who excites libertarians like herself. Like, the coolest, most amazing thing to come along in years, and the songs are nebulous but somehow meaningful, and the lead singer kills himself to preserve the bands legacy.

title: No Longer an Invisible Photographer
description: Vanessa Winship had gotten very good at getting the picture without getting noticed. But unlike street and documentary photographers who strive to be invisible, Ms. Winship was not happy.

title: Jihadists Rout Kurds in North and Seize Strategic Iraqi Dam
description: BAGHDAD  The crisis gripping Iraq escalated rapidly on Thursday with a re-energized Islamic State in Iraq and Syria storming new towns in the north and seizing a strategic dam as Iraqs most formidable military force, the Kurdish pesh merga, was routed in the face of the onslaught.

title: A Dylan Insiders Back Pages
description: LOS ANGELES  On a bright, cool afternoon in July, Jacob Maymudes sat on the deck of the small guesthouse he rents in the Los Feliz neighborhood here, reflecting on the strange journey of his first book, Another Side of Bob Dylan, which will be published on Sept. 9 and has already excited interest.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: Casper, an Online Mattress Start-Up, Raises $13.1 Million
description: How do you teach an old industry new tricks? Casper, a start-up based in New York, says its simple: You try to make it cool.

title: New York Today: A Better Egg Sandwich
description: Good morning on this lovely Thursday.

title: Russia Responds to Western Sanctions With Import Bans of Its Own
