description: UPS Stores, a subsidiary of United Parcel Service, said on Wednesday that a security breach may have led to the theft of customer credit and debit data at 51 UPS franchises in the United States.

title: Customized Trips from Smithsonian and Audley
description: They say two heads are better than one, but what about when it comes to travel planning?

title: To Boldly Go Where No Comrade Has ...
description: To the Polish author Stanislaw Lem, creating science fiction was itself a form of time travel. What the science-fiction work presents belongs to one time (most often the future), whereas how it tells its story belongs to another time, the present, he once wrote. Even if imagination succeeds in rendering plausible how it might be, it cannot break completely with the way of apprehending events that is peculiar to the here and now.

title: A Deal From the 15th World Youth Teams Championships
description: ISTANBUL  At the 15th World Youth Teams Championships here on Wednesday, the 56-board semifinals in the girls, youngsters and juniors events were played.

title: Shakespeares Preening Con Man, as Seen by Salieri, Then Updated
description: Antonio Salieri and his some 40 operas are not usually cited amid the incessant drumbeat of composer anniversaries in New York. But his birthday (Aug. 18) received a rare nod on Tuesday when the dellArte Opera Ensemble presented his Falstaff, a gem performed as part of the companys two-week A Summer of Shakespeare festival.

title: A Line Is Drawn in the Desert
description: There are two disciplines in which Silicon Valley entrepreneurs excel above almost everyone else. The first is making exorbitant amounts of money. The second is pretending they dont care about that money.

title: Mone Davis: A Woman Among Boys at the Little League World Series
description: Mone Davis, the ace of the Taney Dragons in the Little League World Series, spoke fluently about release points and the art of confronting batters who were uncomfortable hitting the ball to the opposite field. It was advanced stuff for any pitcher, let alone one who was 13 years old.

title: France Acknowledges Economic Malaise, Blaming Austerity
description: As Europe faces the prospect of its third recession in five years, France is quickly emerging as one of the weakest links among the 18 nations that share the euro.

title: A Fair Inquiry for Michael Brown
description: The violence on the streets of Ferguson, Mo., abated on Tuesday night, but hundreds of peaceful protesters continue to gather each day to demand justice in the case of Michael Brown, the unarmed black teenager who was shot by a white police officer on Aug. 9. Now its up to local and federal officials to show that they are aggressively pursuing that demand. They have a long way to go.

title: Sunny in Scotland
description: Sitting in the shadow of the University of Glasgows spire, the West End is home to lively bars, restaurants and premier art museums. But its the vast selection of affordable vintage clothing stores that drew Blossom Mccuaig to Byres Road for a day of shopping. Ms. Mccuaig indulged in the uncharacteristically sunny weather by pairing a white childrens tank top (admittedly borrowed from her little sister) and a black pencil skirt with flowers embroidered on the waist. She cites her grandparents wardrobe, old movies and local street style as her main inspirations. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Love Is Strange
description: Ira Sachs narrates a sequence from his film.

title: What Is So Special About Iyengar Yoga?
description: This week, the international yoga community said goodbye to a beloved teacher, B.K.S. Iyengar, who died at 95. He is credited with bringing yoga to the Western world and making it accessible to every age and walk of life. To learn more about what makes Iyengar yoga so special to those who practice it, I spoke with Carrie Owerko, a teacher at the Iyengar Yoga Institute of Greater New York. She was also a student of B.K.S. Iyengar, studying with him in India in February. Heres an edited version of our conversation.

title: Hey, Heres an Idea for a Show
description: LAS VEGAS  Jonathan and Drew Scott, the identical twins better known as the Property Brothers, after their hit home-renovation show, have for the last several years lived not in Vancouver, where they grew up, or Calgary, where they began buying and flipping houses as college students, or even Toronto or Los Angeles, where they spend months at a time filming, but here in the desert, where the temperature on a recent morning was a very un-Canadian 108 degrees.

title: Photographing Both Sides in Ukraine
description: Sometimes you accumulate too many sad moments, said Mauricio Lima, who has been on assignment for The Times in eastern Ukraine.

title: Life of a Yoga Guru
description: The New York Times reporter William J. Broad remembers B.K.S. Iyengar, who helped introduce the practice of yoga to the Western world. Iyengar, 95, died on Wednesday in the Indian city of Pune.

title: A Surreal Short Film From the New York Fashion Film Festival
description: In this new series, Chris Labzda and Bon Duke, the co-founders of the New York Fashion Film Festival, curate a short film each week for T.

title: In Raid to Save Foley and Other Hostages, U.S. Found None
description: EDGARTOWN, Mass.  A secret nighttime military mission authorized by President Obama to rescue Americans held captive in Syria failed early this summer when a team of two dozen Delta Force commandos raided an oil refinery in the northern part of the country but found after a firefight with Islamic militants that there were no hostages to be saved, administration officials said Wednesday.

title: Casting Call: Rethink Family Dinner With Jenny Rosenstrach
description: My friend Sarah is what you might call capable. Shes an emergency room surgeon in Salt Lake City; shes the mother of a 5-year-old; and she has just completed her ninth marathon in as many years. On a Friday last February, while my husband and I sat in her ridiculously organized kitchen, she poured each of us a glass of wine as we asked her a million questions about her day. She seemed shocked that we were so interested in hearing her E.R. stories. Removing appendixes, stabilizing car accident victims, saving lives  all in a days work. She put up with all of our questions, and then said something Ill never forget.

title: Digging Beyond the Headlines at the Monterey Classic-Car Auctions
description: Rob Sass offers his views on some notable, if not record-setting, cars auctioned during the week of the Pebble Beach Concours dlgance.

title: Flattering the Other Flowers
description: Sometimes when I am weeding in the late afternoon, I hear the vibrating wings of the ruby-throated hummingbird before I see it dipping its beak into the long tubular flowers of the blue anise sage (Salvia guaranitica) called Black and Blue for its cobalt-blue petals and near-black calyxes at the base of the flowers. Hummingbirds are shy, but if I remain perfectly still, it is usually so intent on the nectar inside those deep blue trumpets that I can admire it out of the corner of my eye as it backs out of one flower and moves on to another. Then, in a flash of iridescent green and red, it is gone.

title: More People Going to Switzerland for Assisted Suicide, Study Finds
description: Switzerland has long had a permissive law on assisted suicide, and a new study has found an increase in the number of people from other countries traveling to Switzerland to end their lives under the auspices of right-to-die organizations. The study, published in The Journal of Medical Ethics, looked at assisted suicides in Zurich, where Dignitas, the most prominent right-to-die organization, is based. The researchers found that 611 people from 31 countries had committed assisted suicide from 2008 to 2012. Since 2009, the number of those arriving from other countries for help with suicide has increased steadily, to 172 in 2012. Nearly half of all cases involved people with neurological disorders, like Parkinsons disease and multiple sclerosis, diagnoses that are generally not terminal. Nearly 60 percent of the 611 were women. People committing assisted suicide came largely from Germany, Britain and France. Twenty-one arrived from the United States: five in 2010, nine in 2011, and seven in 2012.

title: Storage Bins: To Have and to Hold
description: Without storage bins, no home is complete. Thats what the partners of Tilton Fenwick will tell you if you ask.

title: Ive Heard That Neutral Walls Are Best When Youre Selling Your Home. Does Grasscloth Qualify?
description: Q. Ive heard that when youre selling your home, its better to have neutral wall finishes. Does grasscloth qualify?

title: Designs That Outlived Their Benefactors
description: Woodlawn Cemetery, a national historic landmark in the Bronx that turned 150 last year, is celebrating with an exhibition on its spectacular Gilded Age tombs. Sylvan Cemetery: Architecture, Art and Landscape at Woodlawn, which opens on Sept. 3 at the Miriam and Ira D. Wallach Art Gallery at Columbia University, will offer a display of ironwork, sculpture, stained glass and furniture from the mausoleums along with records from the cemeterys voluminous archives, which were transferred to Columbia in 2006.

title: Why Jews Are Worried
description: ATLANTA  AN old Jewish joke goes like this: Whats the definition of a Jewish telegram? Start worrying. Details to follow.

title: Please Touch, Says the Bench
description: Libby Schrum designs and produces a variety of wood furniture in her studio in Camden, Me., but the Sibling bench ($3,100 and up) remains her signature piece. She takes nearly 10 days to make each one, using walnut, maple or any other wood with a straight grain, and traditional joinery (no nails!).

title: Shopping Made Psychic
description: AS almost everyone knows, we have entered a period in which companies can predict peoples purchases, often with uncanny accuracy. In the near future, they might even use those predictions to enroll you in special programs in which you receive goods and services, and are asked to pay for them, before you have actually chosen them. Call it predictive shopping.

title: Feeling Like Vinyl, Looking Like Silk
description: Overlay/Underlay, Kevin Walzs new collection of wallcovering for Wolf-Gordon, is dyed using translucent ink, to mimic the effect of paint seeping through canvas. So although it is industrially manufactured  and made of vinyl, no less  it looks like handmade silk-screens or block prints.

title: From Artisans to You, With a Click or Two
description: The Citizenry, a new online-only company, specializes in furniture and decorative accessories created by far-flung artisans.

title: Sales at Design Within Reach, Galerie Van den Akker and More
description: All upholstery is 20 percent off at Maine Cottage through Sunday, with the code SEATING20 (the Henry leather chair, regularly $3,180 to $3,420, is $2,544 to $2,736); 866-366-3505, mainecottage.com.

title: When Your Planter Could Use a Handle
description: Alissia Melka-Teichroews Strap Planters have more humble origins than their woven-leather design might suggest. In fact, they were inspired by products from McMaster-Carr, the hardware store catalog that has long been a beloved resource of industrial designers and builders.

title: By Any Means Necessary
description: The Affordable Care Act  Obamacare  has endured so many near-death experiences that digging into the details of still another effort to demolish it is admittedly not an inviting prospect. (My own reaction, I confess, to hearing some months back about the latest legal challenge  this one aimed at the supposed effect of a single word in the 900-page statute  was something along the lines of wake me when its over.)

title: Inside the World of Kidney Trafficking
Store Openings, New Collections and Sales Starting Aug. 21
description: Openings and Events

title: A Blank Slate, With Fig Trees
description: To Kevin Singer and Franois Richard, the American predilection for renovating an entire house as quickly as possible is confounding. And ill conceived.

title: The Tarot Card Reader
description: I thought I could hold it together, that if I was broadcasting crazy it was at least in a glamorous silent-film-star kind of way. Perfect eyeliner surrounding a glint of madness. But obviously I wasnt pulling it off. A friend intervened: Youre freaking me out. Im going to take you to a woman who has helped me out of tough times before. She set up the appointment and I washed up at her tarot card readers Manhattan apartment.

title: Nickel Allergies on Rise as Devices Meet Skin
description: As wearable devices become more popular, some doctors and consumers have expressed concerns about a lack of regulatory oversight to monitor the frequency of skin allergies and other reactions to certain metals or plastics used in the products.

title: Conservation, or Curation?
description: THE United States Fish and Wildlife Service  the main agency for the conservation of species  recently announced a new interpretation of the Endangered Species Act that severely limits its reach and retreats from the conservation ethic that healthy landscapes depend on native plants and animals.

title: Obamas Statement on James Foley
description: President Obama addressed the beheading of James Foley, an American journalist, by the terrorist group the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: Creating Ads During the MTV Video Music Awards
description: ALTHOUGH the target audience for the annual MTV Video Music Awards show is far too young to remember the era when Keep on truckin was a mantra, the MTV cable channel is taking the saying to heart by adding to its fleet of production trucks one devoted solely to helping advertisers create marketing content on Sunday before, during and after the 2014 show.

title: Hewlett-Packard Revenue and Cash Flow Improve, but Earnings Fall
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In nearly three years running Hewlett-Packard, Meg Whitman has restructured and managed costs at the technology giant, buying time for what had been a company in crisis. Whats not yet clear is whether she has built it a future.

title: When Doctors Have the Right to Speak
Obama on ISIS and James Foley
description: The president gave a statement on the beheading of an American journalist by militants in Syria in which he denounced the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and vowed to stay on course in Iraq.

title: Lawyers Spar in Florida Over Newest Voting Map
description: MIAMI  In the latest legal face-off over Floridas invalid congressional map, lawyers wrangled in court on Wednesday over the State Legislatures newest version. With the states primary days away, the judge weighed whether to approve the revised boundaries for seven districts.

title: Obama to Continue Fight Against ISIS
description: Saying that the United States would be vigilant and relentless in protecting its people, the president called the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria a cancer that must be extracted.

title: Tibetans Head for the Hills to Seek Unlikely Treasure
description: Quietly observant, Precious Caterpillar is a grass-roots documentary  or a dirt documentary, given that its devoted to watching Tibetans dig for caterpillar fungus.

title: House Panel on Benghazi Hires General for Legal Team
description: The House committee investigating the 2012 attack on the American diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, has chosen Lt. Gen. Dana K. Chipman as its chief counsel, a spokeswoman for the panels chairman said Wednesday. General Chipman retired in 2013 after four years as the Armys judge advocate general under President Obama, capping a 33-year career with the military. The House voted in May to form the committee to investigate whether the Obama administration misled Congress regarding its response to the attack and its aftermath, and Representative Trey Gowdy, Republican of South Carolina, was named chairman.

title: A Cinematic Wraith That Just Wont Die
description: Quick, name a movie from the 1970s thats full of bawdy rock tunes, cartoon gore and camp humor, one that offers a big flirty wink at its knowing devotees and just feels more appropriate when screened at midnight?

title: Rifts in a Crimean Art Colony
description: The Crimean town of Koktebel was a tolerant oasis for artists and writers in the midst of Soviet repression. Now, its residents are divided by the Russian annexation of Crimea.

title: Tell It to the Camera
description: Amanda Curtis, a 34-year-old high school math teacher, is now the Democrats U.S. Senate candidate in Montana. Finally, a strategy for bringing down the average age of a senator, which is around 62.

title: New Era in Safety When Cars Talk to One Another
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  A driver moves along in traffic, the forward view blocked by a truck or a bend in the road. Suddenly, up ahead, someone slams on the brake. Tires screech.

title: Annexation of Crimea Divides an Artist Colony Founded on Tolerance
description: KOKTEBEL, Crimea  In Soviet times, when favored artists received a government stipend to summer here on Crimeas southern coast, a metal billboard by the beach read in bold letters: Be quiet! Writers are working!

title: Inspiring Dialogue, Not Dissent, in China
description: BEIJING  When the Tibetan farmer Zantas husband died, she was forced by local custom to move in with her in-laws, who forbade her son to attend school. Instead, she packed up and moved to Beijing, where she was helped by a relative from another lifetime.

title: The City Council Speakers Honesty
description: The City Council speaker, Melissa Mark-Viverito, told the world via Twitter on Sunday that she was infected with human papillomavirus, a highly common sexually transmitted infection. She is a reticent person, as public officials go, and, even in an age of oversharing, her candor was startling.

title: The Movie Crypt at the Top of the Stairs
description: The Midtown Manhattan building that houses DuArt, the premiere hatchery of American independent cinema for about 70 years, is 12 stories high. The elevator only goes to the 11th floor. To reach DuArts rooms of wonder, you need to take the stairs.

title: Kings of Their Very Own Genres
description: Ah, Christmas in summer: The holiday season is traditionally the time for lavish boxed sets, but two Blu-ray anthologies, both released on July 29, have set the Internet, or at least its cinephile component, aflame. Herzog: The Collection, a 13-disc box from Shout! Factory, and Twin Peaks  The Entire Mystery, a 10-disc box from CBS-Paramount, are not only deluxe packages but also deluxe packages personally supervised, and in the case of Herzog even signed, by their supremely idiosyncratic artists.

title: Texas Car Lender Is Accused of Distortion in Subprime Inquiry
description: The cycle is a familiar one on Wall Street. First comes a lending boom. And then, after the abuses and excesses of a bubble, there is the government crackdown.

title: Ebola and the Problem of Panic
description: Unrest in a slum in Monrovia, Liberia, is a case study for the panic and challenges doctors and patients face in poor, densely populated urban areas.

title: A New Entry Is Shaking Up Brazils Vote
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  As the daughter of impoverished rubber tappers in the far reaches of the Brazilian Amazon, Marina Silva learned how to read as a teenager and worked as a maid before entering politics as an icon of the environmental movement. Now, with a trajectory appealing to big parts of Brazils electorate, Ms. Silva is stirring an acutely competitive presidential race.

title: De Blasio, Seeking Calm in Chokehold Case, Turns to Clergy
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio gathered with religious leaders on Wednesday in a renewed attempt to ease tensions surrounding the death of a black Staten Island man in police custody, as he strives to show leadership on a controversy that has aggravated racial divisions ahead of a protest march this weekend.

title: Bank of America Expected to Settle Huge Mortgage Case for $16.65 Billion
description: Updated, 7:38 a.m. |

title: Toiling to Succeed: First in the Pool, Then at the Bank
description: SOUTHPORT, Australia  At this weeks Pan Pacific Championships, Claire Donahues job is not on the line, but her paycheck is. Donahue owns the 13th-fastest time in the world in the 100-meter butterfly, the event in which she finished seventh at the London Olympics. To retain her post-N.C.A.A. stipend of $3,250 a month, which has been her primary source of income since she graduated from Western Kentucky in 2011, Donahue must be in the top 12.

title: Former Aropostale Executive Is Sentenced to 8 Years for Fraud
description: With the press of a button, the secret audiotaping of the firing on the 22nd floor of Aropostales headquarters in Herald Square was underway.

title: Quackery and Abortion Rights
description: The deception behind the wave of state-level abortion restrictions now threatening womens access to safe and legal abortions was strikingly revealed during a trial that ended last week in Texas.

title: Chaos in Ferguson Is Fueled by Tangle of Leadership
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  James Knowles III, the mayor of this beleaguered city, says he has watched in frustration as local, county and state officials have sent opposing signals, changed course and, at times, failed to talk to one another  what has been viewed as a collective failure of leadership from his office on up.

title: In Ferguson, Scrutiny on Police Is Growing
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  Early one morning in September 2011, an unarmed 31-year-old black man ran down a residential street here yelling at cars while he pounded his hands on them.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for August 20, 2014
Will You Be Seated on a Jury?
description: You have been called for jury duty. But are you the kind of juror that the lawyers want?

title: From Missouri to Syria, Journalists Are Becoming Targets
description: Islamic extremist fighters forced a freelance reporter, James Foley, to read propaganda celebrating their cause, and then beheaded him in a Middle Eastern desert. Another American journalist is next, they warned. In Iran, Jason Rezaian, a reporter for The Washington Post, was snatched by men waving an arrest warrant in late July. He has not been heard from since. In Afghanistan, Matthew Rosenberg, a reporter for The New York Times, was ordered expelled from the country because government officials did not like his stories.

title: TV Habits? Medical History? Tests for Jury Duty Get Personal
description: Do you believe in an eye for an eye? What do your parents do for a living? Do you watch CSI? Dateline? Read PerezHilton.com? Have you ever undergone a medical procedure that required an anesthetic?

title: St. Louis County Prosecutor Defends Objectivity
description: CLAYTON, Mo.  It was a summer evening 50 years ago when a knife-wielding kidnapper made the kind of malevolent move that defines a boy for life: The kidnapper snatched a police officers gun and used it to kill a canine officer, leaving 12-year-old Robert P. McCulloch without his father.

title: A Young Players Achievements Resonate Beyond a Sport
description: SOUTH WILLIAMSPORT, Pa.  Fans lined up Wednesday at 7:30 a.m. for free tickets to see Mone Davis and the Taney Dragons of Philadelphia, although Davis would not pitch for another 12 hours.

title: False 911 Call Placed by Louis Segna on Sept. 1, 2012
description: When making one of the calls that led to the charges against him, Mr. Segna reported what he said sounded like explosions inside the Bedford Avenue L train station.

title: False 911 Call Placed by Louis Segna on Dec. 31, 2012
description: When making one of the calls that led to the charges against him, Mr. Segna used a fake name, Dillman, while reporting that he had been threatened by a man at a bar on Bedford Avenue in Williamsburg.

title: Brooklyn Man Is Convicted of Making False 911 Calls
description: A man who was a regular at police precinct community council meetings in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, was convicted on Wednesday of making a rash of fake calls to the citys 911 system, concealing his identity while urging the police to rush to fictional incidents in the neighborhood.

title: Complaint Against the Ferguson Police Department
description: Several lawsuits have been filed in recent years that raise questions about excessive use of force or civil rights violations by the department.

title: Anger, Hurt and Moments of Hope in Ferguson
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The long, white bus emerged from a dark side street earlier in the week. Through the tinted windows, people on the street could see flashing lights and bodies moving to a beat. It was a party bus.

title: An American Voice on Ukraines Front Lines Goes Silent
description: Amid the cacophony of voices on Twitter reporting facts, rumors and hearsay on the battle for control of eastern Ukraine this summer, one feed, written by a Ukrainian-American Bruce Springsteen fan who volunteered to fight the Russian-backed separatists, has offered a no-nonsense account of life on the front lines of what the government in Kiev calls its Anti-Terrorist Operation, or ATO.

title: A Major Champion Adjusts to Life as a Major Celebrity
description: PARAMUS, N.J.  As Rory McIlroy passed through a phalanx of autograph seekers on his way to the 18th tee during pro-am play Wednesday morning at Ridgewood Country Club here, a womans voice rang out.

title: What Started as a Local Protest in Missouri Grows Into a Center of National Activism
description: On Tuesday, Mikki Kendall was in her Chicago home, watching live streams on her laptop as protesters and the police played out a 10th straight day of confrontation in the streets of Ferguson, Mo. On Wednesday, she was on the road, headed 300 miles to offer demonstrators her services as a former Army medic.

title: Before Killing James Foley, ISIS Demanded Ransom From U.S.
description: Kneeling in the dirt in a desert somewhere in the Middle East, James Foley lost his life this week at the hands of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. Before pulling out the knife used to decapitate him, his masked executioner explained that he was killing the 40-year-old American journalist in retaliation for the recent United States airstrikes against the terrorist group in Iraq.

title: Terence Todman, an Envoy to 6 Nations, Is Dead at 88
description: Terence A. Todman, who as United States ambassador to six nations and the first black person to head a geographic division of the State Department was known for candor, adroit negotiating and relentless efforts to bring more minorities to the Foreign Service, died on Aug. 13 on St. Thomas in the United States Virgin Islands. He was 88.

title: Mail Conveniences
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Once again, the rebus gods were not working in my favor. I knew something was going on, because I was unable to get very far in Jules P. Markeys puzzle on the first pass.

title: Hint of Scandal Embroils Queens Librarys Leaders
description: There it is atop the Queens Public Librarys headquarters: The roof deck at the heart of an inquiry into misused money, where some say the president of the library, Thomas W. Galante, likes to take cigarette breaks.

title: Sylvia Hassenfeld, Philanthropist From Hasbros Founding Family, Dies at 93
description: Sylvia Hassenfeld, the matriarch of the founding family of Hasbro, the maker of G.I. Joe, Mr. Potato Head and the Transformers, who became a path-making philanthropist and one of the first women to head a major international Jewish aid organization, died on Saturday at her home in Manhattan. She was 93.

title: Gaza Cost Far Exceeds Estimate, Official Says
description: UNITED NATIONS  The United Nations drastically underestimated the devastation that could result from possible assaults by Israel on Gaza this year, with 350,000 people so far displaced from a six-week-old conflict  seven times the 50,000 foreseen in its contingency plan, the top Unicef official for the crowded Palestinian enclave said Wednesday.

title: Dollar General Questions Motivation of Rivals C.E.O.
description: Chief executives routinely pledge to do whats best for their investors, especially when it comes to selling a company.

title: Nestl Moves Toward Humane Treatment of Animals at Its Suppliers
description: Nestl, one of the worlds largest food companies, is adopting animal welfare standards that will affect 7,300 of its suppliers around the globe, and their suppliers.

title: Vandalism at the Whitney Museum of Art
description: A man who was photographed by a bystander splashed a red substance on a blank gallery wall on the third floor of the Whitney Museum of Art on Wednesday, the police said.

title: AvantCredit, a Lender, Secures Credit Facility From Jefferies
description: An online lender trying to challenge major banks has received a vote of confidence from Wall Street.

title: Yankees Cautious About Pineda in Loss That Damages Their Playoff Hopes
description: The Yankees will surely wonder what the season might have been like with Michael Pineda in their rotation for the entire year.

title: Mone Davis Shows the Boys How Its Done
description: The 13-year-old pitching phenomenon Mone Davis has captured the nations attention with her strong performance in the 2014 Little League World Series.

title: Constructing a Conversation on Race
description: The killing of an unarmed teenager, Michael Brown, by a police officer, Darren Wilson, and the protests that have followed have brought about calls for the much-ballyhooed  or bemoaned, depending on your perspective  conversation about race.

title: Junta Leader Is Named New Premier of Thailand
description: The army general who led the overthrow of Thailands elected government in May was named prime minister on Thursday by a rubber-stamp legislature, sealing the militarys acquisition of near-absolute power in a country once considered a regional beacon of political freedom.

title: The Great American Designs of Tom Scheerer
description: With his modest nature, Tom Scheerer often finds himself acting the role of bemused bystander in the opulent and self-promoting world of interior design. As a decorator, he has forged a career doing rooms that are relaxed to the point of being hard to categorize as decorated; this is the idea, an observation he would take as a high compliment. There is a Scheerer style, involving limed pecky cypress, Saarinen tables and Thonet bentwood chairs, but it is actually more of a philosophy than a style. Elegance, he says, is really about economy.

title: A Romantic Inclination
description: A romantic inclination toward portrait necklines and cinched waists is giving classical tailoring a more feminine spirit.

title: The Big Easy
description: Enveloping knits, dramatically long, loose and oversize, are fashions generous solution to the practicalities of a life on the go.

title: A Narrative Thread
description: In rebranding one of the oldest fabric companies in the country, a new creative director finds inspiration in Schumachers rich history.

title: Patricia Heals Melancholy Images of a Lost Time and Place
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: The Facts and Figures Behind Vogue Magazine
description: The glossy has spawned an industry of imitators, two documentaries, a major Hollywood film and, perhaps most enduringly, a modern dance craze. Its also gone through some serious changes over the course of its 121 years in print. (See the 10 most groundbreaking covers in the history of Vogue here.) In recent years, the fashion bible has traded willowy models for celebrities of all kinds, a trend that reached its apex in April when the left-leaning, Chanel-shaded Brit Anna Wintour (the magazines seventh editor in chief) decided to put  gasp!  a reality star on its cover. But even with young upstarts nipping at its Manolos, the periodical that popularized tights and the L.B.D. continues to thrive under its time-tested principle. That is, while other magazines teach women whats new in fashion, Vogue teaches them whats in vogue. Here, a look at the facts and figures behind fashions foremost franchise.

title: Popular and Free, SoundCloud Is Now Ready for Ads
description: SoundCloud is the ubiquitous wild child of the digital music world. Without paying artists or record companies, it lets people freely upload and stream any kind of audio, and musicians have embraced it as a way to share their hottest work with fans.

title: Word of the Day | dawdle
description: dawdle \do-dl\ verb

title: Is Breakfast Overrated?
description: For years, weve heard that breakfast is the most important meal of the day. But scientific support for that idea has been surprisingly meager, and a spate of new research at several different universities  published in multiple articles in the August issue of The American Journal of Clinical Nutrition  could change the way we think about early-hours eating.

title: Food and the Dying Patient
description: The patient had dementia and could no longer swallow. The intricate workings of the muscles of her throat were failing, and she was no longer able to move food or liquids reliably into her stomach.Instead, they too frequently ended up in her lungs, and she drowned a little more with every swallow. She was admitted to my intensive care service with pneumonia from aspirated food that had turned the bottom part of her left lung into a wet sponge. Her blood oxygen levels had dropped so low that we had to support her breathing by inserting a tube.

title: How a Part-Time Pay Penalty Hits Working Mothers
description: Women get paid less than men in almost all jobs, but when women in low-wage jobs need to take time off work to care for children, they are at an even greater disadvantage.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 4:45 P.M. (Showtime 2) KIDNAPPED FOR CHRIST (2014) Kate Logan was a young evangelical when she traveled to the Dominican Republic to document life at a Christian boarding school, now defunct, called Escuela Caribe, one of hundreds of small schools to which American parents send their supposedly troubled teenagers. Once there, Ms. Logan (above right, with Tai, a student) hoped to make a record of young lives changing for the better. Instead, she met Beth, a 15-year-old who was punished with beatings and stints in solitary confinement, and a gay teenager named David, whose parents arranged for his midnight abduction from his home in Colorado and his relocation to the school, where they hoped strict discipline and aggressive Christianity might change his sexual orientation. The resulting documentary is important, if imperfect, Neil Genzlinger wrote in The New York Times. Ms. Logan makes the young-filmmaker mistake of injecting herself into the story, he said. Its not necessary; the students tales are whats important.

title: Corrections: August 21, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, August 21, 2014
description: The United States of America will continue to do what we must do to protect our people. We will be vigilant, and we will be relentless.

title: After Personal Losses, Jets Darrin Walls Learns to Appreciate What He Has
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Before the Jets face the Giants in their annual preseason matchup Friday night at MetLife Stadium, the Jets Darrin Walls plans to keep to his custom of kneeling in one end zone and praying for four people dear to him who have died in the last 17 months.

title: Chinese Group Calls on Japan to Hand Over Tang-Era Stele
description: At some point between 1906 and 1908  no one is sure precisely when  the Japanese military removed a nine-ton Tang dynasty stele from Lushun, the northeastern city also known then as Port Arthur, and shipped it to Tokyo, a trophy of Japans victory over the Russians in 1905.

title: New Map Shows Chinas True Expanse, General Says
description: Two new maps being issued in China this summer are stirring debate across Asia. The first, an ambitious vertical map issued in June by the Hunan Map Publishing House, uses 10 dashes around the South China Sea to broadly delineate Chinas claims to contested waters, shoals, rocks, reefs and islands there. The second is being distributed to units of the Peoples Liberation Army. Military officials have said it is the armys first major revision of a map in 30 years.

title: Student Crossword | Japan
description: Test your knowledge of Japan by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Israel Kills 3 Top Hamas Leaders as Latest Fighting Turns Its Way
description: JERUSALEM  Hamas is the party that keeps extending this summers bloody battle in the Gaza Strip, repeatedly breaking temporary truces and vowing to endlessly fire rockets into Israel until its demands are met. But the latest round of fighting appears to have given Israel the upper hand in a conflict that has already outlasted all expectations and is increasingly becoming a war of attrition.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Clashes Erupt as Liberia Imposes Quarantine to Curb Ebola
description: In Clashes Erupt as Liberia Imposes Quarantine to Curb Ebola, Norimitsu Onishi reports on a dangerous new chapter in West Africas five-month fight against the Ebola epidemic.

title: National Guard Is Pulling Out of Ferguson as Tensions Ease
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  Gov. Jay Nixon ordered the Missouri National Guard to begin a withdrawal from this small city on Thursday, signaling that the authorities believed they had largely restored order after nearly two weeks of unrest set off by the police shooting of an unarmed, 18-year-old black man.

title: What Are the Best Small Towns in America?
description: Rankingthe habitability of major cities is a favorite pastime of sociologists, economists and urban-planning enthusiasts the world over. The World Health Organization estimates that more than half of humanity resides in urban areas (expected to rise to 7 out of 10 by 2050), but a sizable chunk of us favor small-town charm to metropolitanhustle-and-bustle.

title: Eugenie Bouchard Could Be Tenniss Next Big Shot
description: The sun was just starting to fade on the evening of Aug. 5 when Eugenie Bouchard, the eighth-ranked womens tennis player in the world, walked onto center court at the Rogers Cup tournament in Montreal. Immediately the audience rose to its feet and roared. Bouchard, who grew up five miles from the stadium, approached her chair, eyes trained on the ground. As she put down her tennis bag and took out her racket, the audience continued clapping, cheering and whistling. She arranged a towel across the seat of her chair and another across its back, and still the ovation went on. Finally, when it became clear that Bouchard did not intend to acknowledge the frenzy with so much as a wave, the crowd sat, reducing its din to the usual prematch hum. Bouchards composure and focus, for which commentators in countless languages have praised her, was partly what drew 11,000 fans to fill the stands for a second-round match. She would smile, maybe, when she won.

title: Photographing Both Sides in Ukraine
description: Mauricio Lima has been on assignment for The New York Times in eastern Ukraine for the last month. He had previously covered Ukraine for The Times from February through May. His conversation with James Estrin has been edited.

title: New York Today: The Easiest, Hardest Month
description: Good morning to you on this sunny-cloudy Thursday.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: Peter Thiels Mithril Invests in DoubleDutch, an Events App
description: It has become a common refrain among Silicon Valley entrepreneurs: We didnt need to raise money, but we did anyway.

title: European Banks Expect Only Limited Impact From Sanctions on Russia
description: LONDON  For now, European banks with exposure to Russia dont appear too concerned about the effect on their bottom lines of economic sanctions against Moscow, but that outlook could change if the sanctions linger.

title: Daily Report: SoundCloud Decides Its Time to Grow Up
description: SoundCloud is the wild child of the digital music world. Without paying artists or record companies, it lets people freely upload and stream any kind of audio, and musicians have embraced it as a way to share their hottest work with fans, Ben Sisario reports.

title: Myanmar Regresses on Rights
description: When Myanmars military junta dissolved itself in 2011, the country took steps to transition to a more democratic society, including releasing political prisoners and relaxing restrictions on the press. But, its progress toward democracy has stalled.

title: Throwback Thursday | The 1959 Little League World Series
description: The news from this years  Little League World Series  the 68th  has been all about Mone Davis, the first female pitcher in Little League World Series history to earn a win, but in 1959 homesick boys from Hawaii, playing in Williamsport, Pa., just days after Hawaii became the 50th state, were the focus.

title: China Says 5 in Sect Killed Woman Who Wouldnt Join
description: HONG KONG  Five defendants went on trial in eastern China on Thursday, accused of beating and kicking a woman to death in a McDonalds restaurant after she resisted their attempt to recruit her into a sect that has been condemned by the government as a malignant cult.

title: Morning Agenda: Bank of America Nears Huge Settlement
description: The Justice Department is set to announce a $16.65 billion settlement with Bank of America over accusations that it duped investors into buying troubled mortgage securities, DealBooks Ben Protess, Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Michael Corkery write, according to people briefed on the matter. The accord would be the biggest government settlement by a company in American history. Prosecutors are also preparing a separate civil case against Angelo Mozilo, the man who came to embody the risk-taking for which Bank of America is now paying dearly, a rare move against a senior executive at the center of the financial crisis.

title: Till Real Estate Do You Part
description: From the first moments we see them together  waking, washing and dressing in the Manhattan apartment they have shared for decades  it is clear that Ben (John Lithgow) and George (Alfred Molina) are a walking illustration of the phrase old married couple. They know each other so well and have adapted, graciously and sometimes a little fractiously, to each others peculiarities. State law, at long last, has caught up with the reality of their relationship: The first scenes in Ira Sachss Love Is Strange take place on the morning of George and Bens marriage, which is solemnized in an alfresco ceremony followed by a relaxed and lively party at home.

title: The True Price of Customer Service
description: When I started my custom picture framing company 36 years ago, I was one of the first to offer a one-week turnaround in an industry that was used to making people wait anywhere from weeks to months for their framing to be completed. This required carrying a good inventory, having a flexible staff, and maintaining the systems and commitment to do so.

title: Virginia Ex-Governor Chronicles Unraveling Marriage at Trial
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Former Gov. Bob McDonnell of Virginia began his second day of testimony on Thursday seemingly holding back tears as he conceded to his lawyer that detailing the woes of his 38-year marriage was going to be hard.

title: Fresh Data Reflect Anemic Growth in Eurozone
description: PARIS  The eurozone economy is still expanding, but only feebly, according to a private sector report released on Thursday that provided further confirmation that the regions fragile expansion was only slightly better than outright stagnation.

title: Chinese Journalists Barred From Canadian Leaders Trip
description: A familiar scenario features a Western journalist battling restrictions in Chinas state-controlled press environment. But this week, it was Chinese journalists who found themselves shut out in free-press Canada after a reporter from Peoples Daily, the newspaper of the ruling Communist Party, fought for the right to ask a question of Prime Minister Stephen Harper.

title: Family Dollar Rejects Takeover Bid by Dollar General, Citing Antitrust Concerns
description: The fight for one of Americas biggest deep-discount stores isnt over who is willing to pay top dollar, at least for now.

title: Poll Finds Racial Divide in Viewing Response to Ferguson Unrest
description: The latest New York Times/CBS News poll reveals a racial divide in how Americans view the reactions of the president and the Missouri governor to the turbulence and disorder set off by the fatal shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, Mo.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Trunk Open, but No Theft
description: Dear Diary:

title: The 10 Most Groundbreaking Covers in the History of Vogue
description: The conversation that follows the release of each new issue of Vogue is often less about whats inside its pages than it is about what  or who  is on its cover. Over its 121 years in print, the title that Anna Wintour once called a glamorous girlfriend has served as the ultimate stamp of approval for the fashionable and famous, with models and film starlets (and occasionally, men) posing for the worlds most famous photographers. And while changing times have dictated a shift in philosophy  in particular, a move away from the supermodels of Diana Vreelands Vogue in favor of buzzy millennials like Lena Dunham and Lupita Nyongo  the glossys ability to move the cultural needle remains intact. Here, a look back at 10 of the most important covers from Vogues celebrated history.

title: Disney Unveils New Star Wars Game for Mobile Devices
description: LOS ANGELES  Disneys 20-month effort to integrate Star Wars into its Magic Kingdom appears to be hitting light speed.

title: Boston Suspects Friend Changes Plea to Guilty
description: BOSTON  A college friend of the surviving Boston Marathon bombing suspect, who denied last year that he hindered the investigation into blasts at the finish line of the race, changed his plea to guilty on Thursday.

title: Documents on Bank of America
description: The Justice Department announced a $16.65 billion settlement with Bank of America over accusations that it duped investors into buying troubled mortgage securities  the single largest government settlement by a company in American history.

title: How Scottish Independence Relates to Larger Tax Fights
description: LONDON  The roiling debate over Scottish independence from Britain  set to be decided by a referendum in Scotland next month  has thrust the usually sleepy area of national currencies into the spotlight.

title: Albert Reynolds Dies at 81; Peacemaking Irish Premier
description: DUBLIN  Albert Reynolds, the former Irish prime minister who played an important role in forging peace in Northern Ireland, died on Thursday at his home in Dublin. He was 81.

title: Bank of Americas $16 Billion Mortgage Settlement Less Painful Than It Looks
description: The Justice Department said on Thursday that it had so far recovered nearly $37 billion from big banks for their role in selling shoddy mortgages before the financial crisis.

title: 1914: Tsars Troops on Road to Berlin
description: ROME The Russian Embassy here confirms the news that the Russians have brought off a decisive victory at Gumbinnen. It is even more important than was stated in the official bulletins. As the result of this victory, obtained after a battle of four days, all further resistance on the part of the Germans is impossible. Indeed, the Russian forces are entering Germany with forces seven times superior to those with which the Germans can attempt to match them. The intention of the Russian general staff is to march direct on Berlin.

title: Sears Posts a First-Half Loss of Nearly $1 Billion
description: Sears Holdings announced on Thursday that it had lost nearly a billion dollars in the first six months of the year.

title: A Failed Love and a Museums Birth
description: Somewhere in New Jersey in the early 1950s, an artist who was once famous and his wife live alone in an oceanside mansion. Bitter, aging and in ill health, he hasnt painted for more than 10 years. One day, the couple receive a visitor, an imperious woman of a certain age. She and the painter had once been lovers. An artist herself, as well as a museum curator with considerable financial resources, she had been a zealous supporter of his career. But theyd broken up a decade earlier and hadnt seen each other since.

title: The Simpsons': Your Must-Watch Episodes
description: On Tuesday, four Times editors shared their must-watch episodes of The Simpsons ahead of the FXX Networks Every Simpsons Ever marathon, which begins 10 a.m. Thursday, and asked readers to pick their own. Nearly 150 comments were submitted on the ArtsBeat blog and more than 400 were posted on The Timess Facebook page.

title: The Object Lesson Takes Top Prize at Edinburgh Festival Fringe
description: EDINBURGH  The Object Lesson, a funny, sweet and meticulously crafted production examining our relationship to the many objects we encounter during the course of our lives, created and performed by Geoff Sobelle (All Wear Bowlers) is the winner of the 2014 Carol Tambor Best of Edinburgh award, to be announced in a ceremony in Scotland on Thursday.

title: Paula Long of DataGravity, on Mutual Accountability
description: This interview with Paula Long, chief executive of DataGravity, a data management firm, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: 1889: President Carnot Leaves Paris
description: President Carnot left Paris for Fontainebleau yesterday afternoon by the Gare de Lyon, where a few hundred persons were waiting in the drenching rain to wish him and his wife bon voyage and a pleasant fortnights holiday. The directors of the railway company had a waiting room specially arranged, and presented to Mme. Carnot a magnificent bouquet. President Carnot, on his way to the station, happened to come across a large body of English tourists. The Britishers, who heard that the President was coming, raised a real English Hip, hip, hip, hurrah! that nearly raised the roof off the Presidential carriage. The New York Herald, European Edition, Aug. 22, 1889

title: Hawks Crying Wolf
description: Binyamin Appelbaum:

title: The Euro Catastrophe
description: Matt OBrien points out that Europe really is doing worse than it did in the Great Depression. Meanwhile, Francois Hollande  whose spinelessness and willingness to buy into austerity doomed his presidency and quite possibly the European project  is finally, tentatively, suggesting that maybe further austerity isnt the answer.

title: Footage of St. Louis Shooting May Contradict Police Reports
description: Cellphone footage of a fatal police shooting in St. Louis on Tuesday raised questions about the initial account given by the police.

title: Next for Virtual Reality: Video, Without the Games
description: Nearly all the hype around virtual reality  much of it fanned by Facebooks $2 billion acquisition of Oculus VR, the headset maker  is about how the technology can be used for games.

title: New Challenges for Panama Canal at 100
description: The Times has converted all of its 1964 issues into a digitized, searchable format. Each week, The Upshot will unearth an item from 50 years ago and put it in the light of today. Panama Canal, at 50, Still Awes Engineers appeared on Aug. 16 and can be seen in its original format on TimesMachine.

title: Afghanistan Defends Expulsion of a Times Reporter
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The Afghan government lashed out Thursday at criticism of its expulsion of an American journalist, the first such action since the ouster of the Taliban, denouncing him as a spy in an official statement.

title: Kayaking to the Jungle in Nicaragua
description: Nicaragua has recently become a popular tourist destination for its eco-friendly resorts, unspoiled beaches and waves popular with surfers.

title: 2015 Honda Fit Gets Second Chance in I.I.H.S. Crash Test
description: The redesigned 2015 Honda Fit received an Acceptable rating in the small overlap frontal crash test performed by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, a significant improvement over the Poor rating that the 2013 model received when it was tested in January.

title: Searching for Anne of Green Gables on Prince Edward Island
description: My first evening on Prince Edward Island, I found myself on the shore, scrambling across sun-bleached beach grass to circle an abandoned lighthouse. The Gulf of St. Lawrence crashed in moody bursts before me, the water reflecting the deepening gray of the sky. My feet sank into drifts of sand until I turned inland, down a spongy red clay road that edged a verdant meadow. In the distance, the cheerful lights of my bed-and-breakfast, a rambling 19th-century farmhouse, beckoned.

title: Indonesian Court Rejects Election Challenge, Clearing Way for Joko Presidency
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  Indonesias Constitutional Court on Thursday rejected claims by Prabowo Subianto, who lost the countrys presidential election in July, that the voting had been rigged, a widely expected ruling that cleared the way for the populist governor of Jakarta, Joko Widodo, to become the countrys next leader.

title: Exploring Scotlands Past and Present
description: The television producer Ronald D. Moore is best known for projects that mix high concept with high altitude, from his early work as a writer for Star Trek: The Next Generation to his 2004 Battlestar Galactica reboot.

title: Hashim Khan, Patriarch of a Squash Dynasty, Is Dead
description: Hashim Khan, who learned to play squash when he was a boy, retrieving stray balls for British military officers in Pakistan, and went on to become a champion and the patriarch of a family dynasty in the sport, died on Monday in Denver. He was believed to be 100.

title: Will Bill Murray Attend Bill Murray Day? Yes, Bill Murray Will.
description: When the Toronto International Film Festival announced on Wednesday that one of its highlights would be Bill Murray Day  a Murray minifestival on Sept. 5, with free screenings of Stripes, Groundhog Day and Ghostbusters, leading to the world premiere that evening of his new film, St. Vincent  the question no one could answer was whether the elusive Mr. Murray would participate in the public festivities.

title: A Quieter Night of Protest
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. and Capt. Ronald S. Johnson of the Missouri State Highway Patrol spoke after a more peaceful night of protests in Ferguson, Mo.

title: Mario Balotelli Reportedly Headed to Liverpool
description: Striker Mario Balotelli bid farewell to his A. C. Milan teammates Thursday amid reports that Liverpool had agreed to a fee that would send him back to Englands Premier League.

title: Alone Again, Unnaturally
description: Alfred Hitchcock liked to distinguish between surprise and suspense, between the bombs that shock us (boom!) and those that put us on edge (tick, tick, tick). The modestly sized puzzler The One I Love  a cunning, twisty tale about a marriage that has gone sour and is about to go pretty strange  detonates a few bombs, but also keeps a few ticking until the end. The unpromising setup is as banal as someone elses shrink session. What quickly pulls you in, though, are the appealing stars and mysterioso circumstances that their characters  like the viewer  are sucked into as the story morphs into a quagmire of narrative uncertainty, marital gamesmanship and speculative foolishness.

title: Delivering Everything, Except Perhaps Profits
description: Remember when you used to have to go to the library to research a topic or call an airline to buy a plane ticket? The flurry of new on-demand delivery start-ups is hoping that errands around town  like grocery shopping, picking up takeout and pretty much anything else (including buying marijuana)  become like that, too. Their resurgence is the topic of my New York Times Magazine column this week.

title: Why You Should Take a Good, Long Walk Right Now
description: Feel like going for a walk? What, youre working? A number of researchers and writers are saying youll be better at your job when you get back  and its possible bosses will start to listen.

title: Blackstone Finds a Way to Outsource Skin in the Game
description: The Blackstone Group has devised a novel definition of skin in the game  other peoples money.

title: The Doctor Is In (Hes Aged)
description: THE passage of time is perhaps not so acute to the centuries-old alien at the heart of the BBCs Doctor Who, the shape-shifting hero known simply as the Doctor, who has had more than 50 years of adventures across dimensions known and otherwise.

title: Part D Gains May Be Eroding
description: In 2003, when President George W. Bush signed the major Medicare expansion that would establish prescription drug coverage, he called it a promise, a solemn promise, to Americas seniors.

title: Today in Small Business: Economics Lessons From The Simpsons
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: In Move to Curb Drug Abuse, D.E.A. Tightens Rule on Widely Prescribed Painkiller
description: WASHINGTON  The federal government tightened the prescribing for the most common form of painkiller in the country on Thursday, the final step in a policy shift that has been years in the making.

title: The N.R.A. Versus Michael Bloomberg
description: As they say in the old shoot-em-up westerns, the National Rifle Association is calling out Michael Bloomberg. Hey, Bloomberg! Keep your politics in New York, commands the gun lobbys expensive new ad campaign attacking the former mayor and chief antagonist of the N.R.A., who can hold his own in any big money fast-draw.

title: Holder Says Events in Ferguson Speak to Broader Problems
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said on Thursday that the unrest the country has witnessed here over the past two weeks was emblematic of deeper problems that exist across the nation, where a corrosive mistrust exists in certain places between the police and the people they are meant to serve.

title: Holder on Bank of Americas Settlement
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said that the Justice Department and Bank of America reached a record $16.65 billion settlement over the sale of soured mortgage securities.

title: Happening Now: Quiet Demonstrations, and Lunch
With Grit and a Grin, a Determined Franklin Endures a Painful Test
description: SOUTHPORT, Australia  Missy Franklin curled up toward the starting-block bar Tuesday the way she has done thousands of times before, but what she felt next was a new sensation that scared her stiff: a pain in her lower back that was so intense it took her breath away.

title: Driven | 2015 Volvo XC60 T6 Drive-E
description: A safe bet for those who dont need all-wheel drive.

title: Ebola Patient Revels in Miraculous Day as He and Another Exit Hospital
description: ATLANTA  To evaluate the condition of Dr. Kent Brantly, the American aid worker who became the first person to be treated for Ebola in the United States, all anyone needed to do Thursday was notice what he was not wearing.

title: Teen Births and the Complexities of Culture
description: Over at Vox, Sarah Kliff has a long, interesting dive into the recent downward acceleration in the teen birth and teen pregnancy rates, and the insufficiency of the various theories (the Great Recession, greater IUD usage, the Teen Mom effect) proffered to explain it. She leaves the reader with the image of a perfect storm  a collision of lots of trends that all serendipitously happened in the late 2000s and early 2010s, and suggests that we may have just gotten lucky.

title: A Basketball League Whose Success Isnt Measured in Points
description: Behind Lincoln Center, at the heart of a semicircle of tall brick buildings with a dome of leafy trees, on the dull playground of the Amsterdam Houses, the basketball league playoffs were underway.

title: Simple Student Routines for Back-to-School Success
description: In my last column, I wrote about simple solutions for back-to-school supplies, and a rollicking debate ensued in the comments section about the merits of the binder system, paper versus digital systems, and the perception that parents impose undue complexity on their kids these days. The one thing it seems we can all agree upon, however, is that the plan kids implement to keep their schoolwork in order is far more important than the tools they use.

title: A Rolex That a Scientist Can Love
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the illustrator Christopher David Ryan captures a timepiece from Rolex.

title: Video: A Volvo Crossover for Those Who Dont Need All-Wheel Drive
description: Volvo built its reputation on safety, but the XC60 is good enough that it can compete with the Audi Q5, the BMW X3 and the Mercedes GLK250 without having to play the safety card.

title: Lucky Shot? It Strikes a Cord
description: When the loser of a tennis match talks about luck, it can lead to controversy.

title: One Moment You See, Then You Dont
description: I was watching Diane Sawyer on the evening news, wondering how she manages year after year to look so young, when suddenly her face disappeared. Now you see. Now you dont. One second. Thats all it took. A dense black inkblot shaped like a map of England and southern Norway suddenly blocked my view of Diane so that all I could see was her blond hair and shoulders. At first, I thought it was the television set. Changing channels didnt bring her face back, nor did rubbing my eyes.

title: Wheelies: The Lincoln Lawyer Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: Connecticut Boys Death in Hot Car Is Ruled a Homicide
description: The death of a 15-month-old boy who was left alone for hours in a hot car in Connecticut last month has been ruled a homicide, the Connecticut state medical examiners office said on Thursday.

title: Study Finds That Brains With Autism Fail to Trim Synapses as They Develop
description: As a babys brain develops, there is an explosion of synapses, the connections that allow neurons to send and receive signals. But during childhood and adolescence, the brain needs to start pruning those synapses, limiting their number so different brain areas can develop specific functions and are not overloaded with stimuli.

title: 1939: Rising China Flood Engulfs City
description: TIENTSIN  Thousands of persons are believed to have perished in Tientsin and the surrounding country as the waters of the Haiho River continued today to pour over the greater portion of the city. Officials estimated that the inundation was one of the worst in the history of North China. Most of the casualties are believed to be in villages along the Haiho, near the city. The only spots above water are a small section of the French Concession, most of the Italian Concession, the international bridge and the railway station. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug.22, 1939

title: All Thats Southern
description: We dont use the classier ingredients, said Ashley Weavil, the chef of the Dogwood.

title: Family Dollars Rejection of Dollar General Is About More Than Money
description: In the latest dollar wars, it is not about the money.

title: Perry Says Terrorists Could Be Entering the U.S. From Mexico
description: WASHINGTON  Gov. Rick Perry of Texas warned Thursday that militants from the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria and other terrorist groups may have already slipped across the Mexican border.

title: More Dances for an iPhone, Inspired by Sondheim
description: For dance aficionados, Richard Danielss series of iPhone apps have been a source of enlightenment and entertainment ever since Dances for an iPhone  a collection of six short dance films, with choreography by Mr. Daniels, that you watch in the palm of your hand  was released. Since then, Mr. Daniels has created two more installments, and on Sept. 1 he will release Dances for an iPhone, Vol. 4, a collection of dances set to the music of Stephen Sondheim, compiled with Mr. Sondheims blessing.

title: Iran Frees Photojournalist
description: TEHRAN  An Iranian-American woman with dual citizenship, who had been working in Iran as a photojournalist officially accredited by the authorities, was released on Thursday after having been held at an unidentified location since July 22, her relatives said. They refused to reveal her identity.

title: Liberian Boy Dies After Being Shot During Clash Over Ebola Quarantine
description: MONROVIA, Liberia  A teenage boy who was wounded on Wednesday during clashes at an Ebola-stricken neighborhood in Monrovia, Liberia, died of hypovolemic shock after being shot in his legs, said Dr. Mohammed Sankoh, the medical director of Redemption Hospital.

title: Staying Safe, Exploring Sassy
description: LOS ANGELES  The building on the quiet Los Angeles block with a plate on the door that reads Believe  here are the offices of Scooter Braun, Svengali to Justin Bieber. Upstairs in the back is a room filled with old arcade games and the full gamut of Bieber accolades, including a piece of paper taped to the wall identifying him as Gossip Bang Chinese Fans Choice Male Hottie 2013, whatever that might be.

title: Fernand St Germain, Legislator Tied to S.&L. Crisis, Dies at 86
description: Fernand St Germain, a 14-term Rhode Island congressman who was chairman of the House banking committee before the savings and loan crisis exploded, and who lost his seat after drawing attention for his ties to the industry he had helped deregulate, died on Saturday at his summer home in Newport, R.I. He was 86.

title: New Owner to Renovate and Upgrade Quad Cinema
description: Charles S. Cohen, the president and chief executive of the Cohen Brothers Realty Corporation, has bought the Quad Cinema, the Greenwich Village theater that has for decades been a hybrid art-house and first-run theater. The sale was completed on Wednesday, Daniela Sapkar, a spokeswoman for Mr. Cohen, said.

title: Dr. Kent Brantly Recovers From Ebola
description: Dr. Brantly, an American missionary and doctor who contracted Ebola in Liberia, was discharged from Emory Hospital in Atlanta after making a full recovery from the disease.

title: More Comments Invited for Proposed Bitcoin Rules
description: New Yorks Department of Financial Services said on Thursday that it would extend by 45 days the comment period for its proposed virtual currency regulations. Those interested in submitting comments on the new rules will now have until Oct. 21.

title: Why We Love Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
description: The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles are clearly unique. As Megan Garber of The Atlantic puts it, they are turtles who are also mutants  the result of exposure to a mutagen ooze  who are also ninjas. Its hardly a common formulation.

title: States Given a Reprieve on Ratings of Teachers
description: Secretary of Education Arne Duncan announced on Thursday that states could delay the use of test results in teacher-performance ratings by another year, an acknowledgment, in effect, of the enormous pressures mounting on the nations teachers because of new academic standards and more rigorous standardized testing.

title: The Bauble With the Picture, and Vice Versa
description: The common perception of photography is that it is something to be mounted on a wall, printed in a book or viewed on a screen. But people have been wearing and handling photographs practically since their invention. Multiple Exposures: Jewelry and Photography, an exhibition of 170 objects by 80 artists at the Museum of Arts and Design, offers some striking historical and contemporary examples.

title: The Pigeons Are Clay and Play Hard to Get
description: ONE thing was clear: I am not my mothers daughter.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz
description: In the news: CrossFit, assisted suicide and working out with your dog. Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: Sprint, With Marcelo Claure at Helm, Aims for Comeback With Price Cuts
description: Sprints new chief executive, Marcelo Claure, just started work last weekand the company got straight to cutting prices.

title: Ice Bucket Challenge Donations for A.L.S. Research Top $41 Million
description: With everyone from former President George W. Bush to Justin Bieber and Shakira posting online videos of themselves dumping buckets of ice over their heads in the name of charity, the viral Ice Bucket Challenge continues to dominate social media and has now raised more than $40 million for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, commonly known as Lou Gehrigs disease.

title: Its Still Popular Being Green
description: Theres a straightforward strategy for turning a hit musical into a long-running smash: Dont mess with success.

title: Full of Character for a Lot Less Rent in Bayonne, N.J.
description: Two years ago, Matt Jackson returned to New York for work. After 14 years in Dallas, he was unprepared for the high rents, small spaces and quick turnaround. Apartments turn over within hours, he said.

title: Jane Austen Artifacts at the Morgan Library and in England
description: AUSTEN AND ARTIFACTS: A POPULAR COMBINATION

title: Cindy Shermans 156 Wigs
description: See them all in 24 seconds in this stop-motion video.

title: Learning From the Ferguson Tragedy
Summer Salute to Charlie Parker
description: Its not impossible to imagine the jazz legend Charlie Parker putting the musical primitivism of punk rock into perspective with one of his eloquent and pungent zingers. On the other hand, were he here this weekend to see the AfroPunk Festival, a free outdoor concert in Brooklyn, the Miser wonders whether he wouldnt sense some common ground with acts like Meshell Ndegeocello, Shabazz Palaces or Valerie June, who also build vanguard sounds from blues roots.

title: Cindy Shermans Wigs
description: These 156 wigs were shot in the artists New York City studio. See them all in 24 seconds in this stop-motion video.

title: A Risky, Chilly Climb to the Top
description: K2

title: U.S. General Says Raiding Syria Is Key to Halting ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria cannot be defeated unless the United States or its partners take on the Sunni militants in Syria, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff said Thursday.

title: Hes Battled N.B.A. Players. Now Hell Play for Kentucky.
description: When Karl-Anthony Towns checked into the game for the Dominican Republics national team at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday night against the American team of N.B.A. stars, he stepped figuratively onto the crossroads of his 18-year-old life.

title: 10 Questions for the Iowa Senate Candidates
description: The Iowa Senate race is one of a handful that will decide whether Republicans or Democrats control the Senate for the last two years of President Obamas tenure. The race to succeed retiring Senator Tom Harkin, a Democrat, pits Bruce Braley, a Democrat who is currently in the United States House, against Joni Ernst, a Republican state senator.

title: Abduction Case Tests Limits of Amish Ties to Modern World
description: OSWEGATCHIE, N.Y.  The two sisters were missing, apparently abducted from the roadside vegetable stand in front of their house in this rural town near the Canadian border. The police needed photos of the girls to issue an alert, but the family had none: They were Amish, a community that generally prohibits photographs partly based on the biblical injunction against likenesses.

title: Inspection of Russian Trucks at Ukraine Border Begins
description: DONETSK, Russia  Inspectors from Russia, Ukraine and the International Red Cross on Thursday began checking trucks to confirm that they are carrying humanitarian aid destined for eastern Ukraine, a Red Cross spokesman said.

title: In Bordeaux, Chteau Palmer Dares to Experiment
description: MARGAUX, France  Contrary to its image, Bordeaux is not necessarily an old-fashioned, humorless place. Yes, the chateaus that adorn the Mdoc landscape connote a sense of stately permanence, just as the corporate marketers in their Herms ties and Gucci loafers exude single-minded commerce.

title: Holder Vows to Stand With Ferguson
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr., who met with the family of Michael Brown during his trip to Ferguson, Mo., said that mistrust exists between the police and the people they are meant to serve.

title: Afropunks, Come as You Are
description: Phil Knotts portraits of the Afropunk scene show the other black experience among fans of alternative music.

title: Regulators Struggle With Conflicts in Credit Ratings and Audits
description: Few businesses have more obvious conflicts of interest than those that involve the issuing of objective and independent reports and opinions about companies that pay for those reports and opinions.

title: With Extra Pep, McCarthy Prevents Sweep With a Shutout
description: After the fifth inning Thursday, Yankees starter Brandon McCarthy began to feel tired.

title: Despite ISIS Horror, Congress Is Wary of U.S. Military Expansion
description: WASHINGTON  For weeks, Capitol Hill has tried to keep Americas military engagement in Iraq at arms length: Democrats and Republicans warily backed President Obamas limited airstrikes against Sunni militants, but nobody  aside from Senator John McCain and a few fellow hawks  demonstrated an appetite for deeper involvement.

title: Readers Respond: Alone Again, Naturally
description: Readers dissected the Obama presidency with waves of disappointment, civic despondency and Democratic party solidarity in response to Maureen Dowds column Wednesday about President Obamas man-apart style, Alone Again, Naturally.

title: Midtown Manhattan Wouldnt Be the Same
description: The hardworking Skyscraper Museum, in the belly of a condo complex on Battery Place, doesnt have much space or much of a budget, but with admirable frequency its director, Carol Willis, stages smart shows that uncover telling moments of New York skyscraper lore and architecture history. The museum has just opened Times Square, 1984: The Postmodern Moment, about the battle 30 years ago for the soul of Times Square and the profession.

title: Hallberg, Healing, Keeps Balletomanes Up to Date
description: It was the kind of post you might see on a friends Instagram account  a quick note Thursday that the ankle surgery went well, lasted a good four hours, and that his foot must be elevated for over a week so Ill have time to read and watch god knows what on YouTube.

title: Cooking Techniques: Cutting a Mango
description: Learn how to cut and pit a mango.

title: Tim Howard Taking One-Year Break From U.S. National Team
description: Tim Howard, whose superlative shot-stopping nearly carried the United States national team to the quarterfinals of the World Cup this summer in Brazil, announced on Thursday that he would be taking a break from international play until next fall.

title: Back Off, Sis
description: I am a middle-age woman and reasonably satisfied with my appearance. I have a good haircut and wear age-appropriate clothing, but Im not much interested in makeup or accessories. Several women in my family think of me as a great candidate for What Not to Wear. A family wedding is approaching, and my sister offered to pay for a makeup and hairstyling session  just for me. Other family members dont need the help, she said, because they do fine on their own. I feel humiliated. Should I swallow my pride and accept her offer?

title: A Ferguson Story on Conflicting Accounts Seems to Say Trust Us
description: Note to readers: I reconsidered the conclusions in this post on March 23, 2015.

title: Tear-Gassed in Ferguson
description: Alan Blinder reported on the unrest in Ferguson, Mo. He has now returned to The Timess bureau in Atlanta.

title: Natural Gas Production Falls Short in China
description: SHOUYANG, China  Jin Peisheng, a drilling rig foreman, knows the challenges of trying to extract natural gas from a coal seam under the cornfields here in north-central China.

title: And All That Time You Thought You Were Just Playing
description: DURING the humidity-induced haze of midsummer, I dreamed of how refreshing it would feel to flop, arms and legs outstretched, onto a garden-hose-soaked bright yellow Slip N Slide.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: When Flushing Was Awash With Wonders
description: QUEENS is not the borough to hog center stage, but every once in a while, the spotlight turns its way. It happened, in spectacular fashion, 75 years ago. Out in Forest Hills, Bobby Riggs, fresh from victory at Wimbledon, defeated Welby Van Horn to take the singles title at the United States National Championships, while the incomparable Alice Marble repeated as womens champion by putting away Helen Hull Jacobs. And over in Flushing Meadows, thousands of visitors were getting a glimpse of the world of tomorrow at the New York Worlds Fair.

title: How Mitch McConnell Would Rule the Senate
description: Senator Mitch McConnell gave the country a glimpse this week of what Republican control of the Senate would look like. If it produces a familiar depression, its because weve seen what happens when Republican leaders in the House have used the identical tactics, and most people have little interest in seeing Washington return to battle stations.

title: Smaller Hill for Federer to Climb at the Open
description: No matches have been played yet at the United States Open, which does not kick off until Monday, but as the draw unfolded Thursday, Roger Federer must have felt as if he had already won something.

title: Sounds Like a Great Place, but Can We Get There by Shoe?
description: If I were one of those mystics who lives on top of a mountain, dispensing wisdom to people who hauled themselves up, the first thing I would tell them is: Never shop for shoes when you are tired.

title: Fewer Pass High School Exams, and Some in England Cheer
description: LONDON  After years of complaints about declining standards for high school exams, the British government has made them harder to pass: The latest results show the first drop in the passing rate in three decades. And in a nation where education has long been a political battleground between progressives and traditionalists, the changes are an emphatic victory for the old school.

title: In the Shadows, With Their Physical and Moral Impairments
description: A soulful romance, an existential action flick and something of a miracle movie  the appealing slow-burner Salvo hovers at the crossroads of genre. Its story pulls in all directions, and its mood, tone and backdrop are as serious as a Mafia hit.
