(Flix) THE DANGEROUS LIVES OF ALTAR BOYS (2002) In Jeff Stockwells screen adaptation of Chris Fuhrmans novel, directed by Peter Care, the teenage friends Francis Doyle (Emile Hirsch) and Tim Sullivan (Kieran Culkin) cope with the anxieties of education, puberty and first love by writing a series of superhero comics. The masterstroke of this small, heartfelt directorial debut, Stephen Holden wrote in The New York Times, is its integration of animated sequences (by Todd McFarlane) in which action-adventure caricatures of the comic book characters parallel or comment on events in the boys lives. Those lives are darkened as the film progresses, most affectingly by a story of familial abuse shared by Franciss new girlfriend, Margie Flynn (Jena Malone). Jodie Foster plays Sister Assumpta, an especially reviled teacher at the boys Roman Catholic school. Mr. Holden wrote: Ms. Foster, who seems to grow primmer with each film, locates the compassion beneath her characters grim, authoritarian surface. Like tiny ripples on a pond, her face registers the concerns of a caring surrogate parent committed to practicing an austere form of tough love.

title: Satellite Spied No Cannabis After All, China Says
description: Talk about buzzkill. A story that recently went viral on Chinese online news outlets, about the discovery in northern China of the biggest tracts of cannabis since the founding of the Peoples Republic in 1949, may not have been true after all.

title: Quotation of the Day for Tuesday, August 26, 2014
description: No one is going to talk openly and say, Oh, were not making low-income students a priority. But enrollment management is so sophisticated that they know pretty clearly how much each student would cost.

title: Corrections: August 26, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Student Crossword | Life in Colonial America
description: Test your knowledge of life in colonial America by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Jersey City Course Is Picked to Host 2017 Presidents Cup
description: The PGA Tour will announce a 25-year agreement with Liberty National Golf Course on Tuesday, tour officials said, including plans to host the Presidents Cup at the eight-year-old Jersey City course in 2017.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Michael Browns Funeral Draws Large Crowds
description: In Crowds of Mourners Line Up for Michael Brown Funeral, Monica Davey and Motoko Rich report on the funeral service for Michael Brown.

title: Fantasy Football, Stock-Market Edition
description: Last football season, Evan Berlin was a champion. He beat his friends in a fantasy league and won $625 on a $100 buy-in. This season, Berlin, a technology executive in Denver, hopes to profit from another sort of sports play: owning shares of stock in Vernon Davis, the 30-year-old tight end for the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Saving Indonesian Rain Forests and Orangutans
description: Inevitably, while roaming her way across Indonesia, Sandra Hoyn stopped dead in her tracks for the orangutans.

title: Swiss Bank Pictet Reveals Results for First Time
description: LONDON  The Swiss private bank Pictet Group reported its financial results publicly for the first time in its 209-year history on Tuesday, showing a profit and highlighting continuing changes in Switzerlands traditionally secretive banking culture.

title: Bashar al-Assad: Frenemy or Foe?
description: Recent events in the Middle East  the incursion of theIslamic State in Iraq and Syria into northern Iraq and the groups brutal killing of James Foley  have set up the potential to makeunlikely bedfellows of the regime of President Bashar al-Assad and foreign governments that have openly and tacitly supportedthe opposition in Syrias three-year-old civil war.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: New York Today: Improv, With Filters
description: Good morning on this soon-to-be hot Tuesday.

title: Daily Report: Amazon Pays $1.1 Billion for Twitch, a Streamer of Gaming Videos
description: The video in video games is suddenly a billion-dollar business, Nick Wingfield reports.

title: Obama Tells Veterans He Will Fix Health System, as New Report Lists Lapses
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  President Obama on Tuesday promised several thousand military veterans that he would fulfill his sacred trust to those returning from Americas wars by overhauling a dysfunctional health care system, even as a new report documented unacceptable and troubling lapses in medical treatment.

title: New French Cabinet Sheds Critics and Leaves Austerity Policies in Place
description: PARIS  The new government approved Tuesday by President Franois Hollande squelched important voices of dissent on the left wing of his Socialist Party but signaled little change of direction on economic policies that critics say have left the French economy mired in stagnation.

title: A Brick-and-Mortar Retailers Guide to E-Commerce
description: In June, I wrote in a post that Id decided I am not in the e-commerce business. Actually, I concluded, I am a brick-and-mortar retailer who happens to have a good website. The point was that I have to be careful about the resources I devote to building my web business because e-commerce sites can turn into black holes.

title: 1939: Americans Stranded in Europe
description: The United States liner President Roosevelt, the Italian Lines Conte di Savoia and numerous other large trans-Atlantic craft have changed their schedules drastically as a result of the critical European situation. Thousands of American visitors to Europe, those successful in the scramble for berths on liners bound for the United States, were disappointed when their ships either returned to home ports in Europe or announced indefinite postponement of scheduled sailings pending the issue of the crisis.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 27, 1939

title: Putin Talks to Ukrainian Leader as Videos Show Captured Russian Soldiers
description: MINSK, Belarus  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia held inconclusive talks late Tuesday with the president of Ukraine, extending a reluctant hand to a new leadership vilified in Russias state-run news media as the fruit of a fascist putsch. Hours earlier, Ukraine released videos of captured Russian soldiers that directly challenged Mr. Putins longstanding claim that his country has nothing to do with the conflict in eastern Ukraine.

title: Morning Agenda: Amazon Scoops Up Twitch
description: Think video games are just things people play? Think again. On Monday, Amazon announced that it had reached a $1.1 billion deal to buy Twitch, the most popular website for watching people play video games, Nick Wingfield writes in The New York Times. The deal for Twitch is the latest sign of how forms of behavior once seemingly on the fringe can, in the hands of tech entrepreneurs, turn into huge online communities in no time, he writes. Twitch, which specializes in live videos of people playing games, has 55 million unique viewers a month globally.

title: Dealing With Ebola
description: World health authorities are trying to contain the virus.

title: Cease-Fire Extended, but Not on Hamass Terms
description: JERUSALEM  After 50 days of fighting that took some 2,200 lives, leveled large areas of the Gaza Strip and paralyzed Israels south for the summer, Israeli and Palestinian leaders reached an open-ended cease-fire agreement on Tuesday that promised only limited change to conditions in Gaza and left unresolved the broader issues underpinning the conflict.

title: In Performance: Kelvin Moon Loh of Here Lies Love
description: This weeks video features Kelvin Moon Loh singing the number God Draws Straight from Here Lies Love, a musical about the life of Imelda Marcos, the former first lady of the Philippines.

title: Reader Idea | Telling Stories With Data
description: One of many pieces from the Times collection 2013: The Year in Interactive Storytelling that this Reader Idea suggests for teaching math students about data visualization.

title: Global Web of Financial Connections in Burger Kings Deal for Tim Hortons
description: Updated, 9:21 p.m. | To many, Burger King is an American icon that has served up flame-broiled Whoppers and fries for six decades.

title: Afghan Candidate Threatens to Quit the Presidential Race
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Threatening to derail a tenuous Afghan political deal again, a top aide to the presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah said Tuesday that the campaign would pull out of an internationally monitored vote audit unless changes to the process were made by Wednesday.

title: New Palestinian Town in West Bank Awaits Israels Approval for Water
description: RAWABI, West Bank  The Roman-style amphitheater with seating for 12,000 is taking shape against a stunning backdrop of rolling hills. Off to one side, a small soccer stadium is under construction. On the slopes below, there are plans for a water park, and in the town center, a piazza lined with arcades and cafes. A movie theater is being built with seven screens, one of them 4-D.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: At the Emmys, Seth Meyers Plays Fashion Superman
description: The thing that struck me most about the fashion show Monday night  sorry, the Emmy Awards  was not any particular gown or sartorial faux pas or even the triumph of a single brand. (If you want a recap, I highly recommend my colleague Alexandra Jacobss review.) Instead, it was a single mens wear moment: the lightning-fast switcheroo by Seth Meyers, who swapped a black-lapeled navy Valentino tuxedo, worn on the red carpet, for a single-buttoned midnight blue Ralph Lauren tux for his onstage duties as host. It seemed to herald the true arrival of the mens wear red carpet.

title: Reliving Glory Days of Stickball
description: Dear Diary:

title: A Design Lovers Guide to the Modern Jaipur
description: Jaipur is like the elusive mistress you cant get enough of. Considered to be Indias first planned city, it was painted an autumnal shade of pink to coincide with the visit of the Prince of Wales (King Edward VII) in 1878. But time and traffic have turned the pink into a shade of sandstone orange, and today, the city straddles eras. Run-down palaces pop up at random street corners. Ornately carved domes rise up against glass monoliths. Global ideas mingle with generations-old handicrafts, from block printing to brass beating. A stroll around the 18th-century Palace of the Winds (Hawa Mahal), which overlooks the citys main arterial road, gives you a sense of the throbbing cosmopolis Jaipur has become. Here, the top spots to visit in all directions.

title: Fabled Uighur Princess Coming to Chinese Television as a Cartoon
description: Chinese officials are embracing a wide range of tactics in trying to suppress surging ethnic violence in the western border region of Xinjiang. There are, for example, frequent police raids on homes of suspected Uighur insurgents and executions of those found guilty by courts of terrorist activities. There was also a recent proposal by President Xi Jinping to move more Uighurs to parts of China dominated by the Han, the nations main ethnic group, so the mostly Muslim Uighurs could be better assimilated into Chinese society.

title: Liberian Leader Reported to Fire Officials for Defying Ebola Order
description: LONDON  President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf of Liberia was reported on Tuesday to have dismissed government ministers and senior officials who refused to return home as West Africa confronts the worst known outbreak of the Ebola virus.

title: How Social Media Silences Debate
description: The Internet might be a useful tool for activists and organizers, in episodes from the Arab Spring to the Ice Bucket Challenge. But over all, it has diminished rather than enhanced political participation, according to new data.

title: Does Where You Live Make a Difference in How and What You Write?
description: Each week in Bookends, two writers take on questions about the world of books. This week, Mohsin Hamid and Thomas Mallon discuss how where theyve lived has affected their work.

title: Brazil Prison Revolt Ends After Deal Is Reached
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  A bloody prison uprising in southern Brazil that left at least five inmates dead at the hands of fellow prisoners, including two who were beheaded, ended on Tuesday morning after negotiators said they had reached an agreement with the revolts leaders to transfer hundreds of inmates to other penitentiaries.

title: 1964: Goldwater Fishing in Pacific
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif.  Sen. Barry Goldwater arrived here last night [Aug. 26] for six days to fish and not shave and have a good time. Within two hours, the Republican presidential nominee, his wife and two other couples were at sea aboard the converted PT boat Sundance for a no politics pre-campaign holiday off the California coast. The senator was hardly at sea, however, before his boat returned to the harbor off Santa Catalina island for a waterborne news conference. Sen. Goldwater said that no peace negotiations which involve the United States directly or indirectly in Vietnam should be held until the military situation improves.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 27, 1964

title: World Health Organization Urges Stronger Regulation of Electronic Cigarettes
description: PARIS  Governments should ban the use of electronic cigarettes in public places and outlaw tactics to lure young users, the World Health Organization said in a report released on Tuesday that calls for some of the toughest measures yet proposed for the increasingly popular devices.

title: Volvo Introduces Its First S.U.V. Made Under Chinese Ownership
description: STOCKHOLM  Volvo on Tuesday introduced its first vehicle designed and built under Chinese ownership. But the influence, if any, of the new owners from Hangzhou has been carefully hidden by many layers of Swedish aesthetic.

title: Senate Update: Republicans Cross a Threshold
description: Followers of Leo, The Upshots Senate model, will note that it has a new background color today.

title: Mexican Leaders Approval Ratings Fall Amid Economic Concerns
description: The positive image that President Enrique Pea Nieto of Mexico once enjoyed is fading, and his efforts at economic change are unpopular, according to a poll released Tuesday by the Pew Research Center.

title: In Burger King Deal, Buffett Teams Up Again With 3G Capital
description: A cross-border fast-food deal has united Warren E. Buffett with one of his favorite investors.

title: How to Hit Like Serenas Biggest Rivals, as Told by Her Hitting Partner
description: To get Serena Williams ready for matches, Sascha Bajin, Williamss longtime hitting partner who is featured in the magazines United States Open issue, often mimics the style of the opponent she will be facing. We asked Bajin to give us the skinny on some of Williamss biggest rivals and what he does to prepare her for matches against them.

title: Help Is Sought for Migrants Dying at Sea
description: GENEVA  Record numbers of people from the Middle East and Africa are putting their lives in the hands of smugglers to get across the Mediterranean to Europe, and record numbers are dying in the effort, the United Nations refugee agency said on Tuesday in calling for urgent and concerted action by European governments.

title: A Scheherazade in Todays Portugal
description: LISBON  On a cool night last month, Miguel Gomes, one of Portugals most prominent film directors, was shooting a scene for his latest movie in an outdoor amphitheater, high above the Tagus River here. Pall Mall cigarette in hand, he told an actress to look more beleaguered before she began a crucial monologue that captures the countrys dark mood.

title: In Search of the Perfect Taco
description: Believing that Mexican food is the next big thing, the Scandinavian chef Ren Redzepi eats his way across the country to deconstruct its secrets.

title: A Closer Look at Turbulent Oceans and Greenhouse Heating
description: Updated, 6:30 p.m. | Earths climate is shaped by the interplay of two complicated and turbulent systems  the atmosphere and oceans. (The photo above is from the two years I spent at that interface as crew on ocean-roaming sailboats.) The oceans hold the majority of heat in the system, are full of sloshy cycles on time scales from years to decades and, despite an increase in monitoring using sophisticated diving buoys, remain only spottily tracked.

title: Hookup Line. Carpool. Same Rituals, New School.
description: Here in Nashville, the process known elsewhere as car pool  dropping off and picking up children at school  is referred to as hookup. So, instead of saying the car-pool line, folks here say, the hookup line. See you at hookup, fellow parents say. Dont be late for hookup, teachers remind us.

title: Perfectly Imperfect Beauty at the 2014 Emmy Awards
description: On last nights red carpet for the 66th Primetime Emmy Awards, Kristen Wiig, Julie Bowen and Amy Poehler encapsulated the beauty look of the moment: messy hair and (perfect) imperfectly applied makeup, which Sarah Nicole Prickett wrote about in Ts Fall Womens Issue. To get the low-maintenance look, take styling cues from Blumarines fall 2014 runway.

title: Why You Want an App to Measure Calories but Not Character
description: Were often annoyed when the various online services we use make incorrect assumptions about us, like when we order a book about the Monkees (for work, obviously) and our Amazon recommendations are full of B-list band memoirs for months. But we may be even more annoyed  or, perhaps, downright disturbed  when theyre right.

title: Getting Close to the Action at the U.S. Open
description: With live tennis, the closer you can get, the better.

title: Mayor Klaus Wowereit of Berlin Says He Will Step Down
description: BERLIN  Klaus Wowereit, the party-loving mayor of Berlin who once characterized his city as poor, but sexy, will step down in December after more than 13 years presiding over the German capital, he said on Tuesday.

title: India Fines 14 Carmakers in Antitrust Cases
description: MUMBAI, India  Indias antimonopoly regulator has fined 14 automobile companies about $422 million in all for failing to allow fair competition in the market for spare parts.

title: Still More Dylan From the Basement
description: When Bob Dylan disappeared for more than a year after a motorcycle accident in 1966, there were dire suggestions that he was out for the count  talk that stopped with the release of his John Wesley Harding album in the final days of 1967. But Mr. Dylans months of convalescence have proven to be a gift that keeps on giving. Besides composing prolifically, he recorded reel after reel of demo tapes with the Band at his home in upstate New York.

title: In Burger King-Tim Hortons Deal, Consumer Reaction Could Be Crucial
description: Before Burger King, there was Stanley Works.

title: Intersection | Eclectic in Meatpacking
description: Katerina Mozgovoy described her personal style as a colorful mix of everything, from her monkey-teeth necklace to the skirt her mother made a decade ago.

title: Damaged Men, Shifting Loyalties
description: The title of Starred Up, David Mackenzies brutal and boisterous new prison drama, refers to the status of its main character, Eric. Though he is legally still under age, Eric, played with method actor inwardness and movie star magnetism by Jack OConnell, has been promoted to adult status in the British penal system. Its not hard to see why. Brawny and athletic, he looks less like a child than like a young bull, and his capacity for violence unnerves even some of the hardened older criminals in whose midst he finds himself.

title: Why a Slowdown in Housing Prices Is Great News
U.N. Draft Report Lists Unchecked Emissions Risks
description: Runaway growth in the emission of greenhouse gases is swamping all political efforts to deal with the problem, raising the risk of severe, pervasive and irreversible impacts over the coming decades, according to a draft of a major new United Nations report.

title: Betrayal of Yazidis Stokes Iraqi Fears of Return to 2006 Sectarian Horrors
description: ZAKHO, Iraq  The afternoon before his family fled the onslaught of Sunni militants, Dakhil Habash was visited by three of his Arab neighbors. Over tea, his trusted friend Matlul Mare told him not to worry about the advancing fighters and that no harm would come to him or his Yazidi people.

title: W.H.O. Report on E-Cigarettes
description: The World Health Organizations report on the use of e-cigarettes and the dangers they pose.

title: Her Own Kind of Absence
description: She lay so still as I approached her bed, I thought she was asleep. Or dead. Her eyes were open. Mom? I asked. Her gaze tilted toward me, but she said nothing.

title: Today in Small Business: The Problem With Passion
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Dont Get Mad if Burger King Gets Canadian
description: Burger King has agreed to buy Tim Hortons, and has announced its intent to locate the headquarters of the combined company in Canada. This sounds like another tax inversion: a transaction in which an American company combines with a smaller foreign competitor, allowing it to move its tax residency abroad while keeping the bulk of its operations in the United States.

title: Responding to Reader Questions About Our Parts Fiasco
description: Several readers have asked for a more detailed explanation of how we solved our parts problem. Other readers wondered whether we figured out how to finish the problem parts for our customer through blind luck or whether we had a method, possibly one taught by W. Edwards Deming. I want to try to answer those questions along with a few others readers posed.

title: Time Warner Unit Starts Cutbacks Via Buyouts
description: Time Warners Turner Broadcasting System division said on Tuesday that it was offering buyouts to about 600 employees, the first step in an ambitious effort to overhaul a portfolio of cable networks that have struggled with declining ratings at a time of intense competition for viewers.

title: Conlon to Step Down From Ravinia Festival
description: James Conlon announced on Tuesday that he would give up the music directorship of the Ravinia Festival  the Chicago Symphony Orchestras summer home  after the 2015 festival. He has been music director at Ravinia since 2005, and has conducted there regularly since 1977. Welz Kauffman, the president and chief executive of the festival, said that the programming for next summer would celebrate some of the repertory areas Mr. Conlon has explored during his tenure, including Mahler symphonies, Mozart piano concertos, operas in concert and the works of composers whose music was suppressed during the Nazi era.

title: Demand Up, U.S. Economy Shows Gains
description: The American economy is gaining renewed momentum, with data released on Tuesday suggesting strong demand by businesses for airplanes, machinery and other manufactured items, as well as rising confidence among consumers, despite a cooling in the housing market.

title: Police Sergeants Union Warns Against Democratic Convention in Brooklyn
description: A union of New York City police sergeants warned the Democratic National Committee on Tuesday against holding its 2016 convention in Brooklyn, issuing an open letter that doubled as a broadside against a mayoral administration with which some officers have grown increasingly frustrated.

title: Thailands Business in Paid Surrogates May Be Foundering in a Moral Quagmire
description: PAK OK, Thailand  Soon after the first surrogate mother from this remote village gave birth, neighbors noticed her new car and conspicuous home renovations, sending ripples of envy through the wooden houses beside rice paddies and tamarind groves.

title: Russian Soldier Captured in Ukraine
description: Excerpts of an interrogation of Ivan V. Milchakov, a Russian soldier whom Ukraine said its security forces captured in the Donetsk region.

title: Poor Door in a New York Tower Opens a Fight Over Affordable Housing
description: A 33-story glassy tower rising on Manhattans waterfront will offer all the extras that a condo buyer paying up to $25 million would expect, like concierge service, entertainment rooms, and unobstructed views of the Hudson River and miles beyond.

title: Texas v. Perry Emerges From Years of Struggle Over Anticorruption Unit
description: AUSTIN, Tex.  The trail to Rick Perrys indictment began with way too many drinks and a drunken-driving arrest for Rosemary Lehmberg, the Travis County district attorney, that was captured in embarrassing detail on videotape.

title: Saraghinas Artisanal Bakery Opens in Brooklyn
description: To Shop: All It Took Was a Little Extra Kneading

title: Youngest Player in Tournament Makes Biggest Splash
description: On a day that began with more fussing about the plight of American men at the United States Open, 15-year-old Catherine Bellis gave the American fans a shot of adrenaline with an upset victory that electrified her little corner of the U.S.T.A. Billie Jean King National Tennis Center on Tuesday.

title: Illinois Governor Vetoes Ride-Sharing Restrictions
description: In Illinois, legislation that effectively would have quashed ride sharing in Chicago, the only city statewide with services from UberX, Sidecar and Lyft, was vetoed on Monday.

title: Burger King Wins Support Where Wendys Didnt in Tim Hortons Deal
description: Why can Burger King, but not Wendys, own Tim Hortons? Burger King used to argue that it was exceptional for the flame-broiling of its burgers. With its $11 billion purchase of the Canadian doughnut-and-coffee chain, its shareholders seem to believe it is special in some other ways.

title: Presidents of Ukraine and Russia Meet
description: At a summit in Minsk, President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine shook hands with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and later said he is ready to discuss options to end the conflict in Ukraine.

title: The 10 Best White Looks From the 2014 Emmys
description: A bevy of actresses blended in with the red carpet at last nights Emmy Awards in crimson gowns. But to our eye, it was the ladies in fresh, modern white ensembles who stood out. Michelle Monaghans Giambattista Valli Couture dress was elegantly long-sleeved, while Kristen Wiig offered a nod to the90s in her understated Vera Wang slip dress. The House of Cards star Robin Wright, meanwhile, took the look for an androgynous turn in a cream Ralph Lauren tuxedo-inspired jumpsuit. Here, our 10 favorite ivory looks of the night.

title: How Doctors See the Syrian Civil War
description: As if you didnt already think Doctors Without Borders had its hands full with the Ebola crisis unfolding in West Africa, the organization recently released a series of videos and photographs covering the groups work in and around Syria. The series, The Reach of War: A Day in the Life of the Syrian Conflict, offers a glimpse into the activities that the organization conducts on a daily basis to aid refugees and the war-wounded in Syria, Iraq, Lebanon and Jordan.

title: Expressing Himself With Joy
description: A few minutes into my first dinner at Btard, it became obvious that the chef, Markus Glocker, has a snipers accuracy at the stove. Nothing on his gracefully composed plates was chewier or crunchier or softer or saltier than it wanted to be. Mr. Glockers kitchen chops were not exactly a surprise, given that he worked in Vienna for Heinz Reitbauer, in Chicago for Charlie Trotter and in London and New York for Gordon Ramsay, none of them ever known to have smiled indulgently at a young cook and said: Dont worry about burning those onions, kid. The customers wont notice.

title: Inversion Critics and Investors May Be Misjudging Burger King Deal
description: Now that Burger Kings acquisition of the beloved Tim Hortons doughnut chain in Canada has been announced, one word sums up the initial investor and public reaction to the deal: silly.

title: Readers Respond to Life After Brooklyn
description: Brooklyn  love it or leave it. That was the sentiment expressed by readers in reaction to an Aug. 22 article, Life After Brooklyn, about people who are moving out of Brooklyn because of rising real estate prices, which attracted more than 600 comments.

title: Dirty French, From the Creators of Parm and Carbone, Opens Sept. 2
description: Headliner

title: The Governors Primary in New York
description: More than four years ago, while announcing his campaign for governor of New York, Andrew Cuomo stood in front of the Tweed Courthouse in downtown Manhattan and said Albanys antics could make Boss Tweed blush.

title: Robert Hass Wins $100,000 Poetry Prize
description: Robert Hass, who served as poet laureate of the United States in the mid-1990s, and won a National Book Award in 2007 and a Pulitzer Prize in 2008, has now also won the Wallace Stevens Award, a $100,000 cash stipend given by the Academy of American Poets, an organization founded in 1934 to foster an appreciation for American poetry.

title: Hotel Review: The Marlton in New York City
description: Rates

title: Restaurant Report: Caf des Abattoirs in Paris
description: With vegetable-driven menus and Anglo-inspired comfort food dominating the Paris dining scene, the future of classic, meat-focused restaurants is ever uncertain. When food trends become narrowly tied to young and innovative chefs, do classically inspired grills and brasseries still have a place among the rest?

title: N.F.L. Clears Richie Incognito to Return to the Field
description: Are any N.F.L. teams in the market for a player who was found to have engaged in serial harassment?

title: Abbas on Cease-Fire in Gaza Strip
description: The Palestinian president, Mahmoud Abbas, declared that a cease-fire between Hamas and Israel, brokered by Egypt, had been reached in the Gaza Strip.

title: Obama Vows Justice for James Foley
description: At the national convention of the American Legion in Charlotte, N.C., the president said, America does not forget and pledged to go after those who would harm its people.

title: Raising a Glass for Jim Dyke, a New Candidate
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  Jim Dyke had a candidate problem. His underdog was young and bold, and well liked by those who vote with their lips. But the challenger had trouble being heard over incumbents (bold cabernets, buttery Chardonnays and citrusy sauvignon blancs) whose big marketing budgets and long-earned reputations seemed daunting and inimitable.

title: A Lifetime Watching the World Devolve
description: David Mitchell once said he preferred to discuss the human heart through characterization, and to address the human condition through plot.

title: Landon Donovan to Reunite With the U.S. Team for His Farewell
description: Landon Donovan, whose long career with the United States national soccer team appeared to end when he was cut from the World Cup roster in May, is expected to make one final appearance for his country in a friendly match against Ecuador on Oct. 10 in East Hartford, Conn.

title: Google Buys Zync, Maker of Visual Effects Software
description: Special effects are awesome. Special effects are also expensive, which is a reason, at least one of them, why budget movies feel like budget movies.If Google has its way, special effects will continue to become cheaper and more accessible.

title: Early Holiday Shopping at the NY Now Gift Show
description: Twice a year, buyers from stores around the world descend on the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center for what used to be called the New York International Gift Fair, but is now known more vaguely as NY Now (subtitle: The Market for Home & Lifestyle). They go to peruse the wares of some 2,800 companies offering a staggering range of bibelots.

title: Fulfilling a Promise, Jewish Center in India Reopens After Terror Attack in 2008
description: MUMBAI, India  With a cantor singing a benediction, more than two dozen black-hatted rabbis from around the world arrived here on Tuesday to reopen a Jewish center attacked and gutted during a 2008 killing rampage by Pakistani gunmen.

title: The Three Most Dashing Men at the 2014 Emmy Awards
description: At the 66th Primetime Emmy Awards, Matthew Bomer stood out as the most elegant man on the red carpet in his classic black Tom Ford tuxedo. Runners-up were the Emmy nominees Adam Levine in a black, two-button peak lapel Prada tux (with no tie) and Jim Parsons in a chocolate brown, two-button custom Giorgio Armani look. The common denominator? All three winning looks owe their success to impeccable tailoring.

title: American Fighting for ISIS Is Killed in Syria
description: WASHINGTON  Like many teenage boys who grew up in the Midwest in the 1990s, Douglas McAuthur McCain was a fan of Michael Jordans Chicago Bulls and loved to play basketball.

title: Former Virginia Governor Sorry for Accepting Gifts, but Defends Loan Deals
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Five days of grueling, often contentious testimony by Bob McDonnell, the former Virginia governor accused of corruption, ended Tuesday with an apology from Mr. McDonnell for accepting so many gifts and so much money, but an emphatic denial that he had conspired with his wife to sell his office.

title: Vineyard Theater Casts Its Billy Wilder and Raymond Chandler
description: Vincent Kartheiser will shift from the 1960s to the 1940s when he portrays Billy Wilder in Billy & Ray at the Vineyard Theater this fall.

title: Cooking Techniques: Mise en Place
description: Have your ingredients chopped and ready for cooking.

title: Abuse Cases in British City Long Ignored, Report Says
description: LONDON  A report released on Tuesday on accusations of widespread sexual abuse in the northern England city of Rotherham found that about 1,400 minors  some as young as 11 years old  were beaten, raped and trafficked from 1997 to 2013 as the local authorities ignored a series of red flags.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Swimming With the Whales in Australia
description: As swimming with dolphins, sharks and even whale sharks becomes an increasingly common tourist attraction, Australias Sunreef dive company is thinking bigger  80,000 pounds bigger, to be exact.

title: Borne by Facebook, Conspiracy Theory That U.S. Created ISIS Spreads Across Middle East
description: The sudden rise of the militant group known as the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria has prompted a serious effort to make sense of the groups appeal in the Arab world, the Syrian columnist Hassan Hassan wrote last week.

title: Covering the Emmys: Far From the Red Carpet
description: Alexandra Jacobs, recently promoted from features editor to deputy fashion critic, reported on the Emmys.

title: Race Seen Through Viewfinders
description: To describe Thomas Allen Harriss Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People as a history of African-American photography would be accurate but incomplete. Inspired by the book Reflections in Black (2000), Deborah Williss groundbreaking and thorough excavation of a vital and neglected photographic tradition, Mr. Harriss film is a family memoir, a tribute to unsung artists and a lyrical, at times heartbroken, meditation on imagery and identity. The film is always absorbing to watch, but only once its over do you begin to grasp the extent of its ambitions, and just how much it has done within a packed, compact hour and a half.

title: Andy Murray Finds the Right Coach, Gender Aside
description: After a wild first-round match at the United States Open on Monday in which Andy Murray overcame cramping, he sat down for an interview and discussed his recovery from that experience and his thinking outside established norms in tennis by hiring a female coach, the two-time Grand Slam champion Amlie Mauresmo. BEN ROTHENBERG

title: What Were Reading
description: Recommended reads from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers that is sent twice a week as an email. Sign up

title: Kings of Leon Cancel Shows in New Jersey and Pittsburgh
description: When the Kings of Leon canceled a string of shows earlier this month after the groups drummer, Nathan Followill, was injured in an accident involving the bands tour bus, the hope was that the tour would pick up again at the PNC Arts Center, in Holmdel, N.J., on Aug. 28.

title: Fresh Air for Conventions
description: On a riverfront terrace with a view of the city skyline, it could be easy to take in the loungelike setting and mistake it for something other than what it is: a convention center in Detroit.

title: Richard Wood
description: Mr. Wood, 55, is the chief executive and president of Plaza Construction, which provides construction management and building and renovation services.

title: Sick Immigrant Sees Ghosts of Former Country; His Sons Take High Road
description: No young man ever needed a little marijuana more than Sergio in Barcel con Hielo. Luckily, his brother persuades him to smoke before their father gets home. Herbally abetted, the painfully reserved Sergio (Ivn Camilo) smiles and laughs for the first time in this comic drama.

title: Investor Relations Director Accused of Using Client Information for Insider Trades
description: For at least a year, Michael A. Lucarelli, an employee at an investor relations agency in New York, reaped huge rewards in the stock market. Now, his gains have become a publicity nightmare.

title: In New York and Ferguson, a Rush to Judgment
description: To the Editor:

title: A Heartless Double-Cross, Cloak-and-Dagger Style
description: Judging from The November Man, based on a novel by Bill Granger, the C.I.A.s operations in Eastern Europe are a friends-and-family affair. Former colleagues plot one anothers deaths. A junior officer interrogates her superior. A scorned pupil takes aim at his mentors loved ones. Geopolitical intrigue ranks second to daddy issues.

title: The Long Game in Turkey
description: To the Editor:

title: Rescheduling Child Care
description: To the Editor:

title: Summer Reading Winner, Week 9 | Adolescent Insecurities in the Age of YouTube
description: This weeks Summer Reading Contest received the most entries yet with 682 student responses. So congratulations, Kate Weber! As always, we also honor several runners-up and honorable mentions.

title: Botox Maker Allergan Sets Date for Special Shareholder Meeting
description: Allergan, the Botox maker fending off a hostile takeover attempt by Valeant Pharmaceuticals and Pershing Square Capital Management, has set a date for a special meeting at which shareholders will have the opportunity to vote out a majority of the board. In a filing with the Delaware Chancery Court, Allergan said the meeting would take place on Dec. 18.

title: Purrs Like a Kitty Cat, Stings Like a Bee
description: Once the applause for Ron Funches, a comedian whose name aptly conflates fun and bunches, quieted after his introduction at Carolines in Times Square, he said in mock-disappointment: Oh, that died down quickly. Then he giggled.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza City and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza City, Israel, Manila and Ukraine.

title: Full Immersion, Cabaret Style, Because the Pianist Wishes It
description: A hall helps create the impression of a piece of music almost as much as the player or the piece itself. It is doubtless largely because the pianist Taka Kigawas recital on Monday evening was held at Le Poisson Rouge, the basement club in Greenwich Village, that his program had such a bewitchingly suave, intimate effect.

title: Explaining Status Quo at Emmy Awards
description: Ricky Gervais, star of the Netflix original comedy Derek, took the stage at the 66th Primetime Emmy Awards on Monday to present an award after losing for best actor in a comedy series.

title: How Should We Act Against ISIS?
description: To the Editor:

title: Keeping Corporate Lawyers Silent Can Shelter Wrongdoing
description: Have you heard of Maritza I. Munich?

title: Arizona Treasurer Wins G.O.P. Primary for Governor
description: PHOENIX  Doug Ducey, the states treasurer and former chief executive of an international chain of ice cream parlors, defeated five opponents in the Republican primary for governor on Tuesday. His victory reaffirms the hold of the Republican Partys conservative establishment on Arizona politics despite a record turnout among independents, a more centrist constituency that makes up the largest voting bloc in the state.

title: With Youthful Vision, Focusing Lenses on a Wide and Complex World
description: As he kneels on a patchy concrete floor, scrubbing laundry in a spare house in northern India, Lhagyari Trichen Namgyal Wangchuk, 17 at the time, looks into the camera, grins and describes the paradox of his very ordinary life as a descendant of Tibetan kings. What began with the 1949 invasion of Tibet by China led to his familys exile, and he found himself doing chores while struggling to retain his cultural heritage. Yet because of BYkids, an organization that pairs beginning and professional filmmakers, he can explore his odyssey in one of five documentaries to be broadcast this fall by PBS.

title: Timeline: Two Days of Terror
description: A chronology of the terrorist attacks in Mumbai.

title: Giving Away Photos to Make a Profit
description: With the changes sweeping over photojournalism, Getty Images has been anticipating the needs of both viewers and editors.

title: How the Supreme Court Protects Bad Cops
description: IRVINE, Calif.  LAST week, a grand jury was convened in St. Louis County, Mo., to examine the evidence against the police officer who killed Michael Brown, an unarmed black teenager, and to determine if he should be indicted. Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. even showed up to announce a separate federal investigation, and to promise that justice would be done. But if the conclusion is that the officer, Darren Wilson, acted improperly, the ability to hold him or Ferguson, Mo., accountable will be severely restricted by none other than the United States Supreme Court.

title: Declare Yom Kippur a U.N. Holiday
description: THE emblem of the United Nations shows the planet brought together in the embrace of two olive branches. Its charter affirms the equal rights of nations large and small. But in the family of nations, some members are more equal than others. No example of this inequity is starker than that of Israel.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: RECENT SALE

title: AT&T Mobility Names a New Chief Executive
description: AT&T, the No. 2 carrier in the United States, said on Tuesday that it had given promotions to two senior executives, including the chief executive of its wireless business.

title: Tech Tenants Filling a Slice of Brooklyn Called Dumbo Heights
description: Among the leading gospels coming out of Brooklyn over the last century has been that of Jehovahs Witnesses.

title: Leader of Connecticuts Health Marketplace Is Named to Run Federal Program
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Tuesday named Kevin J. Counihan, who ran Connecticuts successful health insurance marketplace, as the chief executive of the federal marketplace serving consumers in 36 states.

title: The Drinkers Manifesto
description: Across my desk recently came a reissue of the 1964 classic The Drinking Mans Diet, a cute little volume that maintains that if you drink a bit youll lose weight. Counterintuitive, since one of the things we think we know about alcohol is that it provides truly empty calories, which generally speaking cause weight gain (see, for example, soda).

title: Comfort of Longtime Brands Inspires Campaigns
description: MARKETERS are hoping to take advantage of the history of their venerable brands as shoppers show a renewed interest in the roots of the products they buy.

title: What's the True Reach of Celebrity Altruism?
Fantasy Football: Preseason Stock Watch, Week 3
description: As we explained in previous weeks, preseason football is important in fantasy football analysis, but only if you are looking for the right things. Here is a look at the third week of preseason football and which players have helped their fantasy value, or hurt it.

title: No Thaw Yet in Ukraine
description: The presidents of Ukraine and Russia, Petro Poroshenko and Vladimir Putin, finally met on Tuesday in Minsk, but neither their words nor developments in eastern Ukraine gave much evidence that either side was ready for a cease-fire.

title: Safety Advocates Call for Florida to Curb Floating Watering Holes
description: MIAMI  In the clear waters of the bay here, not far from President Richard M. Nixons former compound on Key Biscayne, boaters enjoying a floating bacchanal routinely drop anchor on a sandbar, tether their boats together, and spend the day swimming, drinking, blasting music and jumping from boat to boat.

title: For First Time, S.&P. 500 Closes Above 2,000
description: The Standard & Poors 500-stock index reached a milestone on Tuesday, closing above 2,000 for the first time ever, if just barely. It was a lazy day of trading that picked up on some encouraging signs in the United States economy, but not enough for sustained optimism in the market.

title: A Bankers Bold Vision Inspires an Arts Center, and Neighbors Doubts
description: SANTANDER, Spain  From the horizon, the new Botn contemporary art center hovers over Santanders agate-colored bay like a fleet of spaceships poised for a close encounter.

title: Easy Primary Wins for Charlie Crist and Rick Scott in Florida
description: MIAMI  Gov. Rick Scott and his chief opponent, former Gov. Charlie Crist, both handily defeated opponents in their parties primaries on Tuesday.

title: Californias Embrace of Anti-Theft Technology in Smartphones Puts a Squeeze on Thieves
description: SAN FRANCISCO  It will soon get a lot harder for smartphone thieves to sell stolen iPhones, Samsung Galaxy phones and Windows phones on the black market.

title: Celebrating Ganesha Chaturthi in Queens
description: At the Hindu Temple Society of North America in Flushing, a nine-day festival honors the elephant-headed deity.

title: Detroit Mum on Proposal to Use Its Art as Collateral
description: On Wall Street, there is the art of the deal. In Detroit, there is the deal of the art.

title: Speed and Spectators Led to Twitch, a Gaming Nexus
description: To call Twitch.tv a happy accident would be a grand understatement.

title: Hard-Line Splinter Group, Galvanized by ISIS, Emerges From Pakistani Taliban
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani Taliban has suffered its second major split in three months, with militant leaders this week confirming the emergence of a hard-line splinter group inspired by the success of the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria.

title: A Fire for Ganesh
description: At a Hindu temple in Queens, prayers and offerings are presented during a fire ceremony, or homam, for the elephant-headed deity.

title: U.S. Fires on an Iranian Boat
description: A United States Coast Guard vessel fired Tuesday on an Iranian boat in the Persian Gulf in what the Defense Department said was a defensive maneuver. The crew of the Iranian craft, a sailing vessel called a dhow, pointed a machine gun at an inflatable Coast Guard boat as it approached during a routine security procedure. Officials said they did not know whether the single warning shot struck the dhow, which left without communicating with the Coast Guard crew, and no Americans were injured, the Defense Department said.

title: With Bells and Bananas, a Time to Worship Ganesh
description: Dr. Uma Mysorekar lifted the coconut above her head and dashed it against the gray granite floor of the temple, shattering it into pieces.

title: He Has a Dream
description: WASHINGTON  As he has grown weary of Washington, Barack Obama has shed parts of his presidency, like drying petals falling off a rose.

title: Turkey: Chinese Workers Abducted
description: Kurdish separatists kidnapped three Chinese engineers in an area near a power plant in Turkeys southeast, a regional government official said Tuesday. The attackers were believed to belong to the Kurdistan Workers Party, a militant group known as the P.K.K. It has waged an insurgency for decades against the Turkish state but has more recently been engaged in peace talks with it. Xinhua, the Chinese state news agency, said the engineers appeared to have been working Sunday evening at a thermal power plant belonging to a private company in Sirnak Province, near the Iraqi border, when the attack occurred. The P.K.K., which the United States, Turkey and the European Union consider a terrorist group, is based in northern Iraq, and has recently joined forces with Kurdish pesh merga fighters in their struggle against extreme Islamic militants gaining ground in Iraq.

title: As Online Video Surges, the .TV Domain Rides the Wave
description: Youve heard of the dot-com boom. Is the dot-tv boom next?

title: Noah Rubin Gets the Feel for a Bigger Stage at the U.S. Open
description: Noah Rubin stepped into a plausible preview of his United States Open tennis future early Tuesday afternoon when he strode onto a crowded Court 13, drowning out a boisterous reception with a pair of headphones and proceeding to confront an opponent six inches taller.

title: U.S. Mobilizes Allies to Widen Assault on ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  The United States has begun to mobilize a broad coalition of allies behind potential American military action in Syria and is moving toward expanded airstrikes in northern Iraq, administration officials said on Tuesday.

title: With Interest Growing, WTA Is Considering a Womens Team Event
description: As the best womens tennis players compete for themselves at Flushing Meadows, Womens Tennis Association officials are considering the creation of a new tour team event.

title: Rubio Warns Obama Against Executive Action on Immigration
description: Senator Marco Rubio, the Florida Republican who once advocated a broad immigration overhaul that would have included a path to legal status for people now in the country illegally, urged President Obama on Tuesday not to take unilateral action on the issue even to slow the pace of deportations.

title: Obama Pursuing Climate Accord in Lieu of Treaty
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is working to forge a sweeping international climate change agreement to compel nations to cut their planet-warming fossil fuel emissions, but without ratification from Congress.

title: Parents Scramble for Pre-K Seats in Brooklyn District
description: With less than two weeks before the public school year begins, the last-minute addition of more than 100 prekindergarten seats in a crowded Brooklyn district brought parents out in droves on Tuesday.

title: South Sudan: U.N. Helicopter Goes Down, Killing Three in Crew
description: A United Nations helicopter carrying cargo in South Sudan crashed on Tuesday, killing three of its four Russian crew members, the United Nations Mission in South Sudan reported. The aircraft, a Russian Mi-8 used by the United Nations under a contract with a Russian company, was lost near Bentiu, in oil-rich Unity State, where rebels and government forces have been fighting. United Nations officials said they were investigating and had no immediate comment on a rebel commanders assertions that his fighters had shot down the helicopter with a rocket-propelled grenade. News of the crash came a day after representatives of both sides signed an agreement in Ethiopia committing them to work toward a cease-fire and a national unity government, a step that was welcomed by Secretary General Ban Ki-moon. South Sudan has been in turmoil since December because of fighting between government soldiers loyal to President Salva Kiir and rebels loyal to former Vice President Riek Machar.

title: Nebraska: Ex-Federal Official Guilty in Pornography Case
description: Timothy DeFoggi, the former acting director of cybersecurity for the Department of Health and Human Services, was convicted in Nebraska on Tuesday on federal child pornography charges. Mr. DeFoggi, 56, was arrested as part of a continuing investigation into three child pornography websites, on one of which he registered as a member. Evidence showed he gained access to and solicited child pornography and wrote of his interest in the rape and murder of children, once suggesting meeting another member to fulfill that fantasy. Mr. DeFoggi is scheduled to be sentenced in November.

title: State Fairs Big Attraction: The Newest Timberwolves
description: FALCON HEIGHTS, Minn.  Minnesotans can be adaptable with their loyalties and their clothing, as 18-year-old Cale McElroy showed on Tuesday with a few strips of duct tape.

title: Vision Undimmed by Decades
description: LONDON  Kate Bush, through the decades, has become known as a farseeing artist, carrying out ambition at her own speed. Surely, that perception has been encouraged by all the images in her songs of places where the view is unobstructed. Shores, mountains, skies.

title: Manning to Take a Few Snaps as Giants Look to Sharpen Up in Finale
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The final N.F.L. preseason game is treated as a matter of survival by many coaches, leading them to keep marquee players on the sideline as the best way to ensure they will be intact when the regular season opens.

title: Clip Said to Capture Gunshots
description: A lawyer for a Ferguson resident believes that while his client was recording this message on a video chat service, he may also have recorded the gunfire that killed Michael Brown.

title: Recording May Capture Shots Fired at Michael Brown
description: FERGUSON, Mo.  The federal authorities have received a brief video clip from a man who lives near the site where Michael Brown was killed and which, the mans lawyer says, inadvertently captured the sounds of the gunshots fired at Mr. Brown.

title: Gig Part
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  I solved this one from the top down, and was about to be incredibly disappointed with the outlying CONGER LINES until I got to the bottom and stumbled upon TUBER PLAYER. I knew that such a glaring odd-man-out wouldnt pass muster.

title: Bratton Spurned 25% of Boards Police Misconduct Findings in First Half of 14
description: Since taking over the New York Police Department in January, Commissioner William J. Bratton has replaced each of the top officials in charge of disciplining officers and moved to remake training at the Police Academy to prevent misconduct.

title: Progress Is Made in Plan to Convert Post Office Into Penn Station Annex
description: Long a favorite project of civic organizations, developers and politicians, a $1 billion proposal to create a grand annex to Pennsylvania Station, North Americas busiest transit hub, has often moved like a creaky locomotive since it was conceived nearly 25 years ago.

title: No-Show Patterson Is Eligible to Return to Jets Next Week
description: Jets cornerback Dimitri Patterson, suspended indefinitely for disappearing from the team for at least 48 hours during the weekend, will be eligible to return Sept. 1, the team said. Additional terms of his discipline, which most likely included a fine, were not disclosed.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Aug. 26, 2014
The Expanding World of Poverty Capitalism
description: In Orange County, Calif., the probation departments supervised electronic confinement program, which monitors the movements of low-risk offenders, has been outsourced to a private company, Sentinel Offender Services. The company, by its own account, oversees case management, including breath alcohol and drug-testing services, all at no cost to county taxpayers.

title: A (Very) Basic Twitch Users Guide
description: A guide to the site for the nongamer.

title: Brooklyn Teacher Accused of Sending Lewd Photo
description: A Brooklyn high school teacher was arraigned on Tuesday on charges that he sent a sexually explicit photograph to a student over the popular messaging app Snapchat.

title: Safety Agents and de Blasio Administration Reach Labor Deal
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio and Teamsters Local 237, the municipal union representing school safety agents and special officers, announced a tentative contract and the proposed settlement of a pay equity lawsuit on Tuesday that would distribute $38 million in back pay to current and former school safety agents who are overwhelmingly female.

title: Making His U.S. Open Debut, Victor Estrella Burgos Is Embraced by Dominicans
description: The United States Open is a lovely tennis tournament, with stirring feats of athleticism and an often companionable crowd. Class and ethnic diversity, however, are not its most notable aspects.

title: Despite Racial Disparity, Alumni Group Backs Test-Only Policy for Elite Schools
description: A group of alumni of eight prestigious public high schools in New York City issued a statement on Tuesday in support of keeping a test as the sole criterion for entry, inserting themselves in a long-running debate over the admissions process and its impact on the schools racial makeup.

title: A Couple Fights the Cost of a Crossing
description: As Barbara Jaffe-Rose drove up the West Side of Manhattan and approached the Henry Hudson Bridge last month, her mother, Hilde Jaffe, pulled out a few dollars to pay the toll. That, it turned out, was an impossibility. No one was in any of the booths. There were no baskets to drop money into.

title: On a Last Trip to Detroit, Jeter Recalls a First One That Never Happened
description: DETROIT  Derek Jeter, recently called up to the major leagues, collected his 11th hit while batting ninth for the Yankees on June 11, 1995, against the Seattle Mariners. Batting ninth for Seattle that day was Alex Rodriguez, and Tino Martinez, then a Mariner, hit a home run.

title: Peter Theo Curtis, Released by Al Qaedas Syrian Branch, Flies Home to His Family
description: An American writer and freelance journalist held captive for nearly two years by Al Qaedas official branch in Syria returned to the United States late Tuesday after the government of Qatar brokered his release, according to his family.

title: In Aftermath of Missouri Protests, Skepticism About the Prospects for Change
description: MAPLEWOOD, Mo.  On Monday night, just a few hours after Michael Brown was laid to rest, an amiable judge sat in the City Council chambers here and weighed in on the traffic violations and petty crimes, one by one, of more than a hundred people. At least two-thirds of those waiting were black, roughly a reverse racial image of the demographics of Maplewood itself.

title: W.H.O. Moves Team in Sierra Leone After a Medical Worker Contracts Ebola
description: The World Health Organization announced Tuesday that it had removed its Ebola response teams from a region of Sierra Leone that has been hardest hit by the outbreak after a Senegalese epidemiologist there contracted the virus.

title: William Greaves, a Documentarian and Pioneering Journalist, Dies at 87
description: William Greaves, a producer and director who helped bring an African-American perspective to mainstream America as a host of the groundbreaking television news program Black Journal and as a documentary filmmaker, died on Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 87.

title: Enrique Zileri, Stalwart Publisher in Peru, Dies at 83
description: Enrique Zileri, the former publisher of Perus leading newsmagazine, which he called a symbol of resistance against censors and dictators and which brought him international honors and deportations by his own government, died on Monday in Lima. He was 83.

title: Philippine de Rothschild, Wine Nobility, Dies at 80
description: Philippine de Rothschild, a scion of the vaunted winemaking family who helped modernize and expand a renowned wine-producing enterprise that sells 22 million bottles annually, died on Saturday in Paris. She was 80.

title: Mervyn Susser, 92, Dies; Studied Illness and Society
description: Dr. Mervyn Susser, a South African-born epidemiologist whose work drew new attention to the connections between disease and the social conditions that can enable its spread, died on Aug. 14 at his home in Hastings-on-Hudson, N.Y. He was 92.

title: A Grinder Whose Next Stop May Be Citi Field
description: LAS VEGAS  About a year ago, after another bad game, Matt Reynolds sat in his car outside Tradition Field in Port St. Lucie, Fla., and called his father. He could not remember exactly which game it was. The whole season was a blur, one big struggle, as he put it. If he had to guess, he had just gone 0 for 4, with three strikeouts.

title: Walter Mazzone Dies at 96; Directed Navy Underwater Feats
description: Capt. Walter F. Mazzone played a pivotal role in two underwater Navy exploits during the 20th century. In World War II, he kept a waterlogged submarine from going belly up while it was carrying 40 Americans rescued from the Philippines. Twenty years later he helped organize the first Sealab tests of human endurance at crushing ocean depths  conducting the first tests on himself  which established the deepwater diving protocols still used by military and commercial divers today.

title: McCarthy Stumbles, and Yankees Fall Back
description: DETROIT  For five straight games, the Yankees relied on a simple formula for success. It had equal parts pitching, well-timed hitting and a rubber horse mask, worn by reliever Shawn Kelley during warm-up stretches, that served as a lucky charm.

title: Oh, the Things Youll See (Part of) in New York
description: For visitors to New York City, sidewalk sheds ruin the chance to get the complete picture. Here are some city landmarks currently obscured.

title: Celebrity Sighting a Brief Respite for Overmatched Australian
description: Nine American women had already advanced to the second round by nightfall Tuesday, waiting for the forerunner of them all to join them there.

title: A Master Surfboard Shaper Plies His Trade in New Jersey
description: On a muggy morning on the outskirts of Asbury Park, N.J., earlier this month, Ryan Lovelace, a 28-year-old surfboard builder from Santa Barbara, Calif., picked up a white foam surfboard blank and marched it into a nearby shaping bay. He was in the process of shaping, tinting, glassing and sanding 17 custom surfboards in just three days for his East Coast clientele. The setting was the Heavens, an old industrial space that Phil Browne, the owner of Glide Surf Company, has converted into a surfboard factory, mainly for Lovelace. Every inch of space was covered in white foam dust and the air was acrid from resin and accelerant.

title: Nonprofit Hospitals 2013 Revenue Lowest Since Recession, Report Says
description: Nonprofit hospitals last year had their worst financial performance since the Great Recession, according to a report released on Wednesday.

title: A Tipping Point for Too Much Talent
description: Can a sports team ever have too much talent?

title: Word of the Day | revile
description: revile \ri-vi(-)l\ verb

title: Delle Donne Helps the Sky Advance
description: Elena Delle Donne scored 34 points and hit the winning shot with eight seconds left, and the visiting Chicago Sky overcame a 19-point deficit to beat the Atlanta Dream, 81-80, and advance in the W.N.B.A. playoffs.

title: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, August 27, 2014
description: Any peace effort that does not tackle the root causes of the crisis will do little more than set the stage for the next cycle of violence.

title: Corrections: August 27, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: David Ferrers Maturity Proves Too Much for Damir Dzumhur at U.S. Open
description: In many ways, Damir Dzumhur craves to be David Ferrer.

title: Whats on TV Wednesday
description: 9:05 P.M. (HBO) VERONICA MARS (2014) She has left the private eye business behind her and has a New York City law firm on the horizon. But then Veronica (Kristen Bell, above) learns that her ex-boyfriend and former adversary, Logan (Jason Dohring), is a suspect in the murder of his rock star girlfriend. So she cant resist heading back to the town of Neptune to clear him. Its hard to believe that Veronica, having matured into the totally together woman you always knew she would become, would honestly want to return to this pitiful small town other than for a visit with Dad, Manohla Dargis wrote of this film, financed with Kickstarter and directed by Rob Thomas, who created the television series on which its based. She might want to extend that trip and nostalgically break out the Taser. She might even want to tie up some of the ends that have remained loose for the last seven years. But why would you want to go home again when you could just stream it on Amazon?

title: Xi Jinping the Hidden Star of a TV Series About Deng Xiaoping
description: A series about the late leader Deng Xiaoping that has dominated Chinese television for weeks has a hidden star: Xi Jinping.

title: Charting the Rise of Twitch
description: Twitchs peak viewership now rivals the average prime-time viewership of some cable networks.

title: Student Crossword | Music
description: Test your knowledge of music by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Generation Later, Poor Are Still Rare at Elite Colleges
description: In Generation Later, Poor Are Still Rare at Elite Colleges, Richard Prez-Pea writes about obstacles getting in the way of increasing economic diversity at selective colleges.

title: R.B.S. Fined $24 Million Over Mortgage Advice Failures
description: LONDON  A British regulator fined Royal Bank of Scotland 14.5 million pounds, or about $24 million, on Wednesday for failing to offer proper advice to mortgage customers, and criticized the bank for its delays in responding to the initial complaints.

title: Is NATO a Bulwark in Need of Reform or a Relic?
description: The comingNATO summit in Wales inSeptember has inspired a hotly contested debate about the organizations fitness for the 21st century  and even if should exist at all.

title: On the Sidewalks, Structures That Serve to Protect and Obscure
description: Welcome to New York, summer visitors, home of the endless sidewalk shed.

title: Mitch McConnell Is Headed Down the Stretch
description: Theres only one thing Barack Obama needs to keep his grip on power, Mitch McConnell said, his voice cracking amid the applause. He needs the U.S. Senate!

title: Giving Away Photos to Make a Profit
description: Photojournalism has gone through a sea change in both technology and business models in the nearly 20 years since Getty Images started. Despite the challenges, Jonathan Klein,the co-founder and chief executive of Getty Images, thinks these are the best of times, as more and more people rely on pictures for blogs, websites and even daily communication. He discussed with James Estrin Gettys recent moves to make pictures available online for free, a move that seems counterintuitive, but which he thinks results in making sure photographers are paid fairly for their work. Their conversation has been edited.

title: Unity Government Effort in Doubt as Afghan Candidate Boycotts Election Audit
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  American and United Nations officials scrambled to salvage Afghanistans bitterly contested presidential election on Wednesday after one candidate, Abdullah Abdullah, decided to boycott the internationally brokered audit of the vote.

title: 1914: Britain Sinks German Ship
description: LONDON  The 14,000-ton North German Lloyd steamship Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse, upon which many thousands of Americans have travelled to and from Europe, was sunk yesterday while in service as a German auxiliary cruiser, by a 5,000-ton British cruiser, after a chase lasting more than a week, off the West Coast of Africa. The cruiser had gone to the rescue of the Union-Castle liner Galician, from The Cape, which had been captured about ten days ago by the Kaiser Wilhelm der Grosse off Ferro, Canary Islands, as a result of a trick.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Aug. 28, 1914

title: Chiquita Seeks to Reassure Investors on Deal for Fyffes
description: LONDON  Chiquita Brands International and Fyffes tried to reassure investors about their planned merger, saying on Wednesday that they now expected the combined company to achieve an additional $20 million in annual cost savings by 2016.

title: Beheadings in Syria Now Routine, U.N. Panel Says
description: GENEVA  Public executions, often beheadings, are becoming a common spectacle in parts of Syria controlled by Islamic militants, and government forces there continue to massacre and torture civilians, a United Nations panel said in a report released on Wednesday.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: How Kesslers Lawsuit Could Change College Sports
description: The thought of colleges bidding, maybe even with cash, for the services of the best football and basketball prospects would make most university presidents blush.

title: A Legal Titan of Sports Labor Disputes Sets His Sights on the N.C.A.A.
description: First there was a victory for Kain Colter, a brawny Northwestern quarterback who wanted to form a union. Then there was a triumph for Ed OBannon, a former U.C.L.A. basketball star who did not like seeing others make money by featuring him in a video game. Both cases dealt serious blows to the foundations of the embattled N.C.A.A., which is built on the idea of athletes as unpaid amateurs.

title: Test Yourself | Miley Cyrus Causes a Stir Again at the VMAs
description: Below are the six paragraphs that comprise the Aug. 25 article VMAs 2014: Miley Cyrus Causes a Stir Again, This Time by Staying in Her Seat.

title: Daily Report: How Twitch.tv Became a Nexus for Video Gamers
description: To call Twitch.tv a happy accident would be a grand understatement, Mike Isaac reports.

title: New York Today: Scaffold City
description: Good morning on this very warm Wednesday.

title: Food Safety Is Crucial in China Deal for Baby Milk
description: HONG KONG  Six years ago, when tainted infant formula killed six babies in China and sickened 300,000, one of the biggest foreign investors in the sector was caught by surprise.

title: Christine Lagarde, I.M.F. Chief, Under Investigation in France
description: PARIS  Christine Lagarde, the head of the International Monetary Fund, said on Wednesday that French prosecutors had placed her under formal investigation, in an escalation of a long-running inquiry into a murky business affair that dates to her time as finance minister under President Nicolas Sarkozy.

title: Ubers Secret Agents: When Poaching Becomes Unethical
description: If there is one overarching lesson from a new report on how Uber, the smartphone-app car service, tries to poach drivers from its competitors, it is this: Competing with Uber isnt much fun.

title: The C.E.O. of a Sales Software Company Faces Up to Sales Shortcomings
description: Last week, we published a case study about a chief executive who was poised to address a woefully underperforming, 10-person sales staff.

title: Zara Withdraws T-Shirts After Accusations Online of Anti-Semitism
description: Updated | LONDON  The Zara T-shirt called the Sheriff went on sale online at 2 a.m., London time, on Wednesday.

title: The Word on Obamacare: Its Shrinking as a Political Issue
description: Last summer, lawmakers churned out news releases using the term Obamacare, 530 of them in June, July and August.

title: Japans Premier Supported Ceremony for War Criminals
description: TOKYO  Japans conservative prime minister, Shinzo Abe, sent a message of support earlier this year to a ceremony honoring more than 1,000 Japanese who died after convictions for war crimes, a government spokesman said on Wednesday. The move could worsen frictions between Japan and its neighbors, particularly China, over bitter memories of World War II in the region.

title: Morning Agenda: Unusual Offer for Detroits Art
description: As Detroit prepares to defend its plan next week to exit bankruptcy, city leaders have received an unusual offer to mortgage all the artwork in the Detroit Institute of Arts, Mary Williams Walsh writes in DealBook. A company called Art Capital, which makes loans backed by artwork, has told the city it is willing to lend it up to $3 billion, roughly 10 times the exit financing Detroit is now contemplating, using the museums art as collateral. The city has responded to the proposal with silence.

title: The Way We Ate (Personal)
description: The first time I had to cook for myself was the summer between my junior and senior years, when I was working for Bill Nordhaus on this paper (pdf); I shared a very beat-up apartment in New Haven, and tried, sort of, to do some of the cooking. To help, my mother bought me the Betty Crocker Good and Easy cookbook. And I have often told people about the, um, interesting recipes. But was my memory embellishing? Strangely, it never occurred to me to check it out on the intertubes. But I finally did  and no, I wasnt making any of it up:

title: App Smart | Learn to Code
description: Kit Eaton reviews three apps that will help you learn the basics of computer programming from your mobile device.

title: Programming Apps Teach the Basics of Code
description: KNOWING how to write computer code has probably never been more valuable. The barriers to learning code are low and keep getting lower  you just need a little patience and a dose of ambition. Some smartphone apps do a nice job of teaching the basics.

title: Reader Idea | Using Room for Debate to Teach Argumentative Writing and Discussion Skills
description: All this week, we are featuring Great Ideas From Readers, lesson plans from teachers who teach with The Times. If you have used The Times for teaching and learning and would like to see your idea in our blog, write in and tell us what you have done.

title: A Friendly Teenager From Another Planet
description: Dear Diary:

title: NATO Plans More Visible Presence in Eastern Europe
description: LONDON  Caught off guard by the crisis in Ukraine, NATO plans to create a spearhead rapid deployment force and a more visible presence in Eastern Europe to assuage concerns about Russian intentions, Anders Fogh Rasmussen, the alliances secretary general, was quoted as saying on Wednesday.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: Yohji Yamamoto Goes Where No Designer Has Gone Before
description: Finally, our post-World Cup prayers have been answered: A designer has linked up with a soccer team to make the players game jerseys. Yohji Yamamoto has designed 2014-15 uniforms for the European champion Real Madrid under the auspices of his Y-3 Adidas line. I have to say, they are pretty cool.

title: An Art Magazine Featuring Beyonc, Kelly Osbourne and Other Stars Like Youve Never Seen Them Before
description: The photographers Dimitri Scheblanov and Jesper Carlsen forged a professional partnership under the moniker of Herring & Herring, a tribute to their shared love of the pickled fish. Under it, they produce provocative and modern images for commercial and editorial clients spanning from Gucci and DeBeers to Vice magazine. Last year the pair created their first issue of Herring & Herring magazine, a text-free monograph devoted to fashion photography, which they published under the title Fit to Print and sent out to industry colleagues and friends.

title: Stockholm Syndrome in Paris
description: Sure enough, President Hollande has finally shown some steel  moving forcefully to suppress critics of his slavish adherence to the austerity demanded by Germany and Brussels.

title: A Door Into U.S. for Chinese Investors Closes  for Now
description: For the first time, the quota for visas available to Chinese investors hoping to obtain permanent residency status in the United States has been filled before the end of the fiscal year, a United States State Department official has announced.

title: Rethink Your Definition of Salsa
description: Twelve zesty sauces that vary nearly as much in their texture and preparation as they do in their flavors.

title: Heavy Use of Banned Cluster Bombs Reported in Syria
description: Cluster bombs, outlawed munitions that kill and maim indiscriminately, have caused more casualties in the Syrian civil war than in the 2006 Lebanon conflict, when Israels heavy use of the weapons hastened the treaty banning them two years later, a monitoring group said Wednesday.

title: Andr 3000 Is Moving On in Film, Music and Life
description: ATLANTA  Since April, Andr 3000 has been on the road, traveling from festival to festival with his old partner Big Boi to celebrate the 20th anniversary of their debut album as Outkast. And on Sept. 26, hell star, under his original name, Andr Benjamin, as Jimi Hendrix in Jimi: All Is by My Side, a biopic about the year just before Hendrixs breakthrough, when he moved to London, underwent a style transformation and squared off against Eric Clapton.

title: Concussion Lawsuit Seeks to Force Rule Changes in Soccer
description: A group of soccer parents and players filed a class-action lawsuit Wednesday morning against FIFA, the sports international governing body, over its handling of concussions. Filed in United States District Court in California, the suit also names American soccer organizations, including U.S. Soccer and the American Youth Soccer Organization, charging that they and FIFA have been negligent in monitoring and treating head injuries.

title: Dont Want Me to Recline My Airline Seat? You Can Pay Me
description: I fly a lot. When I fly, I recline. I dont feel guilty about it. And Im going to keep doing it, unless you pay me to stop.

title: Gift-Bearing Officials Try to Lure Chinese Factories Inland
description: HONG KONG  The Renley Watch Manufacturing Company is one of the companies that helped coastal southeastern China displace Switzerland as the center of the worlds watchmaking industry. But now Renley, like many watchmakers, is mulling whether to move far into Chinas interior.

title: 1939: Lights of Rome Darkened
description: ROME  Dim lights on alternate lampposts and a sharp falling off in the number of private automobiles on the streets gave Rome this evening [Aug. 27] its first outward signs of war preparations. Apart from this, the Italian capital was still conspicuous among the great cities of Europe for the unchanged tempo of its life. Thousands of citizens are away for their annual months vacation and have not come back. Thousands of others passed the day sunning themselves on the beach of Ostia, Romes seaport and bathing resort. Beneath this tranquil surface, however, both military preparations and diplomatic activity are proceeding. New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 28, 1939
