title: Greenpoint, Brooklyn: Flavored With a Dash of Poland
description: Just before she found her dream fixer-upper in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, Antoinette Sneed left an open house in tears. Raised in an Italian-American family in Williamsburg, she had all but given up on finding an affordable place in Brooklyn.

title: U.S. Captives Mother Issues Plea to ISIS
description: The mother of an American hostage being held by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria released an emotional video appeal to his captors on Wednesday. Shirley Sotloff, the mother of the 31-year-old freelance journalist Steven J. Sotloff, addressed her plea directly to Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of ISIS and the self-declared caliph of the Muslim world.

title: A Mothers Personal Appeal to ISIS
description: Shirley Sotloffs son Steven is being held by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria. In a video obtained by The New York Times, she spoke directly to the groups leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

title: Today in Small Business: The Knee Defender
description: Whats affecting me, my clients and other small-business owners today.

title: Back-to-School Blues
description: My four kids went back to school this morning.

title: $506 Billion Is Forecast for U.S. Deficit, a Slight Rise
description: WASHINGTON  The federal government is expected to finish its fiscal year with a relatively modest budget deficit as the gap between revenue and spending continues a sharp decline, the Congressional Budget Office said Wednesday.

title: T Presents | NYFFF + Kathryn Ferguson
description: The New York Fashion Film Festival showcases director Kathryn Ferguson, whose subjects in The Beauty Project: Change is a Beautiful Thing tackle aging with humor and style.

title: Looking to the Future of Data Science
description: The Association for Computing Machinery, a leading professional association in computer science, is this week holding its annual conference focused on what were now calling data science  though the ACM still clings to the label adopted when the yearly gatherings began in 1998, Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining. Of course, the field is booming, so the four-day conclave of talks, technical papers and human networking in New York has attracted an estimated 2,200 attendees, double last years headcount.

title: Will an Internet Break Make You Socially Smarter?
description: You can learn a lot from what you see on a screen, said Yalda T. Uhls. However, she told Op-Talk, Its not going to give you context. Its not going to give you the big picture.

title: A Crime Where the Telltale Clue Is a Corn Tassel
description: BRISTOL, Conn.  A pair of thefts have disrupted the quiet rhythms of two Connecticut towns and have up-at-dawn farmers and their loyal farm stand clientele fuming.

title: Painting Partners
description: If they hadnt existed in real life, Frida Kahlo and Diego Rivera might well have been dreamed up by a writer of childrens books. There was Diego, round and enormous, sought out by world leaders and captains of industry for his equally outsize talent, able to sit on a scaffold for 36 straight hours painting murals intended to change the course of history. There was Frida, tiny and broken-bodied, enduring physical agony to paint the story of her inner life with a sensuous fury that brought her international renown. Then there was their love and marriage, as passionate and treacherous as any romance between two Greek demigods.

title: What You Get for ... $2,400,000
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I.

title: Wheelies: The Goodbye, Dollie! Edition
description: A roundup of motoring news from the web:

title: House Hunting in ... Bulgaria
description: A CONTEMPORARY VILLA ON THE BLACK SEA IN BULGARIA

title: No Comment Necessary: The Gosh Darn Minimum Wage
description: The Nation magazine obtained an audio tape of Senator Mitch McConnell discussing strategy with wealthy donors at a conference convened by the Koch brothers. He said he would seek to shrink the federal government across the board and explained what the Senate would look like if he were to become majority leader.

title: As Truce Holds, Dazed Gazans Get to Work
description: JERUSALEM  Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel and Ismail Haniya, the Gaza-based political leader of Hamas, both declared a decisive victory on Wednesday as residents on both sides of the border grappled with the death and destruction wrought in a 50-day battle that ended in a limited cease-fire agreement the night before.

title: Syrian Rebels Take Control of Crossing in the Golan
description: LONDON  Islamist opposition fighters in Syria, including members of an Al Qaeda affiliate, took control of the Quneitra crossing point on the demarcation line with the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights, activists said on Wednesday.

title: Two Seasons Worth of World Music
description: Two organizations that present world music have announced their schedules for the coming season, and between them they offer a large sampling of the worlds traditional music forms as well as contemporary styles with distinctive regional accents.

title: Wall St. Prosecutors Bare Their Teeth, but Still Lack Bite
description: Admitting a problem, as the clich has it, is the first step to solving it. But with the Justice Department and the Securities and Exchange Commission, admissions of wrongdoing have been the last step. Theres much work to be done to hold giant corporations accountable for their misdeeds.

title: Mobile Sales Lift Alibaba Profit Nearly Threefold, Ahead of I.P.O.
description: With less than a month before its initial public offering, the Alibaba Group is intent on showing just how profitable  and focused on mobile  it truly is.

title: Finding Bagels in Myanmar
description: Thomas Fuller reports on Southeast Asia. His work recently led him to Sharky, a restaurateur who produces European food in Myanmar, where whole-milk mozzarella cheese and bagels are novel. Heres how he found him.

title: In Dublin, Shopping Away From the Crowds
description: Drury Street in the heart of Dublin is just a few short blocks from Grafton Street, the citys main shopping avenue, but the comparatively smaller strip has a more authentic feel. Instead of international chain stores and tourist-heavy congestion, there are fewer crowds and a diverse mix of locally owned boutiques housed in low brick buildings and selling everything from home goods to Irish art. Its a favorite destination for locals who come for the far from ho-hum finds.

title: A Taste for Lunch in Ashland, Ore.
description: On a recent summer afternoon, it was a busy scene outside the Ashland Food Co-op, where the lunch menu is the biggest draw. On a small triangle of grass a barefooted young woman in a grass skirt did a rather frantic and awkward hip dance while her shirtless tattooed partner played the bongos. Two gray-haired men wearing button-downs ate salad at an outdoor table and argued about Richard Blanco, the Inaugural poet in 2013 who gave a reading here last year.

title: Medicare: Not Such a Budget-Buster Anymore
description: Youre looking at the biggest story involving the federal budget and a crucial one for the future of the American economy. Every year for the last six years in a row, the Congressional Budget Office has reduced its estimate for how much the federal government will need to spend on Medicare in coming years. The latest reduction came in a report from the budget office on Wednesday morning.

title: Kevin Spacey to Sing in Benefit Concert
description: You may have seen  and may have been impressed by  Kevin Spacey singing in the 2004 film Beyond the Sea, a biopic in which he played the singer Bobby Darin (he also directed the film, and wrote the script with Lewis Colick). You might also have caught his performance of Mind Games in Come Together: A Night for John Lennons Words and Music, a 2001 television tribute taped at Radio City Music Hall. There is, apparently, plenty more where that came from: Mr. Spacey plans to set aside his current Washington persona, as the nefarious Frank Underwood on House of Cards, and sing a full concert there on Sept. 29 at Shakespeare Theaters Harman Hall.

title: A Teenagers Study Suggests Public Colleges Get Less Times Attention
description: Last year, as a college freshman, Jack Fischer decided to put some casual observations to the test.

title: Ukraine Reports Russian Invasion on a New Front
description: DONETSK, Ukraine  Determined to preserve the pro-Russian revolt in eastern Ukraine, Russia reinforced what Western and Ukrainian officials described as a stealth invasion on Wednesday, sending armored troops across the border as it expanded the conflict to a new section of Ukrainian territory.

title: Irish Fest With Yiddish
description: A new season on and Off Broadway is revving up, and it will be a busy and somewhat star-studded fall. But before we get sidetracked with all of that, lets give some thought to a smaller but no less notable event: the annual Origins 1st Irish Festival.

title: Shakespeareans From All Walks of Life
description: There were 4-year-olds and 90-year-olds in the rehearsal room, teachers and taxi drivers and nannies and ushers, laughing and shouting during a sheepshearing scene in The Winters Tale, a 90-minute musical adaptation of Shakespeares late play that will open on Sept. 5 at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: Bringing Digital Analytics to Main Street Retailers
description: In 2010, Rudd Davis helped start a business that developed a technology platform to let hotels deliver personalized content to guest phones. At the same time this was happening, Mr. Davis and his parents bought a century-old country store in their small Vermont town.

title: A Proenza Schouler Alum Launches a Line Made From Traditional Guatemalan Textiles
description: Caroline Fuss had just completed a Proenza Schouler design internship when she visited Guatemala for the first time in 2011. Impressed by the quality and intricacy of the weavings in the village markets she visited, the Australian-born, New York-based designer set out to build a sustainable fashion line that would utilize and promote what she saw as an untapped textile resource. The result is Harare, named after the Zimbabwean town where Fusss mother and grandmother were raised. Almost every piece in the line is comprised of fabric woven by small groups of Guatemalan artisans, many of whom are the tenth generation to practice their trade; the garments are sewn or knitted in New York or Los Angeles.

title: A New Bike Tour in the Adirondacks
description: A weeklong bike tour in the Adirondack mountain range in upstate New York  meals and accommodations included  is registering riders for its debut next year, Aug. 23 to 29.

title: A 9-Year-Old at a Shooting Range, a Spraying Uzi and Outrage
description: WHITE HILLS, Ariz.  The four-hour tours offered by one of the big gun ranges here are a popular tourist attraction. Starting at $200 a person, a bus will pick up visitors at their hotel in Las Vegas, 25 miles to the north, show them Hoover Dam and bring them to a recreational shooting range called Last Stop, where they can fire the weapons of their dreams: automatic machine guns, sniper rifles, grenade launchers. A hamburger lunch is included; a helicopter tour of the nearby Grand Canyon is optional.

title: U.S. Open 2014: Venus Williams Easily Escapes Wave of Upsets Arriving With the Heat
description: As if the theoretical heat of playing in the last Grand Slam tournament of the year were not enough to keep the United States Open interesting, the actual heat added several more degrees of difficulty on Wednesday.

title: S.E.C. Adopts New Rules on Asset-Backed Securities and Credit Ratings
description: Nearly six years after the financial crisis, regulators have voted to require more disclosure and impose new controls for two sectors of Wall Street that were at the heart of the collapse.

title: Lending Club, Middleman for Small Loans, Plans Stock Offering
description: Updated, 8:19 p.m. | Obtaining a loan was once a matter of heading down to the bank and applying. But the technology boom of the last decade has given rise to a new way, where web-savvy investors can connect directly with would-be borrowers.

title: In Audio From a Koch Event, McConnell Envisions Undoing Obama Initiatives
description: WASHINGTON  At a private conclave with the billionaire Koch brothers political apparatus this year, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the Republican leader, laid out a confrontational agenda for a Republican-controlled Senate aimed at dismantling President Obamas legislative successes through the federal budget.

title: Former Assistant to Jasper Johns Pleads Guilty in Thefts of Artworks
description: A man who worked for nearly 30 years as a studio assistant to the artist Jasper Johns pleaded guilty in Federal District Court in Manhattan on Wednesday to a charge of unlawfully transporting artworks stolen from his employer.

title: The Future Could Work, if We Let It
description: One persistent criticism of the tech industry is that it no longer works on big ideas. For all of Silicon Valleys talk of changing the world, critics say, Google and Facebook mainly hire armies of coders to figure out how to serve you more relevant ads, while Apple and Amazon just want to keep selling you new stuff.

title: Using Light Technique, Scientists Find Dimmer Switch for Memories in Mice
description: Memories and the feelings associated with them are not set in stone. You may have happy memories about your familys annual ski vacation, but if you see a tragic accident on the slopes, those feelings may change. You might even be afraid to ski that mountain again.

title: Alaska Referendum Upholds Tax System for Oil Companies
description: SEATTLE  A hard-fought ballot referendum that would have overturned Alaskas system of taxing oil industry profits, put to voters last week but until now considered too close to call, has failed by a narrow margin, with absentee ballots counted this week nailing down the outcome.

title: Wall Street Takes the Ice Bucket Challenge
description: Updated, 4:44 p.m. | Wall Street bankers are generally not known for being hip to the latest viral memes. But in a measure of the enormous reach of the ice bucket challenge, some prominent investment bankers are now taking part.

title: Lagardes Lawyer on Investigation
description: Yves Repiquet, a lawyer for Christine Lagarde, the chief of the International Monetary Fund chief, discussed an investigation by Frances Court of Justice of the Republic involving his client.

title: Josh Gordons One-Year Suspension Is Upheld by N.F.L.
description: The N.F.L. on Wednesday upheld its season-long suspension of Josh Gordon, a star wide receiver for the Cleveland Browns, for another violation of the leagues substance abuse policy.

title: General Forced to Retire Over Sex Assault Case
description: WASHINGTON  An Army general who was found to have mishandled an accusation of sexual assault has been forced to retire with a reduced rank, the Defense Department said on Wednesday.

title: Schimmel Center Offers Patti LuPone, Buster Keaton and Loudon Wainwright III
description: The Schimmel Center at Pace University will present a new series in which silent films are shown with live music, as well as productions of The Nutcracker and Don Quixote by the Gelsey Kirkland Ballet and concerts by Loudon Wainwright III, Patti LuPone, Ben Vereen and the Knights as part of its 2014-15 season.

title: Life After Brooklyn Resonates With Readers
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio and his family arent the only ones leaving Brooklyn.

title: Women Discuss the Meaning of Beauty in a Short From the New York Fashion Film Festival
description: In this new series, Chris Labzda and Bon Duke, the co-founders of the New York Fashion Film Festival, curate a short film each week for T.

title: How I Spent 4 Hours at OHare
description: So let me tell you about my great trip to Chicago. I saw some cool public art, was wowed by a towering brachiosaurus from the Field Museum of Natural History, had a locally brewed beer at the famed Billy Goat Tavern, ate a masterful Chicago-style hot dog, ordered takeout from a famed local chef, browsed in a local bookstore and bought a gift for my mom that she raved about.

title: Newly Released Books
description: THE STORY OF LAND AND SEABy Katy Simpson Smith243 pages. Harper. $26.99.

title: Ex-Iowa State Senator Admits Taking Cash to Switch Allegiance
description: WASHINGTON  A former Iowa state senator pleaded guilty Wednesday to receiving and concealing payments in exchange for switching his support from one presidential candidate to another in the 2012 election, the Justice Department said.

title: How Students Can Get More Sleep
description: I was sitting in class, my freshman year of college, quietly taking notes, when suddenly somethingcrawled up from underneath the seat in front of me. I recoiled in horror: It was a witch!

title: In Queens Primary, 2-Term Senator Faces Rival Seeking a Comeback
description: On the hilly streets of Whitestone, Queens, the Hamptons-bound helicopters buzzing overhead were ruining the afternoon quiet. A collapsed storm drain was a trap for unsuspecting children. And each dilapidated house was another sign of middle-class malaise amid the million-dollar properties.

title: Readers Respond to the Andrew Cuomo Non-Endorsement
description: The editorial boards decision not to endorse either candidate in the Democratic primary for governor was guaranteed to annoy partisans on both sides, and the comments ontodays editorialreflect that anger. The most frequently voiced criticism was: You wimped out, inthe words of Nancy Fitz, from Greenwich, Conn. We should have made a choice, they said, just as voters must.

title: How Nicole Zeitzer Johnson, Communications Director and Special Needs Parent, Does It
description: Nicole Zeitzer Johnson is the director of communications at Qello, a digital streaming service for full-length concerts and music documentaries, and the mother of two children, Tanner, 7, and Josie, 2. Josie has a rare genetic neurological condition called FoxG1, which is associated with impaired development. In the How I Do It series, Motherlode asks parents, from members of Congress to retail clerks, to share how they do it on one typical day.

title: Nobody Beats Wiz Khalifas Album; Shake It Off Soars
description: On the music charts this week, the rapper Wiz Khalifa lands his first No. 1 album, while Taylor Swift sails to the top with her new single, Shake It Off.

title: A Withheld Endorsement for Governor
description: To the Editor:

title: Valentino Kicks Off its Manhattan Flagship With a New Pair of Kicks
description: Last year, Valentino made real-estate and fashion headlines when it announced plans to take over the former New Yorksite of thehigh-end Japanese department store Takashimaya, on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan. Earlier this month, the three-story flagship store at last opened its doors. To commemorate the new digs, the Valentino creative directors Maria Grazia Chiuri and Pierpaolo Piccoli are debuting a limited-edition, unisex style of Rockrunner sneakers to be sold exclusively at the new location. They sport subtle matte studs, white-on-white camouflage and big red hearts on the heels  the brands nod to the classic I Love New Yorkemblem.

title: Behind the Blackwater Trial
description: Why the case of four Blackwater guards, charged with murdering 14 Iraqis in Nisour Square on Sept. 16, 2007 (the Iraqi government had originally accused them of killing 17), took so long to reach a verdict.

title: Ratan Tata Buys Stake in Indian Online Retailer Snapdeal
description: Ratan Tata, one of Indias most influential tycoons, is buying a stake in Snapdeal, an online marketplace, becoming the latest investor to jump in the countrys booming e-commerce sector.

title: Blackwater Jurors Urged to Give Iraqis Justice
description: WASHINGTON  Iraqi civilians never stood a chance against a convoy of Blackwater security guards armed with machine guns, grenade launchers and sniper rifles, a federal prosecutor said Wednesday. But he told jurors that an American courtroom, where four members of that convoy are standing trial, levels the playing field.

title: Firing Range Accident Kills Instructor
description: Video released by the Mohave County Sheriffs Office in Arizona shows a 9-year-old girl firing an Uzi submachine gun next to her instructor before she lost control of it.

title: Buffetts Involvement in Burger King-Tim Hortons Deal Is a Diversion
description: Warren E. Buffetts name is giving a public relations boost to Burger Kings deal to buy Tim Hortons. But some commentators on Twitter are calling Mr. Buffett, the head of Berkshire Hathaway, a hypocrite and branding him unpatriotic for supporting a companys move to Canada from the United States. Both sentiments are diversions.

title: 36 Hours in Charlotte, N.C.
description: In 1755, the Pennsylvania homesteader Thomas Polk settled at the intersection of two trading paths used by North Carolinas Catawba Indians. Thirteen years later, the settlement that sprang up was named for Charlotte Sophia, the wife of Englands King George III. But it wasnt until 1799 that Charlottes emergence as a financial center began, with the discovery of a 17-pound gold nugget in the northern woods, sparking the nations first gold rush. In the years since, Charlotte has endured war, poverty, racial strife and financial crisis on its way to becoming a global banking powerhouse. Today, Polks original crossroads lies in the shadow of the Bank of America tower in the heart of an eminently walkable downtown, which Charlotteans call Uptown. In the last decade, escapees from jobs in the corporate world have revitalized nearby enclaves like Dilworth, NoDa and Plaza Midwood, leaving galleries, breweries and farm-to-table enterprises in their wake  all increasingly linked by greenway, bike route and light rail. The Queen City is smaller and easier to navigate than, say, Atlanta, and is an excellent place to soak up the new Old South.

title: Tyson Foods and Hillshire Win Antitrust Clearance for Merger
description: Updated, 7:26 p.m. | Tyson Foods has reached a deal with the Justice Department to sell its hog-purchasing business as part of its planned $7.7 billion acquisition of Hillshire Brands.

title: Chasing Fairy Dust in Jackson Hole
description: Snowboard legends Jeremy Jones and Bryan Iguchi head into the Jackson Hole backcountry with young snowboarders, Frank Knab and Jimmy Goodman.

title: Broadway Darlings, Rejects and Mixed Memories
description: Critics for The New York Times recently checked back on long-running Broadway shows to see how they were holding up. On ArtsBeat, we asked readers for their memories of the shows. These are excerpts from their responses.

title: Protect and Power Back-to-School Gear
description: There is more to back-to-school tech than laptops and smartphones.

title: British Police Arrest 2nd Man in Killing of Pakistani Politician
description: LONDON  The police in Britain said Wednesday that they had arrested a 30-year-old man in connection with the killing of a senior Pakistani politician, Imran Farooq, who was stabbed to death in 2010 as he walked to his home in northwest London.

title: Convictions of Amish Sect Leader and Followers Overturned in Hair-Cutting Attacks
description: A federal appeals court on Wednesday overturned the hate-crimes convictions of the leader of a breakaway Amish sect and his followers who sowed fear in the Amish of eastern Ohio in 2011 for a bizarre series of attacks in which they cut the hair and beards of rivals.

title: Video: Chasing Fairy Dust in Jackson Hole
description: Higher Unplugged looks at the making of the film Higher, which follows the snowboarder Jeremy Jones and the TGR crew as they ascend and ride peaks in Alaska, Wyoming, California and Nepal. Jones is a professional snowboarder who has been named big mountain rider of the year 10 times by Snowboarder magazine.

title: Spiralling Tensions at Frank Lloyd Wright Architecture School
description: The architecture school run by the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation on Wednesday criticized a decision by the foundations board that will result in the school losing its accreditation.

title: Alex Katz on Old NFL Films, Matisse and Levis 501s
description: Next month, the legendary New York artist Alex Katz will unveil Katherine and Elizabeth, 2014, a new public commission along the High Line in the Meatpacking District, directly across from the new home of the Whitney Museum of American Art. Katz was a logical choice to inaugurate what will be an ongoing series of large-scale public works jointly commissioned by the museum, High Line Art and the local developer TF Cornerstone. Often cited as a progenitor of Pop Art, Katz, now 87, has exerted influence on several generations of New York painters.

title: Your Evening Briefing
description: Heres what you need to know from NYT Now:

title: Leaving Money and Privacy on the Table
description: What Stays in Vegas is a very far cry from what it promises to be. Adam Tanners ostensible objective is to reveal big secrets about how Las Vegas casinos, notably those owned by Caesars Entertainment, collect and use data that customers drop when they visit, just as they drop money. Surely, theres something sexier about this than there is about the way Amazon analyzes you based on your purchases. Surely theres something about gambling that makes it different from surfing the web. Not exactly. Mr. Tanner, a fellow at the Institute for Quantitative Social Science at Harvard and a former Reuters bureau chief, spends a lot of time covering familiar ground. And not all of it is in Nevada. He starts at Harvard Business School, where Gary Loveman joined the faculty at 29 and became known for an article about the financial value of customer satisfaction. As part of his job, he trained executives from Harrahs, the casino giant. A few years later, he left academia to become Harrahs chief operating officer and moved to Las Vegas. He may have been the only guy in town who used words like stochastic and vitiate in conversation.

title: Oceans Agency Lists 20 Coral Species as Threatened
description: After two years of assessment and public comment, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration has whittled down an initial list of 66 coral species considered for protection under the Endangered Species Act in 2012 and today listed 20 as threatened and no species as endangered  the most protective category. Five of the newly listed species are from the Caribbean and 15 from the Pacific or Indian Oceans. Two coral species, elkhorn and staghorn, were listed as threatened in 2006.

title: Pictures of the Day: Gaza City and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Gaza City, Israel, Ukraine and California.

title: California Agrees to Expand Film and TV Incentive
description: LOS ANGELES  Lawmakers and Gov. Jerry Brown of California on Wednesdaysaid they had reached an agreement to expand the California film incentive program, capping a drive by entertainment industry unions, filmmakers and executives to bolster sagging movie and television production in the state.

title: Duelists Armed With Banter and Mutual Admiration
description: HOLMDEL, N.J.  In hip-hop tours this summer, two has trumped one. There was the juggernaut teaming of Jay Z and Beyonc, who have love (or maybe not, a tension they slyly played with) and oodles of collaborations between them. After that came the grand-scale mash-up of Eminem and Rihanna, who share some hits and, it turns out, not much else.

title: American Kids, Learning to Aim and Fire
description: According to Pew Research, different estimates say there are from 270 million to 310 million guns in the United States  almost one firearm for every man, woman and child. Statistics from the Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence include these depressing numbers:

title: A Veteran Bridge Foursome Keeps on Playing
description: What is the combined age of the oldest foursome playing bridge together?

title: Just Out of the Box From Britain
description: The work of three influential British designers has just landed at Crate & Barrel. Freemont, a mahogany extension table by the furniture maker Russell Pinch, was inspired by classic farmhouse shapes. Its rounded top and turned legs are updated with a deep brown stain and wire brush finish. The $999 table, 60 inches long and 38 inches wide, includes an 18-inch-wide leaf tucked under the top.

title: Improving on Nature
description: If Keiichi Tanakas ceramic wall vases were not holding botanicals, they would easily stand alone as sculpture. Im inspired by the old tools and handicrafts hanging on walls of old farmhouses, Mr. Tanaka said, adding that he sought forms that would look beautiful even without flowers and trees. He makes the vases by hand in his home studio in Kawagoe, near Tokyo. He achieves the aged metallic look by applying a custom blended metal-infused glaze and firing each piece at 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit, then applying a black pigment and firing again at a lower temperature. His Linear vase ($310) and Circular vase ($280) are available from March in San Francisco. Information: 415-931-7433 or marchsf.com.

title: Discounts at Company C, Korin, Thomas Paul and Pan American Phoenix
description: All bedding and pillows are 30 percent off at Company C through Saturday (the Asters pillow, regularly $98, is about $69; the Diva pillow, regularly $125, is about $87); 800-818-8288, companyc.com.

title: This Vacuum Established a Tough Beachhead
description: I live near a beach with a large family. Sand is my nemesis. My garage is a museum of vacuum cleaners tried and for the most part abandoned  from cumbersome canisters with bags and cords to an old-school manual sweeper.

title: Saved From the Flames, Ready for Love
description: A couple of years ago, the Flanagan farmstead was so far gone that the local fire department was considering using it as fodder for a training exercise. If that had happened, only the beautifully proportioned broken-down barn would have survived.

title: Mother Natures Daughters
description: If you wanted to find someone picking a fat tomato this week in the City of New York, you could go see Esther and Pam, near the kiddie-pool planters on the rooftop of the Metro Baptist Church in Hells Kitchen. Or Maggie, Benia, Iyeshima and Kristina at the Bushwick Campus Farm and Greenhouse. Or Deborah, Shella, Sarah, Kate, Rachel and Chelsea in the West Indian haven of East New York Farms. Or Kennon, Leah, Jennifer and Charlotte at the Queens County Farm Museum, which has been planted continuously since 1697. Or Mirem, Cecilia and (another) Esther in the converted parking lot outside P.S. 216 in Gravesend. Or Nick, Caspar and Jared, on a one-acre farm and orchard in Randalls Island Park.

title: The House Collectors Dilemma
description: The people at the California tourism board should hook up with Eric Jacobson and Roy Luthringer, and plaster the couples story onto brochures and billboards. After all, who better to convey the promise and dynamism of the Southern California dream than two men who own four homes, none more than two hours drive apart, yet each exemplifying a distinct, alluring way of life?

title: The Dirt on Your Sponge
description: Tod Maitland, 56, is a sound mixer and 30-year veteran of the film and television business, having worked on more productions than there is room here to list. Hes also an inventor. While working on M*A*S*H, the television series, he said recently, he figured out how to dull the water noise in the shower scenes (it involved horsehair), and was inspired to create a product that would muffle the sound of rain on an air-conditioner (it involved rubber, and because he didnt have a patent, was not a career changer).

title: Amazon Unveils Its Latest Smiles and Thrills
description: Playing catch-up with Netflix is grueling business. Amazon posted five new online pilots aimed at adults in February and ordered full seasons of four of them in March. Now, before any of those shows have arrived, five more pilots are being posted Thursday on Amazon Instant Video.

title: How Do You Stage an Apartment When You Have Young Kids?
description: Q. We have three young children, so staging our apartment before each showing can be a challenge. Whats the bare minimum we should do?

title: New Features on Our Site and in the iOS App
description: SPECIAL POST  The New York Times Crossword is happy to announce the restoration of an additional three years of crosswords to our web archive of nearly 8,000 puzzles (coming soon to iOS). Thanks to Jim Horne of Xword Info, solvers can now solve many more puzzles while waiting for the next daily to come out. The New York Times is grateful to Mr. Horne for hosting the 1993-1996 archives for us before we expanded.

title: Michael Vick, Starting vs. Eagles, Is Still Grateful for Second Chance
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Philadelphia Eagles fans, notorious for once booing Santa Claus and pelting him with snowballs, are expected to give quarterback Michael Vick a far warmer reception when he returns to Lincoln Financial Field on Thursday night.

title: Reporting on the Front Lines in Ukraine
description: Covering the war in eastern Ukraine has been a challenge partly because it has involved a lot of moving across vast territories of shifting front lines and cutting through rural farmland and industrial urban sprawl on trips that sometimes take hours in each direction. And as in all conflict reporting, the risks of any particular trip, frustratingly, do not always correlate with the payoff in newsworthiness.

title: Everyone Loves a Loner
description: LOS ANGELES  In the next two weeks, film festival viewers will join Reese Witherspoon on her long, lonely hike through the wilderness in the movie version of Wild, Cheryl Strayeds best-selling book about a solo trek along the Pacific Crest Trail. And that trip will mark the latest entry in an emerging subgenre among Hollywood dramas, the contemporary cinema of solitude.

title: At the Venice Film Festival 2014, Liya Kebede is a Vision in Violet
description: The Star: Liya Kebede

title: A Debate Over Tiananmen Finds Echoes in Germanys Fascist Past
description: The military suppression of the Tiananmen Square democracy protests in June 1989 was a one-off in Chinas recent history. Its leaders lost control of the situation. China is freer today than in 1989. Its people have the right to forget.

title: Photographs That Make a Difference
description: Bob Adelman, who has devoted his career to making pictures that make a difference, has been named photographer in residence at the Library of Congress.

title: Bringing Tech Culture to the Staid College Quad
description: COLLEGE has its problems. Its expensive, it has some outdated traditions and it has a tendency to produce graduates who struggle to find jobs in the rapidly changing economy.

title: Saving on College Textbooks
description: There are cheaper ways to get your textbooks for college, they just involve being a better shopper. Sites like Chegg, Bookrenter and Packback allow you to digitally buy or rent books as you need them.

title: Dubbing 007
description: German actor Dietmar Wunder performs the voice of Daniel Craig as James Bond, among many others, as a dubbing artist in Berlin.

title: Another Season, Another App
description: ONCE UPON A TIME, back in the days of Norman Rockwell certainty, the last long weekend of summer meant predictable things: the United States Open, back to school, back to work, the dawn of cooler weather. And all of those clichs were clichs because they were true.

title: No Country for Subtitles (Just Voices)
description: BERLIN  As a rule, Dietmar Wunder prefers his martinis shaken and not stirred. But dont ask him to order one at a Berlin bar, at least not in German.

title: Street Style in the Meatpacking District, New York City
description: The meatpacking district in Manhattan comes alive at night. If you happen to be in the neighborhood during the day, you will find people strolling the cobblestone streets visiting Chelsea Market, shopping at the high-end boutiques, or  on weekends  going to brunch. Katerina Mozgovoy, who works in the neighborhood, was running errands on a recent afternoon and stood out because of her bright red hair and lipstick. She was wearing an equally colorful outfit, with a floral skirt her mother made and a necklace she bought in Peru. This interview has been edited and condensed.

title: Lawmakers Want Congress to Decide on Military Action Against ISIS
description: WASHINGTON  A bipartisan group of lawmakers on Wednesday called for Congress to debate and vote on whether to authorize President Obama to take military action against Sunni militants in Iraq and Syria.

title: JPMorgan and Other Banks Struck by Hackers
description: A number of United States banks, including JPMorgan Chase and at least four others, were struck by hackers in a series of coordinated attacks this month, according to four people briefed on a continuing investigation into the crimes.

title: Shopping for Fall? Sweater Dresses and Hiking Boots Can Update Your Look
description: Let beach bunnies lament summers end. Shorter days bring sweater weather, and designers like Marc Jacobs, Stella McCartney and Phoebe Philo of Cline have already signaled their excitement. The fall collections are chockablock with great knits. Knit wits may go for head-to-toe looks inspired by the catwalk; novices can start by updating their wardrobes with a cozy sweater dress. Add a woolly cap, cute socks, boots. ...

title: Josh Shaw of U.S.C. Says He Lied About Saving Drowning Nephew
description: LOS ANGELES  The fantastical story of the Southern California football player Josh Shaw leaping out of a second-floor window to rescue a drowning nephew was, it turns out, too fantastical to be true.

title: Video of Combat in Eastern Ukraine Adds to Worries in Kiev
description: While the advance of pro-Russian separatists across a swath of southern Ukraine stirred alarm Wednesday, hundreds of protesters gathered outside the presidents office in Kiev to complain about the conduct of the war in the east of the country, where five battalions of volunteer fighters were reportedly cut off by a rebel counterattack.

title: A Scandal at the C.I.A. Maybe.
description: The green metal file box was about the size and shape of an ammunition case. It was scuffed and serious-looking and packed tight with personal letters and papers that had belonged to my grandfather, who died in 1989. The line in the family had always been that he did intelligence work in Washington after the war. This file box gave up a better story: My grandfather was an operations officer with the C.I.A. from January 1948 to August 1951. But that revelation brought up another question: Why only three years? I went back through the brittle and yellowing letters in the file box, looking for anything that might explain the brevity of my grandfathers spying career. I wouldnt need much; I have a fertile imagination.

title: Ex-Minister Fires Back After Ouster in France
description: PARIS  Arnaud Montebourg, ousted this week as President Franois Hollandes economy minister after bucking the French governments line on austerity, warned on Wednesday that Europe was headed for serious economic problems unless officials overcame an obsession with budget deficits and began tackling the problems of low growth and high unemployment.

title: Pizza and Parenthood
description: BELGRADE LAKES, Me.  I HAD everything I needed  the sweet sausage, the grilled shrimp, the three kinds of cheese. The dough had been rising since midafternoon. All my spices were lined up, the sauces in the right bowls. Id had a long time to prepare. You could say Id been getting ready to make this pizza for 20 years.

title: Holiday on Monday: Labor Day

title: Dethrone King Dollar
description: WASHINGTON  THERE are few truisms about the world economy, but for decades, one has been the role of the United States dollar as the worlds reserve currency. Its a core principle of American economic policy. After all, who wouldnt want their currency to be the one that foreign banks and governments want to hold in reserve?

title: The Poisoning of Africas Vultures
description: NAIROBI, Kenya  IN July of last year, roughly 500 vultures died after they ate the pesticide-laced carcass of an elephant that had been killed by poachers in Namibia. It was an example of one poaching technique in Africa that seems to be on the rise: the poisoning of vultures so that authorities wont be alerted to the location of the crime.

title: Holding Bankers Accountable
Proposing New Capital Is Old Idea in Argentina
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Belmopan, Belize. Astana, Kazakhstan. Braslia, Brazil. Naypyidaw, Myanmar. Abuja, Nigeria. And now, Santiago del Estero, Argentina?

title: Powerhouse on the Field Looks to Have a Similar Presence on TV
description: CHARLOTTE, N.C.  There are no bronze statues of Bear Bryant or Bo Jackson to advertise the presence of the SEC Network in a suburban office park here.

title: Lawmakers Ask Boehner for Vote on Iraq
Plugged-In Over Preppy: Teenagers Favor Tech Over Clothes
description: For some teenagers, wearing last seasons jeans will always be unthinkable.

title: From a Compound in the Brazilian Hills, Excellence in Math Emerges
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  Until a few weeks ago, few Brazilians had even heard of the National Institute for Pure and Applied Mathematics, much less followed the rarefied concepts being studied within.

title: The Crazy Quilt of Fall
description: A recent post on Pinterest highlights the image of a lanky young woman celebrating the Burning Man festival dressed in a spangled bandeau top and shorts. Her zany striped hose are yanked up past her knees; a collection of hand-tooled silver bracelets snakes up both arms, and the turbanlike affair coiled around her head is fringed in a mass of cornrow braids.

title: 9 Mexicans Can Return to Contest Deportations
description: LOS ANGELES  Nine Mexican immigrants who agreed to be deported from the United States during the last five years will be allowed to return to fight their expulsions under an agreement announced Wednesday that could also include other Mexicans who consented to leave.

title: A Parting of the Ways at Visionaire
description: Among those toying with the boundaries of fashion and art during the last 20 years, few stand out more than Stephen Gan, Cecilia Dean and James Kaliardos. Roughly three times a year they released editions of Visionaire, a publication that was neither fashion magazine nor art object but something in between.

title: For Vuitton, More Than Window Dressing
description: It didnt take long for the Saks Fifth Avenue president, Marigay McKee, to find Michael Burke at the conclusion of Nicolas Ghesquires first runway show for Louis Vuitton. According to Mr. Burke, Louis Vuittons chief executive, it took all of a few seconds for her to spring from her seat and begin the full-court press.

title: Black Ex-Police Chief Picked for Top Enforcement Post in Missouri
description: BERKELEY, Mo.  Gov. Jay Nixon on Wednesday nominated a former St. Louis police chief to become the states top law enforcement official  and the only African-American in his cabinet  in the wake of racially charged unrest in nearby Ferguson.

title: Whats The Matter With France?
description: Update: I wanted to add one more chart, showing real GDP growth since early 2008:

title: The Carefully Scripted Red-Carpet Look of Lena Dunham
description: Sometimes, a woman puts on a dress in the hope of looking pretty. Other times, her agenda is more squarely focused on getting people talking. When it comes to certain celebrities and their much-plotted red-carpet turns, it can be difficult to surmise exactly what they are thinking.

title: Is Everyone a Little Bit Racist?
description: Lets start with what we dont know: the precise circumstances under which a white police officer in Ferguson, Mo., shot dead an unarmed black teenager named Michael Brown.

title: A Better Deal for Franchisees and Workers
description: Fast-food workers, who have been striking regularly for higher pay and an unimpeded right to unionize, are not the only people fed up with powerful corporate bosses.

title: Iowa: Guilty Plea in Campaign Allegiance Deal
description: A former Iowa state senator pleaded guilty on Wednesday to receiving and concealing payments in exchange for switching his support from one presidential candidate to another in the 2012 election, the Justice Department said. Kent Sorenson of Milo resigned from the Iowa Senate last year after an inquiry found that he had probably violated ethics rules by taking money from presidential campaigns. Mr. Sorenson, 42, had been the state chairman for the presidential campaign of Representative Michele Bachmann, Republican of Minnesota, but switched his support to former Representative Ron Paul of Texas days before the states caucus. In his plea agreement, Mr. Sorenson admitted that he had agreed to switch his allegiance in exchange for $73,000.

title: Military Skill and Terrorist Technique Fuel Success of ISIS
description: BAGHDAD  As fighters for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria continue to seize territory, the group has quietly built an effective management structure of mostly middle-aged Iraqis overseeing departments of finance, arms, local governance, military operations and recruitment.

title: Young Americans Carry Burden of Expectation at U.S. Open
description: On Tuesday evening, Jared Donaldson entered a mostly empty interview room after a matter-of-fact, straight-sets loss at the United States Open to Gal Monfils of France.

title: Timothy Wu for Lieutenant Governor
description: The office of lieutenant governor in New York is a feeble one. The current occupant  Robert Duffy, a former mayor of Rochester  was handpicked by Gov. Andrew Cuomo in 2010 and spent the last four years promoting the governors agenda around the state. In May, Mr. Duffy decided he had had enough of traveling in the governors shadow, and is not seeking re-election.

title: Skirmishes Put Feeling of Wartime on India-Pakistan Border
description: JORA FARM, India  The habits of wartime have crept back into life here along the border between India and Pakistan.

title: Questions on Airstrikes in Syria
description: With American airstrikes slowing the march of extremists in Iraq, President Obama is considering expanding that action across the Iraqi border into parts of Syria, where fighters for the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, or ISIS, move unimpeded. But there are too many unanswered questions to make that decision now and there has been far too little public discussion for Mr. Obama to expect Americans to rally behind what could be another costly military commitment.

title: Police Shooting Kills Crew Member Working for TV Show Cops
description: OMAHA  The Omaha police chief said Wednesday that the fatal shooting of a crew member filming the television show Cops by one of his officers was an unfortunate incident and that it appeared that the three officers involved had acted professionally.

title: Ex-Police Officer Pleads Guilty to Playing Role in a Disability Fraud Scheme
description: A former New York City police officer accused of playing a major role in a scheme to defraud the Social Security Administration pleaded guilty on Wednesday and agreed to testify against his co-defendants.

title: Curls Get Their Groove Back
description: When Claire Mazur married this summer, she did her own hair. Everyone seemed really surprised, but nobody else can be trusted with styling my curly hair, she said.

title: From the Earth to Your Mouth
description: Dirt dont hurt.

title: Iran Altering Reactor in Bid for Nuclear Deal
description: Atomic power engineers in Iran have started redesigning a partly constructed reactor in the northwest city of Arak to limit the amount of plutonium it produces, the countrys top nuclear official said Wednesday, expressing hope that the change would help alleviate Western objections that the plutonium could be used in weapons.

title: Aching for Change in an Unequal Sport
description: After deciding on Wednesday to write about why men at the United States Open play best-of-five-set matches while women here and at other Grand Slam events play best of three, I ran to see the end of the match between Ivan Dodig of Croatia and Feliciano Lpez of Spain. The two were just starting their fifth set.

title: Student-Built Apps Teach Colleges a Thing or Two
description: Vaibhav Verma was frustrated that he could not get into the most popular courses at Rutgers University, so he decided to try a new approach.

title: Committee on Shut Lanes Subpoenas Cellphone Records of a Top Christie Aide
description: The New Jersey legislative committee investigating the mysterious closing of access lanes to the George Washington Bridge last September has subpoenaed a cellphone carrier in an effort to uncover text messages exchanged by Gov. Chris Christie and a top aide as the governors administration sought to contain the fallout from the ensuing scandal.

title: Ferguson Reveals a Twitter Loop
description: It was the best of Twitter. It was the worst of Twitter.

title: Lena Dunhams Red-Carpet Choices
description: Her choices can be feminine and pretty, and a tad unusual.

title: A Prodigy Calmly Jolts Her Sport
description: When CiCi Bellis was 9, which was only six years ago, a Bay Area tennis coach named Michael Jessup took the court with her for the first time. He smacked a ball her way to start the warm-up. She fired it back. The rally lasted 10 minutes, as Jessup remembered Wednesday, something he had never experienced with a junior player.

title: In Israels South, Families Worry About the Future of Life Near Gaza
description: KIBBUTZ NAHAL OZ, Israel  Towering concrete walls surround the kindergarten in this rural Israeli community next to the border with Gaza, blocking out the light. The fortresslike panels went up a few days ago as protection against deadly shrapnel from the Palestinian mortar rounds that have crashed down here in recent weeks with a terrifying intensity.

title: Winning Lottery Numbers for Aug. 27, 2014
Helen Bamber, Therapist to Torture Victims, Dies at 89
description: Helen Bamber, whose volunteering to comfort broken survivors of a Nazi concentration camp when she was 19 inspired her to devote her next seven decades to helping more than 50,000 victims of torture in 90 countries, died on Aug. 21 in London. She was 89.

title: Russia: 3 McDonalds Shut for 90 Days
description: Russian courts ordered three McDonalds restaurants in Moscow shuttered for the maximum period of 90 days over sanitary code violations, Russian news agencies reported, including one facing the Kremlin walls. The rulings confirmed an earlier temporary closing ordered by the countrys food safety organization. McDonalds issued a statement vowing to fight the court orders and to reopen all six restaurants it said had been closed nationwide. The closings and a rash of inspections of the chain across Russia, where it has more than 400 restaurants, are widely seen as retribution for McDonalds shutting its three restaurants in Crimea after the peninsula was annexed by Russia in March. Government officials deny any such link.

title: David Chase Says Remarks About Sopranos Finale Were Misconstrued
description: Updated, 10:27 p.m. | If you have your own personal interpretation of the famously ambiguous ending of The Sopranos, or would simply prefer not to have any particular conclusion affixed to that influential HBO crime drama, which ended in 2007, the lesson here is: Dont stop believing.

title: Tsonga, Forceful in Play and in Personality, Hopes to Extend Strong Run at U.S. Open
description: Jo-Wilfried Tsonga remains delighted to have beaten four members of the top 10 to win the Rogers Cup in Toronto this month.

title: Immigration Clash Could Lead to Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  As President Obama nears a decision on taking broad executive action to reshape the nations immigration system, Republicans are threatening to force a confrontation over what they describe as a power grab by refusing to finance some or all of the moves.

title: How Rain Falls
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  Thank goodness for gravity or wed be mighty confused about the theme to todays puzzle.

title: Fashion Trends to Court This Fall
description: Noteworthy trends that emerged from the fall shows and how to translate them from the runway to your wardrobe.

title: Inside U.S. Hostage Policy
description: A look at some very rare exceptions in the United Statess otherwise strict policy of never negotiating with hostage-takers.

title: Unflattering Portrait of Virginias Former First Lady Is Offered by Her Lawyers
description: RICHMOND, Va.  Lawyers defending Maureen McDonnell at her and her husbands corruption trial presented a portrait of the former first lady of Virginia that was embarrassing and at times even humiliating.

title: With Montreal a Distant Memory, the Nationals Expect Big Things
description: PHILADELPHIA  Ian Desmonds first professional team was the Gulf Coast League Expos, in 2004. He also played for the Vermont Expos that summer. He still has some caps and sweatshirts with the swirly Montreal logo, and he remembers the uncertainty surrounding the organization that drafted him that June.

title: For Up-Close View of CiCi Bellis, Just Be Patient
description: Want to jump on the CiCi Bellis bandwagon? Bring sunscreen, be patient and learn how to pronounce Pavlyuchenkova.

title: Eight in Adoption Abuse Case Agree to $17.5 Million Settlement With Foster Agencies
description: Eight young adults with disabilities who were fraudulently adopted by a Queens woman and subjected to years of abuse have agreed to a $17.5 million settlement of their lawsuit against three private New York foster care agencies that had placed them with the woman, a new court filing shows.

title: Scaffolding Comes Down in East Harlem After 4 Years
description: More than a year after participating in a mayoral candidates sleepover at an East Harlem public housing community, Mayor Bill de Blasio returned on Wednesday to the Lincoln Houses to announce that a longstanding eyesore  thousands of feet of construction scaffolding without the construction  would finally be removed by this weekend.

title: Elizabeth M. Fowler, Financial Reporter for The Times, Dies at 95
description: Elizabeth M. Fowler, an author and financial reporter for The New York Times who was one of the first women to cover the Wall Street beat for a daily newspaper, died on Aug. 11 at her home in Chatham, N.J. She was 95.

title: Little League Win Lifts District Marred by Violence
description: CHICAGO  People showed up and plopped down lawn chairs, sitting there just so they could feel like a part of the event, even if they could not see anything. The neighborhoods residents were glad for their team, for their boys and for themselves. They brought cakes. They rode bikes. They hugged.

title: Yankees Nine Straight Hits Off Price Add Up to One Big Victory
description: DETROIT  Nine batters kept going around and around the bases, 90 feet at a time for the most part, dropping in hits against one of the best pitchers in baseball.

title: Seeking Answers in Utah Shooting
description: SALT LAKE CITY  Family and friends of a 20-year-old white Utah man fatally shot by the Salt Lake City police say they will continue to hold protests outside state and federal government offices until the authorities answer questions about the shooting.

title: Barge Burns On Hutchinson River
New York Comptroller Is Concerned Over Pre-K Contract Delays
description: A week before the start of the school year, more than 300 New York City contracts with organizations that will be teaching prekindergarten classes have not been delivered by the city to the comptrollers office for required vetting.

title: Workers Win Supermarket Presidents Job Back
description: After the intervention of two governors and an enormous public outcry, the chaos that has paralyzed the Market Basket supermarket chain ended Wednesday night with a deal between the two warring factions of the Demoulas family, the company said in a statement.

title: A Former French Fashion Models Glamorous Career in Pictures
description: In this weekly series, Ts photo editors share the most compelling visual projects theyve discovered.

title: Finally Getting Help
description: Terri Hall talks about her struggles with depression, and the care she has been receiving since she signed up for health insurance.

title: An Overwhelming Workload
description: Erin Riedel, a therapist at Seven Counties Services, talks about the influx of new mental health patients since the Affordable Care Act went into effect.

title: Word of the Day | opulence
description: opulence \-py-ln(t)s\ noun

title: Patchwork Lineup Fizzles as Mets Fall to Braves
description: Travis dArnaud, the Mets young catcher, had come on recently. His confidence was up, and his 12 homers were tied for the most among National League rookies. But just two months ago, he had been working out his swing in the minor leagues.

title: Medal of Honor for a Civil War Hero 150 Years in the Grave
description: WASHINGTON  He went off to fight, telling a cousin that I may never return but I will gain a name in this war. First Lt. Alonzo H. Cushing proved right on both counts. He did not return, and now, after an epic delay notable even in a town famed for taking its time, his name will at long last be honored at the White House.

title: Expansion of Mental Health Care Hits Obstacles
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.  Terri Halls anxiety was back, making her hands shake as she tried to light a cigarette on the stoop of her faded apartment building. She had no appetite, and her mind galloped as she grasped for an answer to her latest setback.

title: Corrections: August 28, 2014
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Quotation of the Day for Thursday, August 28, 2014
description: There was some resistance to awarding a Union soldier the congressional medal at Gettysburg even 150 years after the fact. They didnt want us refighting the Civil War all over again. Its still sensitive.

title: Sitting Back, an Underdog Quickly Falls Behind
description: Jana Cepelova has essentially perfected one type of deep groundstroke: hard and flat.

title: Heroins Death Toll Rising in New York, Amid a Shift in Who Uses It
description: A heroin crisis gripping communities across the country deepened in New York last year, with more people in the city dying in overdoses from the drug than in any year since 2003.

title: Whats on TV Thursday
description: 7:20 P.M. (Showtime) SILVER LININGS PLAYBOOK (2012) Pat Solatano (Bradley Cooper) has returned to the home of his parents (Jacki Weaver and Robert De Niro) after eight months in a mental institution in this film from David O. Russell. Pat wants to tackle the world and reclaim his estranged wife, Nikki, who took out a restraining order against him, through a physical and psychological regimen he created while locked away. Then he meets Tiffany (Jennifer Lawrence, above with Mr. Cooper), a heartbreaker who persuades him that she can circumvent the law by passing a letter from him to Nikki, if only hell enter a dance contest with her. Soon, she is leading, and he is following. For all its high-flying zaniness, the movie has the sting of life, and its humor feels dredged up from the same dark, boggy place from which Samuel Beckett extracted his yuks, Manohla Dargis wrote in The New York Times about this best picture Oscar nominee, which also earned nominations for Mr. Cooper, Ms. Weaver and Mr. De Niro, and a win for Ms. Lawrence. These are characters who get in one anothers faces and occasionally punch a loved one right in the kisser. They must go on, they cant go on, but together they do.

title: Stephon Marbury the Musical: A Tale of Making It in Beijing
description: Stephon Marburys turbulent decade in the N.B.A. was marked by public feuds and lackluster teams, but in recent years he has found a better basketball life in China, where he has led the Beijing Ducks to two national championships.

title: Media Tycoon Critical of China Is Visited by Hong Kong Antigraft Agency
description: HONG KONG  Officers from the anticorruption agency in Hong Kong searched the home of the media tycoon Jimmy Lai on Thursday morning, a month after leaked documents suggested that he had made substantial donations to local pro-democracy parties and politicians.

title: Student Crossword | Paleontology
description: Test your knowledge of paleontology by playing our crossword (PDF). You can find the answers here.

title: Optimism Is Renewed In Search For Jetliner
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Officials expressed new optimism on Thursday that data from an attempt to contact the Malaysia Airlines flight that disappeared in the Indian Ocean could lead to the planes discovery.

title: Vivendi in Talks With Telefnica for Brazil Unit as It Looks to Exit Telecom
description: Updated, 7:55 p.m. | The French conglomerate Vivendi is saying goodbye to the telecom sector.

title: 6 Qs About the News | Seeing Double, Acting Singularly
description: In Holding a Mirror to Their Natures, David Levine writes about recent scientific research of the personality traits of unrelated look-alikes.

title: $2.4 Billion Invested in Chinese Bad-Debt Company
description: HONG KONG  Chinas biggest manager of bad debt said on Thursday that it had attracted about $2.4 billion from eight investors, including Goldman Sachs and Warburg Pincus, before an expected initial public offering here.

title: Photographs That Make a Difference
description: As a philosopher-turned-photographer, Bob Adelman forged a career committed to both social action and aesthetics. When he was not documenting the civil rights movement in the North, he was hanging out with  and taking pictures of  artists like Andy Warhol and Larry Rivers.

title: Why a New Nail Polish Cannot Gloss Over Rape Culture
description: Undercover Colors is a brand of nail polish developed by four recent graduates of North Carolina State Universitys materials science and engineering program. The special lacquer changes color when exposed to common date-rape drugs  a womanneed only casually dip a painted finger in her drink to know if its been tampered with.

title: Swiss Bank Lombard Odier Reveals Results for First Time
description: LONDON  The private bank Lombard Odier unveiled its financial results publicly for the first time in its 218-year history on Thursday, reporting a profit and becoming the latest Swiss financial institution to pull back the curtain on what has been a traditionally secretive banking culture.

title: Violence at Chinese High School Raises Questions About Mandatory Military Training
description: Updated, 4:48 a.m. ET| While American high school freshmen are busy stocking up on backpacks and binders to prepare for the new school year, their Chinese counterparts are in the midst of a very different sort of back-to-school ritual: mandatory military training.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Welcome to the Morning Briefing on NYT Now.

title: New York Today: Carnival Countdown
description: Good morning on this fair Thursday.

title: Audit Blames New York State Program for Delays in Affordable-Housing Projects
description: A New York State program that helps finance affordable housing has contributed to delays in building and rehabilitating homes because of the questionable selection and lax monitoring of construction projects, an audit has found.

title: The Other Big Mac Index
description: The first time I stood in line to enter Moscows first McDonalds  then the largest McDonalds in the world  was in the spring of 1991. The country was still called the Soviet Union, and that McDonalds on Pushkin Square, though it had been open for a year, was still a unique place in several ways: It was a public space where ordinary people could have a private conversation while eating food they could afford, sold to them by polite staff. The few other existing cafes and restaurants in the city offered either an exorbitantly priced experience or a humiliating one.

title: Ebola Could Strike 20,000, World Health Agency Says
description: GENEVA  The World Health Organization said on Thursday that the Ebola epidemic was still accelerating and could afflict more than 20,000 people  almost seven times the current number of reported cases  before it could be brought under control.

title: Daily Report: JPMorgan and Other U.S. Banks Are Hit by Hackers
description: A number of United States banks, including JPMorgan Chase and at least four others, were struck by hackers in a series of coordinated attacks this month, according to four people briefed on a continuing investigation into the crimes, Nicole Perlroth reports.

title: Indian Student Said to Have Joined ISIS Is Reported Dead
description: MUMBAI, India  An Indian engineering student who suddenly left for Iraq with three friends this spring, and who was believed to have joined the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, has been reported dead, a man whose nephew was part of the group said Thursday.

title: Thai Court Dismisses Murder Case Against Ex-Leaders
description: BANGKOK  A criminal court in Bangkok on Thursday dismissed a murder case against a former prime minister and his deputy, a highly contentious decision likely to rekindle political animosity in military-ruled Thailand.

title: Should I Buy an Extended Warranty?
description: Most people give a fair amount of thought to buying an appliance or an electronic device. But a warranty for them gets barely any consideration.

title: Ukraine Leader Says Huge Loads of Arms Pour in From Russia
description: MOSCOW  Supported by NATO satellite imagery showing Russian forces on the move in eastern Ukraine, its president accused Russia on Thursday of an invasion to aid the separatists, and his national security council ordered mandatory conscription to help counter what he called an extremely difficult threat.

title: The Fine Art of Giving Gifts in China
description: I approach the world with gratitude, and I am thankful for my many blessings. I share that with you so that you will not think too poorly of me when I tell you that I really dont care for most gifts that people give me.

title: Deutsche Bank Fined $7.8 Million Over Faulty Reports on Swaps
description: LONDON  A British regulator fined the German lender Deutsche Bank 4.7 million pounds, or about $7.8 million, on Thursday for having failed to properly report certain swaps transactions over a period of almost six years.

title: 1939: France Imposes Censorship
description: PARIS  With Adolf Hitler greatly aggravating the crisis by raising his demands on Poland to include the Corridor as well as Danzig, France yesterday glided into a regime of war. A government censorship over the press, radio and cinema was set up. The eminent French dramatist, Jean Giraudoux, who was recently appointed French propaganda chief, was placed as the head of the censors bureau, which is being established at the Hotel Continental, near the Place Vendme.  New York Herald Tribune, European Edition, Aug. 29, 1939

title: Morning Agenda: Hackers Hit U.S. Banks
description: A number of United States banks, including JPMorgan Chase and at least four others, were struck by hackers in a series of coordinated attacks this month, according to four people briefed on a continuing investigation into the crimes, Nicole Perlroth writes in The New York Times. The hackers infiltrated the banks networks, siphoning off gigabytes of data, including checking and savings account information, in what security experts described as a sophisticated cyberattack. The motivation and origin of the attacks are not yet clear, according to investigators.

title: Reader Idea | Get to Know Your Introverts, Extroverts and Ambiverts
description: All this week, we are featuring Great Ideas From Readers, lesson plans from teachers who teach with The Times.

title: Winged Warning: Heavy Metal Song Distortion
description: Im catching up with Winged Warnings, a remarkable online series on birds as sentinels for (and victims of) environmental problems, which is unfolding over at Environmental Health News. The series launched in recent days with an introductory overview, a piece on how ospreys have recovered from the DDT era but face new ills, and a report on troubles with puffins and other northern seabirds facing disrupted food webs and a changing climate. Heres a video summary:

title: Modesty Is Rewarded
description: Dear Diary:

title: Parasites Practicing Mind Control
description: An unassuming single-celled organism called Toxoplasma gondii is one of the most successful parasites on Earth, infecting an estimated 11 percent of Americans and perhaps half of all people worldwide. Its just as prevalent in many other species of mammals and birds. In a recent study in Ohio, scientists found the parasite in three-quarters of the white-tailed deer they studied.

title: When the Ice Bucket Challenge Becomes a Promotional Moment
description: The surprise story of the silly season, a.k.a. August, has been the Ice Bucket Challenge and the many fabulous people allowing themselves to be doused in freezing water for a good cause  and for the amusement of their many online followers and the public. I wont list them all because, at this stage, you probably know who most of them are.

title: Daily Clip Report
description: Daily Clip Report is a collection of articles about The Times and the media sent by email each morning to senior executives and newsroom editors. The email is produced by the Corporate Communications Department at The Times.

title: A Practical Avant-Garde Timepiece for Drivers
description: In this weekly series, the mens fashion editors of T invite creative personalities to put their own aesthetic spin on a new watch. Here, the illustrator Christopher David Ryan captures a timepiece from Vacheron Constantin.

title: Many Addresses Before Making Bed-Stuy Home
description: With the move this summer of New Yorks first family from Park Slope to the Upper East Side, City Room is taking a look at the migration of New Yorkers from one neighborhood to another. Odehyah Gough-Israel shared her story; tell us yours here.

title: Two Senators Willing to Defy the Party Line
description: Who are the two most disagreeable United States senators?

title: Throwback Thursday | Life Made Easier in 1967
description: The much-pampered housewife is faced with a selection of household and personal care aids that will, manufacturers hope, spur her to tone up her facial muscles, serve wines at appropriate temperatures and keep her floors shining and carpets shampooed with a battery of machines designed to make all previous models obsolete, wrote The Times on Aug. 28, 1967.

title: 1914: India to Send Men to France
description: LONDON  Lord Kitchener made the following announcement in the House of Lords yesterday [Aug. 28]: In addition to the reinforcements that will shortly proceed from this country, the Government has decided that our army in France shall be increased, besides, by other troops from India. The Marquis of Crewe, as Secretary of State for India, said: We shall find our army on the Continent reinforced by soldiers of first-rate training, and representing an ancient civilization, and we feel certain that if they are called upon, they will give the best possible account of themselves side by side with British troops in encountering the enemy. (Cheers.)  The New York Herald, European Edition, Aug. 29, 1914

title: Hong Kong Told to Strive for a Less Perfect Democracy
description: HONG KONG  On the eve of a decision by Beijing on rules for elections in Hong Kong, a top Chinese scholar presented a series of justifications on Thursday for why the territorys more than seven million people should temper demands for Western-style democracy, insisting that a less perfect version of democracy is better than none at all.

title: The Delayed: To Sit or Not to Sit?
description: Excuse me. Would you mind not stomping on my feet during your late entrance, or squawking complaints during your early exit? Fresh bait awaits the rude in the coming fall entertainment season, which brims with scores of new plays, concerts, operas and movies. Or is it rude to label rude the people who simply value (their) time over (our) money? Here, we examine a certain kind of audience behavior, with the full knowledge that we may be among the guilty.

title: Young, Fearless and Not Into Dragons
description: Ruby Rae Spiegels earliest stab at playwriting makes her cringe in the recollection. It was a modern-day Peter Pan, with Wendy sending instant messages. But give a girl a break: Ms. Spiegel was only in seventh grade when she wrote it, and she had a classic motive. She wanted to cast a boy she liked as Peter.

title: Rick Perlstein: By the Book
description: The author, most recently, of The Invisible Bridge, would like Chekhov to write his life story. Sometimes I think he knows me better than I know myself, even when hes ostensibly writing about Russian ladies over a hundred years ago.

title: Ukraines Prime Minister Asks for Help
description: Prime Minister Arseniy P. Yatseniuk of Ukraine urges the international community to freeze Russian assets, saying that Russian troops are on Ukrainian soil.

title: Film Festivals Scramble for First Dibs
description: For normal people, Labor Day weekend represents the last breath of summer, a pleasant island of leisure and shopping on the journey back to work, school and other autumnal responsibilities. But for citizens of Movieland  a fractious, mobile and multifarious population that includes publicists and producers, celebrity profilers and the celebrities they profile, bloggers, soothsayers and critics of every temperament and medium  it is the opposite of a holiday. The start of September means the onset of Fall Festival Season, which is the first leg in the Oscar race. So here we go.

title: The Dissatisfied: To Leave or Not to Leave?
description: Excuse me. Would you mind not stomping on my feet during your late entrance, or squawking complaints during your early exit? Fresh bait awaits the rude in the coming fall entertainment season, which brims with scores of new plays, concerts, operas and movies. Or is it rude to label rude the people who simply value (their) time over (our) money? Here, we examine a certain kind of audience behavior, with the full knowledge that we may be among the guilty.

title: Resurgence in Oil and Gas Sector Spurs Merger Boom
description: The merger boom in the energy sector shows no signs of slowing.

title: Dont Just Pay for Chores. Pay for Performance.
description: Tis the season of chore-time slackerdom.

title: Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt Married in France
description: They are two of Americas celebrated and scrutinized movie stars, known for their enviable physiques, their rsums of hit movies, their creatively named children and the barrage of media attention that follows them. And now, Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt are husband and wife.

title: A Modern Heroine Returns to Center Stage
description: LONDON  The world of suffering opera heroines can be divided into a few discrete categories. There are the downtrodden lovelorn women, such as Violetta and Mim; the bold but doomed leaders, like Carmen and Norma; and the vociferous helpmeets, like Brnnhilde and Isolde, belting out heavy lyrics as the world about them lies in ruin.

title: The Abortion Ship
description: Rebecca Gomperts is a Dutch doctor who pushes the limits of abortion law. In this excerpt from Diana Whittens documentary Vessel, Gomperts creates a mobile clinic aboard a ship.

title: The Dawn of the Post-Clinic Abortion
description: In June 2001, under a cloud-streaked sky, Rebecca Gomperts set out from the Dutch port of Scheveningen in a rented 110-foot ship bound for Ireland. Lashed to the deck was a shipping container, freshly painted light blue and stocked with packets of mifepristone (which used to be called RU-486) and misoprostol. The pills are given to women in the first trimester to induce a miscarriage. Medical abortion, as this procedure is called, had recently become available in the Netherlands. But use of misoprostol and mifepristone to end a pregnancy was illegal in Ireland, where abortion by any means remains against the law, with few exceptions.

title: Under Cover: Opening Up the Abortion by Mail Cover
description: To illustrate Emily Bazelons cover story about activists working to give women access to abortions at home, we knew that we wanted to show a package of pills received by mail. As Jake Silverstein, the magazines editor in chief, noted, what was new about Bazelons article was not that women could use pills to have an abortion, but that women who would otherwise be denied access to an abortion could get those pills through the mail.

title: Convenient to Classes and Clean Socks
description: Just after her graduation from Vassar College, Eliza Hartley moved into a postwar high-rise on East 91st Street and First Avenue, a quick subway trip from her job as a research study assistant at a hospital.

title: With $30 Million More in Hand, IFTTT Looks to the Internet of Things
description: One ambitious start-up wants to reroute the plumbing of the consumer Internet. Now it has the money to try to make it happen.

title: An Inspiring Fashion Collective Springs From Perus Prison System
description: Two years ago, the French-born, Peru-based textile specialist Thomas Jacob accompanied a friend on a trip to the San Jorge prison in Lima. I was struck by the dignity of the inmates, the 27-year-old recalls. They didnt have a mind for pain, they just accepted their fate with sobriety and humility. He located two similar correctional facilities near the countrys capital  Santa Monica in Chorrillos and San Pedro in Lurigancho  and established a system that would enable the inmates at each to work together making clothes. The nascent fashion collective took its name, Project Piet, from a masterpiece by Michelangelo.

title: David Lynch, Who Began as a Visual Artist, Gets a Museum Show
description: LOS ANGELES  David Lynchs rooftop painting studio, perched high in the Hollywood Hills, is littered with the byproduct of work. Paintings with crude, childlike figures doing menacing things lean up against the walls, unfinished drawings are strewn over his huge desk, and the floor is carpeted with cigarette butts. While the dark visual sensibility of his film work  Eraserhead (1977), The Elephant Man (1980), Blue Velvet (1986), Wild at Heart (1990), Mulholland Drive (2001), and his TV series Twin Peaks (1990-91)  has permeated the public consciousness and widely influenced other filmmakers, writers and artists (including Cindy Sherman and Gregory Crewdson), Mr. Lynchs own visual art is almost unknown. Yet painting is where he started, enrolled as an advanced student at the Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts in Philadelphia in 1966 and 67, and it is the medium he continues to work in most actively. His first United States museum retrospective, David Lynch: The Unified Field, opens at the Pennsylvania Academy on Sept. 13.

title: ZZ Top Cancels Shows After Bassist Is Injured
